THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS HBCU ABIC ARE TWOFOLD: (1) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMS, FIRMS, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH INTERESTS IN AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD SYSTEMS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ENTREPRENEURIAL ACADEMY, WHICH WILL OFFER (A) A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATION PROGRAM PROVIDING ENTREPRENEURIAL TRAINING, CONSULTATION, WORKSHOPS, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES AND ACTIVITIES, (B) A "TOURNAMENT OF IDEAS" COMPETITIVE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMS, FIRMS, AND STUDENTS FOR BUSINESS STARTUP, MARKETING, AND FUNDRAISING ASSISTANCE, AND (C) A MODEL FOR SUPERVISED AGRIBUSINESS ENTREPRENEURSHIP BEYOND TRAINING TO INCUBATE BUSINESS IDEAS, AND (2) TO PROVIDE WORKFORCE-ORIENTED ENTREPRENEURIAL TRAINING THROUGH STUDENT EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING PROGRAMS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE ENHANCED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF AGRICULTURAL BUSINESS OWNERS TO PLAN, CREATE, DEVELOP, AND FUND VENTURES. CONTINUOUS TRAINING WITH TWO TRACKS (FARMING ENTERPRISES AND AGRICULTURE/FOOD PRODUCT OR SERVICE ENTERPRISES) WILL BE COLLABORATED WITH USDA FUNDED FOUR REGIONAL RURAL DEVELOPMENT CENTERS AND THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY SOUTH CENTERS ALONG WITH PARTNERING 1890 HBCU LG INSTITUTIONS TO ENSURE THE LONGEVITY OF THE ABIC.

THE GOAL OF THE INTEGRATED RESEARCH AND TEACHING PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE BIOLOGICAL SYSTEMS ENGINEERING (BSE) PROGRAM'S CAPACITY TO ATTRACT, RETAIN AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THIS ABET ACCREDITED PROGRAM IS ONE OF ONLY TWO BSE PROGRAMS AMONG THE 108 HBCUS IN THE US, AND BSE GRADUATES ARE INCREASING THE POOL OF MINORITY AND WOMEN IN KEY FIELDS. THE PROGRAM IS CURRENTLY SEEING HIGH RATES OF ATTRITION AND LOW ENROLLMENT, IN SIGNIFICANT PART DUE TO STUDENT'S LACK OF AWARENESS ABOUT THE OPPURTUNITIES IN THE PROGRAMSPECIFIC PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE A) LEVERAGING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) TECHNOLOGY TO INCREASE INSTRUCTIONAL CAPACITY, STUDENT ENGAGEMENT AND RECRUITMENT IN BSE PROGRAM; AND B) DEVELOPING BSE PROGRAM'S MID-CAREER FACULTY AND STUDENT RESEARCH USING MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHMS TO ANALYZE VULNERABILITY OF REGIONAL ECOSYSTEMS TO A VARIABLE AND CHANGING CLIMATE. THE INTRODUCTION OF AI APPROACHES WILL INCREASE CAPACITY TO DEVELOP MORE SOPHISTICATED SYSTEMS MODELS WHICH WILL PROVIDE MECHANISMS FOR EFFECTIVELY TEACHING STUDENTS ABOUT SYSTEMS THINKING AND APPROACHES.METHODS: THE PROJECT WILL BE DESIGNED AROUND TWO MAJOR ACTIVITIES MAPPED TO PROJECT OBJECTIVES: (1) DEVELOP EIGHT INNOVATIVE TEACHING MODULES AND CURRICULAR MATERIALS THAT CONVEY ABSTRACT CONCEPTS BY MODELS (E.G., COW DIGESTION ANALOGY AND WATER TREATMENT) AND, (2) DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED RESEARCH PROJECT ENGAGING FACULTY, GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS.LEVERAGING AI TECHNOLOGY BASED RESEARCH AND INSTRUCTIONAL INNOVATIONS WILL HELP OVERCOME IDENTIFIED CHALLENGES AND HELP ENABLE BSE TO REACH ITS FULL POTENTIAL. THE POTENTIAL OUTPUTS ARE 10 PUBLICATIONS, 10 STUDENTS TRAINED IN RESEARCH, 8 TEACHING AND RECRUITMENT MODULES. OUTCOMES: REACH OVER 5000 STAKEHOLDERS.

HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM IS ONE OF THE FASTEST-GROWING INDUSTRIES IN THE WORLD. GLOBALLY, THE HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY IS DEMANDING PROFESSIONALLY QUALIFIED GRADUATES FOR THE RESURGENCE OF ALL ITS SECTORS. THE DIFFERENT HOSPITALITY SECTORS INCLUDE FOOD AND BEVERAGE (RESTAURANTS), TRAVEL AND TRANSPORTATION, TOURISM, MEETING AND EVENT PLANNING, SPAS, ATTRACTIONS, GAMING, ENTERTAINMENT, AND RECREATION. INDUSTRY LEADERS ARE LOOKING FOR GRADUATES WITH DEGREES IN HOSPITALITY TO BE PREPARED FOR THE WORKPLACE BY BEING EDUCATED AND WELL TRAINED IN CURRENT INDUSTRY TECHNOLOGY (SCHOFFSTALL, 2013). THE NEW HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM PROGRAM AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS AT PINE BLUFF (UAPB) IS PROPOSING TO PREPARE ITS GRADUATES FOR THE FACE-PACED, DYNAMIC SECTORS OF THE INDUSTRY. THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE SECTOR'S NEEDS BY PROVIDING GRADUATES WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING VITAL FOR SUCCESS IN THE HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY USING TECHNOLOGY BY ESTABLISHING A HOSPITALITY TECHNOLOGY CLASSROOM/LABORATORY. THIS CLASSROOM LABORATORY WILL CONSIST OF THE LATEST COMPUTER PROGRAMS FOR STUDENTS TO LEARN THROUGH ASSIMILATION OF VARIOUS HOSPITALITY FUNCTIONS SUCH AS RESTAURANT OPERATION AND MANAGEMENT, GUEST SERVICES CHECK-IN AND OUT, MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING, CATERING CONTRACTS, AND SALES MARKETING. THE STUDENTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN PRACTICAL SKILLS AND MANAGEMENT SKILLS AND LEARN THE SOFT SKILLS THE INDUSTRY HAS STATED THEY DESPERATELY NEED.UAPB COMPLETED RESEARCH AND REALIZED THE INDUSTRY NEEDS FROM A GLOBAL POINT OF VIEW TO ITS LOCAL GROWTH IN HOSPITALITY OPPORTUNITIES IN THE CITY OF PINE BLUFF, REGIONALLY, AND THROUGHOUT THE STATE. AS A RESULT OF THE RESEARCH, UAPB ESTABLISHED A NEW BACHELOR OF SCIENCE DEGREE PROGRAM IN HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM MANAGEMENT (HTM) IN THE FALL OF 2020. THE PROGRAM'S ESTABLISHMENT IS A DIRECT RESPONSE TO THE LOCAL NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. SARACEN CASINO RESORT OPENED IN PINE BLUFF IN OCTOBER 2020. THE FACILITY LOCATED JUST 5 MILES FROM UAPB HASCOMPLETED PHASE I, INCLUDING A FINE DINING RESTAURANT, SPORTS BAR, CASUAL RESTAURANT, CRAFT BEER BREWERY AND BAR, A FULL-SERVICE BUFFET, AND A FOOD COURT THAT INCLUDES THE OPERATION OF A LOCALLY GROWN PRODUCT. THE SECOND PHASE OF THE RESORT WILL CONSIST OF A HOTEL AND SPA. WITH SUCH A MASSIVE HOSPITALITY OPERATION CLOSE TO THE UNIVERSITY, STUDENTS AND GRADUATES FROM THE NEW HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM PROGRAM HAVE AN EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO SMOOTH TRANSITION FROM THE CLASSROOM TO A PROFESSIONAL WORKPLACE LOCALLY. ALSO, THIS PROGRAM COULD QUICKLY EXPAND THROUGHOUT THE SOUTHEAST REGION OF THE STATE DUE TO MANY OUTDOOR TOURISM SITES. OTHER STATE AREAS SEEKING WELL-PREPARED HOSPITALITY MANAGEMENT GRADUATES INCLUDE THE RECENTLY EXPANDED AND UPGRADED OAKLAWN RACING AND CASINO IN HOT SPRINGS, ARKANSAS. OAKLAWN RECENTLY BUILT A NEW BOUTIQUE HOTEL, SPA, AND EVENT CENTER COMPLETED EARLY IN 2021. ALSO, LITTLE ROCK, THE STATE'S CAPITAL, HAS MANY HOTELS, AND A MINOR LEAGUE BASEBALL TEAM AND IS SWIFTLY BECOMING A "FOODIE" LOCATION WITH ITS NEW RESTAURANTS AND BREWERIES ALONG THE REMODELED AND UPGRADED RIVERFRONT. GREAT HOTELS, RESTAURANTS, AND CASINOS WITH GAMING IN WEST MEMPHIS, ARKANSAS, AND GREENVILLE, MISSISSIPPI. THIS PROJECT ALSO SEEKS TO PREPARE STUDENTS NATIONALLY AND INTERNATIONALLY BY OFFERING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE CLASSROOM/LABORATORY TO LEARN, EXPLORE, DESIGN, AND SERVE WORLD CUISINES.PROJECT JUSTIFICATION.PROJECT VALUE. THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE VALUE OF HAVING A CURRENT AND RELEVANT CURRICULUM VALUED BY HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS, STAKEHOLDERS, AND ACCREDITATION AGENCIES. UPGRADING THE CURRICULUM IS VITAL IN BRIDGING THE GAP FOR UAPB STUDENTS TO BE COMPETITIVE LOCALLY, REGIONALLY, NATIONALLY, AND INTERNATIONALLY. STUDENTS GRADUATE FROM COLLEGE BELIEVING THE EDUCATION HAS PREPARED THEM FOR THE WORKPLACE (KAUFMANN, & FELDMAN, 2004). FURTHER, THE ROLE OF HIGHER EDUCATION IS TO PROVIDE GRADUATE EMPLOYABILITY (SATO ET AL., 2021). HOWEVER, HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS REPORT A GAP BETWEEN WHAT STUDENTS HAVE LEARNED AND THEIR ABILITY TO MOVE SWIFTLY INTO MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. REVISING THE CURRENT CURRICULUM WILL ADD VALUE TO THE PROGRAM, INCREASING OPPORTUNITIES FOR GROWTH AND SUSTAINABILITY. ADDITIONAL VALUE OF THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE COMPETITIVENESS REQUIRING AN ELEVATED LEVEL OF TECHNOLOGY. THE HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM INDUSTRY IS INCREASINGLY BECOMING A TECHNOLOGICALLY DRIVEN INDUSTRY REQUIRING COLLEGE GRADUATES TO BE WELL TRAINED, EDUCATED, AND READY TO ENTER THE WORKPLACE (HODGES & LINK, 2019). THE HTM PROGRAM LABORATORY CLASSROOMS NEED COMPUTERS, POINT OF SALE PROGRAMS, RESTAURANT AND PROPERTY MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE, AND CATERING MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE TO IMPROVE TECHNICAL SKILLS.ACCORDING TO BATRA (2016), THE INDUSTRY SEEKS ALL WAYS TO BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN GRADUATES AND QUALIFIED HOSPITALITY WORKERS ACROSS THE ENTIRE INDUSTRY. FURTHER, BILSLAND ET AL. (2020) REPORT THAT POST-COVID -19 ADJUSTMENTS NEED TO ADDRESS INDUSTRY TRAINING MECHANISMS AND WORK-RELATED LEARNING. THUS, GIVEN SOME RECENT PHYSICAL RESTRICTIONS, TECHNOLOGY IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER TO HELP TRAIN STUDENTS BEFORE PHYSICALLY MOVING INTO THE WORKPLACE. IN SUMMARY, GRADUATES NEED TO BE ABLE TO WORK REMOTELY AS WELL AS PHYSICALLY IN THE INDUSTRY. THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE GRANT FUNDS TO CREATE A SUSTAINABLE LABORATORY/CLASSROOM TO INSTRUCT STUDENTS USING THE TECHNOLOGY SOFTWARE IN MULTIPLE CLASSES AND TWO-DEGREE PROGRAMS TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF EDUCATION THROUGH TEACHING AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING. THE PI HAS ASCERTAINED THE MOST RECENT AND HIGHLY REGARDED TECHNOLOGY SYSTEMS FOR HOSPITALITY USED BY COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES. THE TECHNOLOGY SYSTEMS, INCLUDING COMPLEX AND SOFTWARE PACKAGES, WILL BE PURCHASED AND INSTALLED IN A HOSPITALITY LABORATORY/CLASSROOM ALLOWING STUDENTS TO OPERATE DIVERSE FOOD ESTABLISHMENTS SUCH AS A COFFEE SHOP/DELI OR DINNER CAF&EACUTE;. AFTER INSTALLATION, FACULTY WILL BE TRAINED IN THE USE OF TECHNOLOGY. IN TURN, FACULTY WILL THEN USE THE TECHNOLOGY TO INSTRUCT STUDENTS IN THEIR CLASSES.ONGOING AND RECENT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE PROJECT. UAPB RESPONDED TO THE NEEDS OF THE HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY BY CREATING A HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM DEGREE PROGRAM IN 2020. THIS DEGREE PROGRAM IS ALIGNED WITH THE INDUSTRY BOTH LOCALLY AND GLOBALLY. BECAUSE OF ITS EDUCATIONAL MISSION, THE UNIVERSITY HAS CREATED A CURRICULUM TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF THE INDUSTRY WITH THE GOAL TO PREPARE STUDENTS FOR SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. THE PREPARATION INCLUDES THE CORE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES (KSA'S) NECESSARY TO BE COMPETITIVE IN THE MARKET. THIS TEACHING AND EDUCATION PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP STUDENTS AS HUMAN CAPITAL TO MEET THE NEEDS OF VARIED HOSPITALITY, FOOD SERVICE MANAGEMENT, FOOD SAFETY, LODGING, AND TOURISM WORKPLACES. THE RELEVANT ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE IMPROVING EXISTING INSTRUCTION OPPORTUNITIES, PROVIDING EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING, PRACTICE, AND ASSIMILATION IN CLASSROOM LABORATORIES, AND GIVING PRACTICAL EXPERIENCES SERVING FOOD. IN SUMMARY, THE OVERALL VALUE IS TO GIVE STUDENTS AN UPDATED CURRICULUM, MANAGEMENT PRACTICE, LABORATORY EXPERIENCES, AND AN OPPORTUNITY TO UTILIZE THE LATEST INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY AND METHODOLOGIES FOR SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN THE HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM INDUSTRY.

ADVANCES IN AGRICULTURE HAVE REVOLUTIONIZED THE WAY WE EAT AND HOW WE VIEW FOOD IN AMERICA AND ALABAMA. THIS HAS BEEN ADIRECT RESULT OF ADVANCES IN SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND ENGINEERING FOR THE AGRICULTURE INDUSTRY. WHILE AGRICULTURE TOUCHESEVERYONE'S LIFE EVERY DAY, LESS THAN 2% OF OUR POPULATION IS ASSOCIATED WITH OR UNDERSTANDS MODERN FOOD PRODUCTION. DURING THECOVID-19 CRISIS, METROPOLITAN AREAS ACROSS THE NATION HAVE EXPERIENCED AN INCREASED INTEREST IN THEIR FOOD SOURCE AND SECURITY.AS A RESULT, THE TREND FOR INCREASING URBAN AGRICULTURE HAS GAINED MOMENTUM. UNFORTUNATELY, URBAN SCHOOL SYSTEM TEACHERS LACKTHE BACKGROUND AND TRAINING TO PROMOTE, UNDERTAKE, AND SUCCESSFULLY SUSTAIN A SCHOOL GARDEN WHILE SUPPORTING STEM PROGRAMSAND ENCOURAGE URBAN AGRICULTURE. ALABAMA EXTENSION - URBAN AFFAIRS UNITS IS POISED AND READY TO PROVIDE TRAINING FOR TEACHERS.HOWEVER, THE RECENT EVENTS OF COVID-19 HAVE LIMITED FACE-TO-FACE TRAININGS AND AS A RESULT REQUIRED EXTENSION'S METHODS OFPROGRAM DELIVERY TO CHANGE AND PROVIDE MORE EFFECTIVE AND INNOVATIVE REMOTE VIRTUAL TRAINING TO CLIENTELE. THIS PROPOSAL, ENTITLED"URBAN AGRICULTURE VIRTUAL TEACHER TRAINING PROGRAM: STIMULATING AG AWARENESS WITH STEM IN THE GARDENS", WILL EXPAND ANDINCREASE CAPACITY OF THE ALABAMA EXTENSION'S URBAN HOME GROUNDS, GARDENS AND HOME PESTS PROGRAM CONTENT BY DEVELOPINGAND UTILIZING NEW VIRTUAL AND REMOTE TRAINING INNOVATIONS IN OUR TEACHER TRAIN-THE TRAINER PROGRAM SERIES. THE ADDED INNOVATIONSWILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO STEM PROGRAMMING TEACHING METHODS, RESEARCH-BASED APPLIED MODERN AGRICULTURE METHODS AND BESTURBAN AGRICULTURE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (URBAN AG BMPS). THIS PROPOSAL LOOKS AT INTEGRATING THE LATEST NOVEL VIRTUAL AND REMOTETRAINING TECHNOLOGIES FOR TRAINING TEACHERS IN STEM CURRICULUM METHODS THAT PROMOTE THE LATEST URBAN AGRICULTURE METHODS. THISPROPOSAL APPLIES A PROBLEM SOLVING ORIENTED GENERAL LOGIC MODEL AND DEVELOPS A UNIQUE SOLUTION TO EXPAND COMMUNITYKNOWLEDGE AND OPPORTUNITY IN ALABAMA'S GROWING URBAN AGRICULTURE MARKET.

INDUSTRIAL HEMP IS A VERSATILE CROP GROWN FOR ITS NUMEROUS USES. TO MEET THE INCREASING DEMAND, HEMP PRODUCTION NEEDS TO BE INCREASED; HOWEVER, THE CHANGING CLIMATE AND UNSEASONAL HEATWAVES ARE NEGATIVELY IMPACTING HEMP CROP PRODUCTION AND QUALITY. VERY FEW STUDIES HAVE BEEN DONE ON TEMPERATURE IMPACT ON HEMP CROP PRODUCTION. TO DEVELOP CLIMATE RESILIENT GERMPLASM HEMP IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS NEED TO BE FOCUSED ON UNDERSTANDING THE HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS IMPACT. FUNCTIONAL GENOMIC APPROACHES SUCH AS TRANSCRIPTOMICS AND LIPIDOMICS HAVE BEEN USED TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL CANDIDATE GENES AND BIOMARKERS IN OTHER CROPS SUCCESSFULLY AND CAN BE ADOPTED TO HEMP WITH LITTLE RISK AND HIGH POTENTIAL. ADOPTING A NOVEL OMICS APPROACH AND INTEGRATION WILL HELP ELUCIDATE UNKNOWN MECHANISMS AND IDENTIFY THE DESIRED CANDIDATES FOR IMPROVING HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS TOLERANCE IN UNEXPLORED CROPS LIKE HEMP. IN THIS REGARD, THE OVERALL AIM OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS THE IDENTIFIED KNOWLEDGE GAPS IN RESPONSE TO HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS BY RIGOROUS GERMPLASM SCREENING, EXTENSIVE PHENOTYPING OF THE AGRONOMIC TRAITS, AND FUNCTIONAL GENOMIC ANALYSES TO IDENTIFY THE NOVEL CANDIDATE GENES AND BIOMARKERS. THE DEVELOPED RESOURCES WILL BE UTILIZED IN BREEDING PROGRAMS FOR IMPROVING HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS TOLERANCE IN HEMP VARIETIES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO HELP TRAIN FUTURE SCIENTISTS FROM MINORITY AND UNDERSERVED GROUPS.

THE SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND EXTENSION CENTER (SUAREC) PROVIDES AGRICULTURAL TRAINING TO INCARCERATED, ADUDICATED AND HOMELESS YOUTH. THREE SITES ARE IDENTIFIED AND HAVE CAMPUS GARDENS, THRIVE ACADEMY, YOUTH OASIS AND AMI KIDS. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MODIFY THE APPLICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GARDENING PROJECT BY ADDRESSING THE COMPONENTS OF NUTRITION EDUCATION, INTERPERSONAL SOCIAL SKILLS, AND WORK SKILLS TO CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADJUDICATED, INCARCERATED AND HOMELESS YOUTH. OBJECTIVES INCLUDE (1) TO DEVELOP A GARDEN PROGRAM AND THERAPEUTIC HORTICULTURE EXPERIENCE FOR ADJUDICATED AND INCARCERATED YOUTH WITHIN THE CORRECTIONAL FACILITY AND SCHOOL CAMPUS; AND (2) TO PROMOTE HEALTHY LIFESTYLES THROUGH NUTRITION EDUCATION TO ADJUDICATED AND INCARCERATED YOUTH; AND (3) TO PROVIDE ADJUDICATED AND INCARCERATED YOUTH WITH INTERPERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL WORK SKILLS FOR CAREER OPPORTUNITIES AND FAMILY STRENGTHENING TECHNIQUES. INSTRUCTION INVOLVES BOTH CLASSROOM AND HANDS-ON ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF HORTICULTURAL GARDEN PLOTS. CERTIFICATES ARE AWARDED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE PROGRAM; THEY CAN BE UTILIZED TO SUPPORT EMPLOYMENT APPLICATIONS AT ANY HORTICULTURALLY-RELATED ESTABLISHMENT. THE MULTIDISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO GAIN HORTICULTURAL AND NUTRITIONAL KNOWLEDGE, INTERPERSONAL SOCIAL SKILLS, AND WORK SKILLS TO BETTER PREPARE THEM FOR A HEALTHY AND PRODUCTIVE LIFESTYLE UPON RELEASE AND ULTIMATELY REDUCE RECIDIVISM.

PROJECT SUMMARY INTEREST IS GROWING IN INTRODUCING BEHAVIORAL AND EXPERIMENTAL METHODS INTO FOOD, AGRICULTURE, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HUMAN SCIENCES, BUT THIS CAPACITY IS LACKING IN HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES. BOTH BEHAVIORAL AND EXPERIMENTAL ECONOMICS HOLD PROMISE IN IMPROVING THE PREDICTIVE ACCURACY OF AGRIBUSINESS RESEARCH. FLORIDA A&M UNIVERSITY (FAMU) CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE ACCESS TO AN EXPERIMENTAL ECONOMICS LAB NECESSARY FOR TAKING ADVANTAGE OF NOVEL METHODS AND RECENT DEVELOPMENTS IN AGRIBUSINESS AND RELATED RESEARCH. THUS, FAMU'S STUDENTS ARE NOT BEING EXPOSED TO THESE OPPORTUNITIES AND INSTRUCTIONAL DELIVERY SYSTEMS. FAMU'S FACULTY DO NOT HAVE THE RESOURCES TO SUPPORT NOVEL BEHAVIORAL RESEARCH. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO BUILD THAT CAPACITY AT FAMU BY CREATING A CENTER FOR BEHAVIORAL AND EXPERIMENTAL ECONOMICS IN AGRIBUSINESS (CBEEA). INCLUDING EXPERIMENTAL ECONOMICS IN THE FAMU CURRICULUM WILL ENABLE UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS TO SEE THE TECHNOLOGICAL RELEVANCE AND CONTEMPORARY ASPECTS OF AGRICULTURE. THAT IS, THIS IS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE RESEARCH CAPABILITIES, SKILLS, AND CAREER-AWARENESS GAPS BY ELEVATING STUDENTS TOWARD HIGH-SKILL, HIGH-WAGE CAREER OPTIONS THROUGH GIVING THEM THE KNOWLEDGE NEEDED TO BE COMPETITIVE IN A GLOBAL ECONOMY.SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE CURRICULUM OF THE AGRIBUSINESS PROGRAM AT FAMU BY DEVELOPING AND TEACHING THREE NEW COURSES:EXPERIMENTAL ECONOMICS,BEHAVIORAL ECONOMICS, ANDENTREPRENEURSHIP-LEADERSHIPIN AGRIBUSINESSAND PROVIDING TRAINING IN EXPERIMENTAL METHODS DURING SUMMER WORKSHOPS. IT WILL ALSO STRENGTHEN FAMU'S RESEARCH CAPACITY BY CONDUCTING LABORATORY EXPERIMENTS WITH STUDENTS, AND FIELD EXPERIMENTS RESEARCH RELATED TO FARMERS' BEHAVIOR AND COMPLIANCE WITH FLORIDA WATER-QUALITY STANDARDS, AND THEIR DECISION-MAKING IN RISKY AND UNCERTAIN ENVIRONMENTS. WE PLAN TO CONDUCT ECONOMIC FIELD EXPERIMENTS WITH 200 FARMERS TO COLLECT DATA AND LOOK FORWARD TO SHARING RESULTS FROM OUR RESEARCH WITH THEM THROUGH OUR EXTENSION NETWORK AND WORKSHOPS. BY SHOWING HOW THEIR PARTICIPATION CONTRIBUTES DIRECTLY TO OUR UNDERSTANDING AND ADVANCEMENT OF AGRIBUSINESS AND AGRICULTURAL DECISION MAKING, THEY WILL HAVE INCREASE KNOWLEDGE TO AID IN THEIR OWN BUSINESS DECISIONS AND ADDED MOTIVATION TO CONTINUE PARTICIPATING IN BOTH THE GENERATION AND DISSEMINATION OF NEW RESEARCH FINDINGS. THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT WILL HAVE A VERY DIRECT POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE TRAINING AND EDUCATION OF OUR STUDENTS VIA ENHANCING TEACHING METHODS, SKILLS, AND RESEARCH CAPABILITIES IN EXPERIMENTAL METHODS. FACULTY WILL BE BETTER EQUIPPED TO CONDUCT FIELD EXPERIMENTS, UNDERSTAND FARMERS' BEHAVIOR AND DECISION MAKING AND, THUS IN A BETTER POSITION TO ASSIST THEM BY GENERATING NEW KNOWLEDGE THAT CAN IMPROVE THEIR SATISFACTION, PROFITABILITY, AND SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE IN THE REGION.

COMMERCIAL SHELLFISH AQUACULTURE IN DE REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT OPPORTUNITY TO EXPAND DE'S AQUACULTURE INDUSTRY AND POSES A CHALLENGE AS THERE IS A NEW/EXPANDED DEMAND FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, EDUCATION, AND OUTREACH. THE CURRENT PROPOSAL WILL ENABLE DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY (DSU) TO EXPAND THE SCOPE OF ITS EXISTING AQUACULTURE EXTENSION PROGRAM TO ADDRESS THIS NEED. SPECIFICALLY, WE ARE PLANNING A 36-MONTH PROJECT THAT WILL ESTABLISH DSU AS THE GO-TO SOURCE FOR SCIENCE-BASED INFORMATION ON SHELLFISH AQUACULTURE IN DE BY ACCOMPLISHING THE FOLLOWING FIVE OBJECTIVES:CONDUCT A FORMAL NEEDS ASSESSMENT,ESTABLISH A DEMONSTRATION 'FARM'CARRYOUT PRODUCTION DEMONSTRATIONSCREATE BASELINE PRODUCTION COST/BENEFIT ANALYSIS FOR DEDEVELOP EXTENSION PROGRAMING IN SHELLFISH AQUACULTURETHIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY BUILDING ON OUR ALREADY STRONG FOUNDATION OF AQUACULTURE EXTENSION PROGRAMMING IN DE BY DRAWING FROM A NETWORK OF COLLABORATORS, INCLUDING MR. MICHAEL BOTT FROM DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL, DR. JOHN JACOBS FROM THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION, AS WELL AS MR. DON WEBSTER, AND DR. MATT PARKER FROM UMD COOPERATIVE EXTENSION. WE WILL DISSEMINATE INFORMATION TO THESE NEW GROWERS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH DR. ED HALE AND TO OUR K-12 TEACHERS AND STUDENTS WITH MR. DAVID CHRISTOPHER, BOTH OF WHOM ARE WITH DE SEA GRANT. COLLECTIVELY OUR PLANNED ACTIVITIES WILL ALLOW DSU TO CONTINUE TO FULFILL ITS MISSION OF EDUCATING DELAWAREANS 'TO ADVANCE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, LIBERAL ARTS AND THE PROFESSIONS' TO PRODUCE 'CAPABLE AND PRODUCTIVE LEADERS WHO CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUSTAINABILITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE GLOBAL COMMUNITY.'

THERE IS A GROWING CONCERN ABOUT THE PREVALENCE OF SO-CALLED "CONTAMINANTS OF EMERGING CONCERN" (CECS) IN THE WATER AND THEIR DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND HUMAN BEINGS. CECS ARE INCREASINGLY DETECTED IN SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER, POSING RISKS TO THE NATION'S DRINKING WATERS, AGRICULTURAL CROPS, FOOD, AND AQUATIC LIFE. CECS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: PHARMACEUTICALS AND PERSONAL CARE PRODUCTS (PPCPS), ENDOCRINE DISRUPTOR CHEMICALS (EDCS), HOUSEHOLD CLEANING PRODUCTS, INDUSTRIAL CHEMICALS (E.G., PER- AND POLY FLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES) (PFASS), FLAME RETARDANT, AND PESTICIDES. CECS ARE KNOWN TO BE RELEASED INTO WATER RESOURCES THROUGH MULTIPLE PATHWAYS, INCLUDING RESIDENTIAL SEPTIC TANKS, SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT, HOSPITAL DISCHARGES, IMPROPER MANUFACTURER DISPOSAL, LANDFILL LEACHATE, AND REUSE OF TREATED WASTEWATER. CECS CAN CAUSE AN EXTREMELY WIDE RANGE OF ADVERSE EFFECTS TO HUMAN BEINGS AND VARIOUS ORGANISMS EVEN AT VERY LOW-LEVEL EXPOSURE. HUMAN EXPOSURE TO CECS MAY CAUSE CANCER, BIRTH DEFECTS AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISORDERS, DECREASED IMMUNITY TO DISEASE.THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO BUILD ANALYTICAL CAPABILITY OF MEASURING CONTAMINANTS OF EMERGING CONCERN IN WATER, DETERMINE THE POTENTIAL SOURCES AND MAGNITUDE OF CONTAMINATION OF CECS IN SURFACE WATER AND SHALLOW GROUNDWATER IN THE CITY OF TALLAHASSEE, FL, AND PROVIDE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITY TO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN THIS EMERGING FIELD OF RESEARCH. WE PLAN TO ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS THROUGH ACQUISITION OF LC-MS/MS AND SETTING UP THE METHODS FOR SELECTED POLAR AND NON-VOLATILE CECS, MONITORING SURFACE WATERS AND GROUNDWATER MONITORING WELLS AT THE SOUTHEAST FARM IRRIGATED WITH RECLAIMED WATER IN THE CITY OF TALLAHASSEE, INVOLVING UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES, AND COLLABORATION WITH FLORIDA STATE UNIVERSITY. THE COLLABORATION WITH FLORIDA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL HELP TO MEASURE VOLATILE CECS USING GC-MS WHICH IS COMPLIMENTARY TO LC-MS/MS. THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY WILL BE HELPFUL TO DETERMINE THE EXTENT AND POTENTIAL SOURCES OF CECS, WHICH WILL LEAD TO BETTER MANAGE OUR WATER RESOURCES AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT.

RECENTLY, WIDELY PRESENT HARMFUL ALGAE SPECIES (I.E., CYANOBACTERIA) ALONG WITH THEIR METABOLITE CYANOTOXINS IN OHIO WATERBODIES HAVE THREATENED THE PUBLIC, DOMESTIC ANIMALS AND WILD LIFE SPECIES. THE OCCURRENCE OF HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS (HAB) HAVE BEEN EXTENSIVELY ATTRIBUTED TO NON-OPTIMAL AGRICULTURAL OPERATIONS. THE CENTRAL STATE UNIVERSITY (CSU) RESEARCH GROUP SEEKS COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS WITH THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY (OSU) TO CONDUCT INTEGRATED ACTIVITIES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY AND ADOPT A SYSTEM'S APPROACH TO CONTROL CYANOTOXINS IN FRESHWATER. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROPOSAL IS TO BUILD CSU WITH RESEARCH CAPACITY ON DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING ECONOMICALLY VIABLE AND ENVIRONMENTALLY COMPATIBLE WATER TREATMENT TECHNOLOGY, THROUGH DEVELOPING ADVANCED OXIDATION PROCESS FOR MICROCYSTINS DESTRUCTION. THE PROJECT WILL OFFER CSU ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING (ENE) STUDENTS WITH HOLISTIC TRAINING IN NOVEL WATER SYSTEM DESIGNING AND FURTHER STRENGTHEN THE ENE PROGRAM IN ENHANCING THE CAPACITY IN ENGINEERING DESIGN CURRICULA TO MEET THE ABET ACCREDITATION REQUIREMENTS. WITH THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES, OUR COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH GROUP IS ANTICIPATED TO 1) DEVELOP WATER TREATMENT TECHNOLOGY AND PURIFICATION METHODS THAT ARE CAPABLE OF REMOVING CYANOTOXINS FROM FRESHWATER; 2) DEVISE ENGINEERING SYSTEMS WITH THE INCORPORATION OF EFFECTIVE REMOVAL TECHNOLOGY THAT CAN BE EMPLOYED IN CENTRALIZED FACILITIES; 3) STRENGTHEN THE ENE CURRICULUM BY INCORPORATING NOVEL ENGINEERING SYSTEM DESIGNS FOR WATER TREATMENT; 4) PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR FACULTY AND STUDENTS ON APPLIED ENVIRONMENTAL CHEMISTRY AND REDUCTION OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH RISKS; AND 5) DEMONSTRATE THE POSITIVE SOCIO-ECONOMIC IMPACTS OF THE NEWER TECHNOLOGIES WITH LIFE CYCLE ANALYSES THROUGH OUTREACH TO STAKEHOLDERS VIA TRADITIONAL AND SOCIAL MEDIA.

THIS MINI-SABBATICAL IS THE FIRST STEP IN A MULTISTEP PROCESS AND FITS WITH THE GOALS OF THE DEPARTMENT AND UNIVERSITY. A LONG-TERM GOAL IS A FOOD PRODUCT INNOVATION CENTER (FPIC) TO DEVELOP FOOD PRODUCTS FROM THE IDEATION STAGE THROUGH A FINAL (SHELF-READY) PRODUCT. THIS MINI-SABBATICAL WILL HELP MEET DEPARTMENT GOALS THROUGH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE IN PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT (SPECIFICALLY EXTRUSION) AND SENSORY EVALUATION AS HIGH QUALITY PRODUCTS WILL BE DEVELOPED WHICH CAN BE COMMERCIALIZED FOR THE FPIC.

NON-TECHNICAL SUMMARY:THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT BY PROJECT DIRECTOR, DR. SHOBHA SRIHARAN (PROFESSOR OF ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, VIRGINIA STATE UNIVERSITY), WILL PROVIDE HER THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AT USDA ARS IN COLLEGE STATION, TX WITH GUIDANCE FROM HER MENTOR, DR. CHENGHAI YANG, RESEARCH AGRICULTURE ENGINEER (ARS) AND ADJUNCT PROFESSOR (TEXAS A & M UNIVERSITY). DR. SRIHARAN WILL GAIN RESEARCH EXPERIENCE IN USING REMOTE SENSING TECHNIQUES IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE/MANAGEMENT. SHE WILL LEARN TO APPLY THE TRAINING OF INTEGRATING THIS TECHNOLOGY IN COURSES ON: REMOTE SENSING, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND INDEPENDENT STUDY AT VSU. THE RESEARCH IS ON: (1) GAINING EXPERIENCE IN THE USE OF ENVI AND PIX4D SOFTWARE AT ARS COLLEGE STATION, TEXAS, (2) DIGITAL IMAGE PROCESSING OF SATELLITE IMAGERY (SENTINEL-2/LANDSAT-8) NEAR ARS STATION WITH ENVI AND PIX4D, (3) DETECTING LAND USE AND LAND COVER (LULC) CHANGES BY SUPERVISED AND UNSUPERVISED CLASSIFICATION OF SENTINEL/LANDSAT IMAGERY, IN ADDITION TO PERFORMING ACCURACY ASSESSMENT TO PREDICT OVERALL ACCURACY AND KAPPA COEFFICIENT VALUES OF LULC CLASSIFICATIONS BY USING HIGH-RESOLUTION GOOGLE IMAGERY AND GROUND OBSERVATIONS, AND (4) ENRICHING COURSES ON REMOTE SENSING AND CLIMATE CHANGE BY HANDS-ON EXERCISES WITH ABOVE-MENTIONED SOFTWARE. THE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE PD'S CAPACITY IN RESEARCH, WHICH IN TURN WILL RESULT IN ENRICHING THE ABOVE-MENTIONED COURSES WITH STUDENT EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN REMOTE SENSING. THE LONG-RANGE GOALS OF VIRGINIA STATE UNIVERSITY IS TO PREPARE A MINORITY WORKFORCE WHO ARE WELL-TRAINED AND HAVE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN TECHNOLOGY. VSU'S DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE OFFERS COURSES IN FANH (FOOD, AGRICULTURE, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HEALTH) SCIENCES.

KENTUCKY HAS ABUNDANCE OF LANDOWNERS WHO ENGAGE IN SMALL-SCALE FARMING OPERATIONS, OWN SMALL ACREAGE, HAVE LIMITED RESOURCES TO IMPROVE THEIR OPERATIONS, OR LIVE IN FOOD INSECURE AREAS. KENTUCKY IS ALSO EXPERIENCING AN INCREASE IN LANDOWNERS WITH THE SIMULTANEOUS GOALS OF DIVERSIFYING FARMING OPERATIONS TO IMPROVE INCOME WHILE ALSO VALUING LAND CONSERVATION. ALLEY CROPPING IS AN AGROFORESTRY PRACTICE WELL-SUITED TO SMALL-SCALE PRODUCTION THAT OFFERS SIGNIFICANT ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS BY INTEGRATING PERENNIAL WOODY CROPS WITH A VARIETY OF OTHER CROPS. THIS SYSTEM CAN PROVIDE ADDITIONAL CHOICES FOR BEGINNING AND EXPERIENCED PRODUCERS TO IMPROVE LOCAL FOOD AVAILABILITY AND INCREASE INCOME. THIS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BENEFIT PRODUCERS WHO NEED ADDITIONAL CHOICES WHEN FACED WITH LIMITED LAND, LIMITED RESOURCES, AND THE DESIRE TO USE MORE SUSTAINABLE PRACTICES.KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY WILL IMPLEMENT A RESEARCH STUDY THAT EXAMINES THE POTENTIAL OF DIFFERENT ALLEY CROPPING SYSTEMS TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY IMPROVING SOIL HEALTH AND POLLINATOR DIVERSITY. COOPERATIVE DEMONSTRATION SITES WILL ALSO BE INSTALLED TO PROVIDE PUBLIC EXPOSURE TO THESE PRACTICES. THESE SITES AND OTHER EFFORTS WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING ABOUT ALLEY CROPPING, AND EXTENSION RESOURCES WILL BE DEVELOPED TO SHARE INFORMATION ABOUT THIS PROJECT AND RELATED AGROFORESTRY PRACTICES. THIS FOCUSED PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE AMEANS FOR FARMERS TO CHOOSE AN ADDITIONAL PATHTHAT ADDRESSES THEIR SPECIFIC NEEDS. THIS WILL BE AIDED BY TRAINING AND EDUCATION RESOURCES THAT DIRECTLY BENEFIT PRODUCERS AND NATURAL RESOURCE PROFESSIONAL WHO ASSIST PRODUCERS.

FLORIDA SUSTAINS ONE OF THE MOST EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT AGRICULTURE AND AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRIES IN THE NATION. TODAY, FLORIDA'S 47,500 FARMS PRODUCE MORE THAN 300 DIFFERENT COMMODITIES ON MORE THAN 9.7 MILLION ACRES. FLORIDA'S AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SYSTEMS SUPPORT 2 MILLION PEOPLE AND CONTRIBUTE MORE THAN $253.86 BILLION TO OUR STATE'S ECONOMY EACH YEAR. FLORIDA HAS BEEN AND CONTINUES TO BE PRONE TO INVASIVE PEST INSECT INVASIONS. INDEED, THESE PESTS POSE SERIOUS ECONOMIC CHALLENGES TO SPECIALTY CROP'S PRODUCTIVITY AND FOOD SECURITY. THE CARIBBEAN COUNTRIES REPRESENT FLORIDA'S LARGEST SINGLE TRADING PARTNER FOR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS, WITH THE LARGE VOLUME OF COMMERCE AND TRAVEL TAKING PLACE EVERY YEAR. CLIMATE CHANGES CAN HAVE PROFOUND IMPACTS ON THE GEOGRAPHICAL RANGES OF PESTS AND DISTRIBUTIONS TO PRODUCTION SYSTEMS. THERE HAVE BEEN SEVERE ECONOMIC FOOD AND FIBER LOSSES TO INDUSTRIES AND TRADE REGARDLESS OF THE PEST ENTRY PATHWAYS. THIS COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROPOSAL WILL FOCUS ON DEVELOPING FAMU'S CAPACITY ON CLIMATE CHANGE AND PREDICTION OF INVASIVE PEST INSECTS AND TARGET CBG'S PRIORITY AREA: GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH ARE TO I). IDENTIFY PATHWAYS, ESTABLISHMENT, SPEED, AND SPREAD OF POTENTIAL INVASIVE PEST INSECTS VIA MACHINE LEARNING, ARCGIS MAPS, AND MAXENT MODELING, II) PREDICT FUTURE DISTRIBUTION OF INVASIVE PEST INSECTS IN THE SPECIALTY FOOD CROPS IN THE REGION (FLORIDA AND THE CARIBBEAN) CONSIDERING MAIN CLIMATE CHANGE PROJECTIONS OF THE INTERGOVERNMENTAL PANEL ON CLIMATE CHANGE (IPCC), AND III). DEVELOP A WEBSITE TO DEPLOY ELECTRONIC RESOURCES ON THE INVASIVE PEST INSECTS FOR THE REGIONAL STAKEHOLDERS.

THIS PROJECT IS CONCERNED WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN INNOVATIVE INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT STRATEGY FOR PRODUCTION OF INDUSTRIAL HEMP AND AN EVALUATION OF ITS POTENTIAL ECONOMIC BENEFITS. THE PASSAGE OF HISTORIC LEGISLATION WHICH REMOVED HEMP FROM THE CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES ACT HAS LED TO ITS PRESENT STATUS AS A MULTIMILLION-DOLLAR INDUSTRY. THERE ARE MANY OPPORTUNITIES FOR SMALL- AND LARGE-SCALE FARMERS TO BE INVOLVED IN THIS NEW AND PROMISING AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY. HOWEVER, BECAUSE OF FLORIDA'S FAVORABLE CLIMATE, PEST SPECIES POSE A SERIOUS THREAT TO HEMP PRODUCTION. PESTICIDES THAT ARE CURRENTLY REGISTERED FOR USE ARE NOT VERY EFFECTIVE AGAINST PESTS OF HEMP. THEREFORE, WE INTEND TO DEVELOP AND APPLY A NOVEL INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (IPM) STRATEGY FOR HEMP GROWERS AND EVALUATE ITS POTENTIAL ECONOMIC IMPACT. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE: (A) TO DEVELOP BIOLOGICALLY BASED INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (BBIPM) STRATEGIES TO MANAGE PESTS ON INDUSTRIAL HEMP IN NORTH AND CENTRAL FLORIDA;(B) TO ASSESS THE COST EFFECTIVENESS OF HEMP PRODUCTION WITH AND WITHOUT THE USE OF BBIPM. (C) TO PROVIDE WEB-BASED IDENTIFICATION TOOLS FOR PESTS; AND (D) TO DEVELOP SPECIES DISTRIBUTION MODELS FOR STAKEHOLDERS. IN ORDER FOR NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND FORECASTING TOOLS TO REACH END-USERS, THIS PROJECT WILL TRANSFER TECHNOLOGY THROUGH EXTENSION PROGRAMS AND PROVIDE WORKSHOPS, HANDS-ON TRAININGS, E-CERTIFICATES, EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING TO STUDENTS, EXTENSION PERSONNEL, FARMERS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.

TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY IS A LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION THAT WAS FOUNDED ON THE PRINCIPLE OF HELPING THESMALL FARMER. FOR THE SMALL DAIRY FARMER, THE GREATEST LOSS IS THE LOSS OF THE MEANS OF PRODUCTION,THAT IS, THE DAIRY ANIMAL. MASTITIS, WHEN CAUSED BY THE PATHOGEN STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS (S.AUREUS), FACES THE FARMER WITH CHOOSING BETWEEN SACRIFICING (CULLING) THE INFECTED ANIMAL, LOSINGALL FUTURE PRODUCTION FROM IT, OR TRYING TO TREAT IT. THIS USUALLY ENDS WITHOUT SUCCESS AND RISKSTHE PROPAGATION OF THE DISEASE TO OTHER ANIMALS AND HUMANS AS WELL AS THE CONTAMINATION OF THEHARVESTED MILK AND MILKING EQUIPMENT. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH AIMS AT GIVING THE FARMER ONETHIRD OPTION: TREATING THE ANIMAL WITH A HIGH PROBABILITY OF SUCCESS, HELPING PRESERVE THE FARM'SFUTURE. THIS PROPOSED SOLUTION ADDRESSES MANY AREAS PRIORITIZED BY THIS CAPACITY BUILDINGGRANT OPPORTUNITY, SUCH AS FOOD SAFETY, GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY, ANDSUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE. INDIRECTLY, IT ALSO HELPS PRESERVE THE WATER QUALITY.INFECTIOUS MASTITIS IS AN INFLAMMATION OF THE MAMMARY GLAND CAUSED BY MICROBIAL AGENTS,MOST COMMONLY BACTERIA. ANTIBIOTIC TREATMENT IS NOT COST-EFFECTIVE FOR MASTITIS CAUSED BY THEOPPORTUNISTIC PATHOGEN, STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS. SUCH AN APPROACH HAS AN EXCEEDINGLY HIGHFAILURE RATE FOR THIS DISEASE. MOREOVER, APPARENT BACTERIOLOGICAL CUREIN THE CASE OF S. AUREUS INFECTIONS (NEGATIVE MILK CULTURE) DOES NOT NECESSARILY MEAN THAT S.AUREUS HAS BEEN ELIMINATED. ITS CAPACITY TO PERSIST INSIDE INFECTED CELLS MAKES THENEGATIVE MILK CULTURES AN UNRELIABLE PROXY FOR BACTERIAL ABSENCE IN THE UDDER.ANIMALS THAT DO NOT RECOVER DEVELOP CHRONIC MASTITIS AND PERSISTENTLY SHED THE BACTERIA IN THEMILK, POSING A RISK OF CONTAMINATION FOR THE ENVIRONMENT, THE MILKING EQUIPMENT, OTHER COWS, AS WELL AS THE MILK IN THE TANK, AND THE MILKERS IN CONTACT WITH THE MILK OF THE AFFECTED ANIMAL. MOREOVER, ANTIBIOTIC-RESISTANTSTRAINS WHICH HAVE AN EVEN LOWER RECOVERY RATE HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED, AS WELL AS HEAT-RESISTANTSTRAINSTHAT CAN SURVIVE THE MOST COMMON METHOD OF PASTEURIZATION (HIGHTEMPERATURE SHORT TIME PASTEURIZATION OR HTST).THIS SUPPOSES A RISK FOR THE PUBLIC CONSUMING PASTEURIZED MILK AND DERIVED PRODUCTS.TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY IS A LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION THAT WAS FOUNDED ON THE PRINCIPLE OF HELPING THESMALL FARMER. FOR THE SMALL DAIRY FARMER, THE GREATEST LOSS IS THE LOSS OF THE MEANS OF PRODUCTION,THAT IS, THE DAIRY ANIMAL. MASTITIS, WHEN CAUSED BY THE PATHOGEN STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS (S.AUREUS), FACES THE FARMER WITH CHOOSING BETWEEN SACRIFICING (CULLING) THE INFECTED ANIMAL, LOSINGALL FUTURE PRODUCTION FROM IT, OR TRYING TO TREAT IT. THIS USUALLY ENDS WITHOUT SUCCESS AND RISKSTHE PROPAGATION OF THE DISEASE TO OTHER ANIMALS AND HUMANS AS WELL AS THE CONTAMINATION OF THEHARVESTED MILK AND MILKING EQUIPMENT. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH AIMS AT GIVING THE FARMER ONETHIRD OPTION: TREATING THE ANIMAL WITH A HIGH PROBABILITY OF SUCCESS, HELPING PRESERVE THE FARM'SFUTURE. THIS PROPOSED SOLUTION ADDRESSES MANY AREAS PRIORITIZED BY THIS CAPACITY BUILDINGGRANT OPPORTUNITY, SUCH AS FOOD SAFETY, GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY, ANDSUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE. INDIRECTLY, IT ALSO HELPS PRESERVE THE WATER QUALITY.INFECTIOUS MASTITIS IS AN INFLAMMATION OF THE MAMMARY GLAND CAUSED BY MICROBIAL AGENTS,MOST COMMONLY BACTERIA. ANTIBIOTIC TREATMENT IS NOT COST-EFFECTIVE FOR MASTITIS CAUSED BY THEOPPORTUNISTIC PATHOGEN, STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS. SUCH AN APPROACH HAS AN EXCEEDINGLY HIGHFAILURE RATE FOR THIS DISEASE. MOREOVER, APPARENT BACTERIOLOGICAL CUREIN THE CASE OF S. AUREUS INFECTIONS (NEGATIVE MILK CULTURE) DOES NOT NECESSARILY MEAN THAT S.AUREUS HAS BEEN ELIMINATED . ITS CAPACITY TO PERSIST INSIDE INFECTED CELLS MAKES THENEGATIVE MILK CULTURES AN UNRELIABLE PROXY FOR BACTERIAL ABSENCE IN THE UDDER.ANIMALS THAT DO NOT RECOVER DEVELOP CHRONIC MASTITIS AND PERSISTENTLY SHED THE BACTERIA IN THEMILK, POSING A RISK OF CONTAMINATION FOR THE ENVIRONMENT, THE MILKING EQUIPMENT, OTHER COWS, AS WELL AS THE MILK IN THE TANK , AND THE MILKERS IN CONTACT WITH THE MILK OF THE AFFECTED ANIMAL . MOREOVER, ANTIBIOTIC-RESISTANTSTRAINS WHICH HAVE AN EVEN LOWER RECOVERY RATE HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED, AS WELL AS HEAT-RESISTANTSTRAINS (JAMES ET AL., 2018) THAT CAN SURVIVE THE MOST COMMON METHOD OF PASTEURIZATION (HIGHTEMPERATURE SHORT TIME PASTEURIZATION OR HTST).THIS SUPPOSES A RISK FOR THE PUBLIC CONSUMING PASTEURIZED MILK AND DERIVED PRODUCTS.S. AUREUS HAS A HERD PREVALENCE FROM 42% IN NON-PASTURED (CONVENTIONAL) HERDS, TO 62% IN ORGANIC HERDS. STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS CAUSES AN ESTIMATED 10-11.7% OF USA'S INFECTIOUS MASTITIS CASES , HAS A 50% CHANCE OF RECOVERY WHEN TREATED WITH THE PROPER ANTIBIOTICS AND A 1% OR LOWER CHANCE OF SPONTANEOUS RECOVERY. THIS IS FAVORED BY THE EVASION MECHANISMS OF THE PATHOGEN: 1. S. AUREUS INTERNALIZATION INTO THE MAMMARY CELLS PROTECTS IT FROM OPSONIZATION, ANTIBIOTICS AND PHAGOCYTOSIS. 2. INHIBITION OF THE AUTOLOGOUS IGG AND IGM ANTIBODIES THROUGH THE EXPRESSION OF THE PROTEINS STAPHYLOCOCCAL PROTEIN A (SPA) AND STAPHYLOCOCCAL BINDER OF IMMUNOGLOBULIN (SBI). 3. B CELL KILLING BY SPA. 4. BIOFILM FORMATION, WHICH PROTECTS S. AUREUS FROM BOTH ANTIBIOTICS AND THE IMMUNE SYSTEM OF THE ANIMAL. 5. ON OCCASION, ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE. CULLING IS USUALLY CONSIDERED THE MOST COST-EFFECTIVE METHOD OF CONTROLLING S. AUREUS INFECTIONS, AT THE COST OF THE FARMER; THE AVERAGE VALUE OF A DAIRY COW IS $2094 (FIRST LACTATION) AND $1973 (AFTER SECOND LACTATION). REGULARLY, AN ANIMAL THAT HAS BEEN CLINICALLY CURED FROM S. AUREUS MASTITIS WILL APPEAR CLINICALLY ILL WITH THE SAME AGENT (HAVING A "FLARE UP") IN A SUBSEQUENT LACTATION, MAKING EVEN APPARENTLY SUCCESSFUL TREATMENT UNRELIABLE AND EXPOSING OTHER COWS TO THE AGENT WITHOUT WARNING. ALL THIS MAKES IT CRITICAL TO FIND AN ALTERNATE EFFECTIVE SOLUTION FOR S. AUREUS MASTITIS IN DAIRY ANIMALS. THE PROPOSED STUDY IS AIMED AT DEMONSTRATING THE FEASIBILITY OF USING A NOVEL APPROACH FOR THE TREATMENT OF S. AUREUS MASTITIS IN DAIRY ANIMALS. THIS TREATMENT CONSISTS OF A COMBINATION OF THREE SYNERGIC PRODUCTS PROVIDING IMMUNOMODULATORY AND BACTERIOSTATIC PROPERTIES, AND WHICH 4 ADDRESS THE DIVERSE EVASION MECHANISMS EXERTED BY S. AUREUS THAT ALLOW FOR ITS PERSISTENCE IN THE AFFLICTED ANIMAL. IN THIS PROPOSED APPROACH, WE INTEND TO USE ANTI-SPA CHICKEN IGY, CHOLECALCIFEROL AND THE PEPTIDE RP TO ADDRESS THE EVASION MECHANISMS AND GROWTH OF S. AUREUS FOR THE FULL RECOVERY OF THE ANIMAL. THE PROPOSED TREATMENT IS DESIGNED TO: 1. PREVENT BACTERIAL INTERNALIZATION BY THE MAMMARY EPITHELIAL CELLS USING CHOLECALCIFEROL AND IGY. 2. REDUCE BACTERIAL GROWTH, USING INTRAMAMMARY IGY AND BIOFILM PRODUCTION. HIGHLY INCREASE BACTERIAL PHAGOCYTOSIS USING IGY AND A NOVEL PEPTIDE, RP. 4. INCREASE THE KILLING OF INFECTED CELLS BY MACROPHAGES BY USING RP TO POLARIZE THEM INTO M1-LIKE MACROPHAGES. MOREOVER, THIS TREATMENT ALSO AIMS AT MINIMIZING THE FIBROSIS OF THE MAMMARY GLAND, HELPING THEREFORE PRESERVE UDDER FUNCTION FOR FUTURE LACTATIONS BY THE ACTION OF RP.

THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE THE GLOBAL COMPETENCE OF VETERINARY STUDENTS AT THE TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY COLLEGE OF VETERINARY MEDICINE (TUCVM), THE ONLY HBCU WITH A COLLEGE OF VETERINARY MEDICINE. EMERGING ZOONOSES LIKE COVID-19 CAUSED BY SARS-COV-2, INDICATES THAT VETERINARIANS INHABIT A PRIMARY POSITION IN THE PREVENTION OF NEW AND DANGEROUS ZOONOSES. THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE NEED FOR NEW GENERATION OF VETERINARIANS TRAINED TO ADDRESS THE GROWING THREAT OF EMERGING ZOONOTIC INFECTIONS. IT ALSO ADDRESSES THE SHORTAGE OF FOOD ANIMAL VETERINARIANS IN PUBLIC, PRIVATE, INDUSTRIAL AND ACADEMIC SECTORS, WHICH WILL WORSEN UNLESS NEW STRATEGIES ARE IMPLEMENTED. THERE IS A CRITICAL NEED FOR VETERINARIANS THAT CAN CONTRIBUTE TO THE HARMONIZATION OF RULES AND ADVICE CLIENTS ON GLOBAL TRADE OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF TRANS-BOUNDARY ANIMAL INFECTIONS. TUCVM ASPIRES TO STRENGTHEN CAPACITY TO TRAIN STUDENTS TO BE DAY1 -READY VETERINARIANS THAT WILL PLAY CRUCIAL ROLES IN: 1. RESPONDING TO EMERGING ZOONOSES, 2. NATIONAL OR INTERNATIONAL STANDARD SETTING ORGANIZATIONS THAT REGULATE GLOBAL TRADE OF ANIMALS AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS, AND 3. ALL SECTORS WHERE FOOD ANIMAL VETERINARIANS ARE URGENTLY NEEDED. THESE ASPIRATIONS WILL BE REALIZED BY CREATING A NEW COURSE ON "EMERGING ZOONOSES" AND BY PROVIDING EXTERNSHIPS AT COLLABORATING USDA AND FOREIGN INSTITUTIONS. PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR FACULTY MEMBERS WILL BETTER PREPARE THEM TO TEACH THE NEW COURSE AND MENTOR TARGETED STUDENTS. EXTERNSHIPS DURING THE EARLY YEARS OF CURRICULUM WILL IMPROVE THE HANDS-ON EXPERIENCES AND PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS OF OUR STUDENTS WITH AN INTEREST IN FOOD-ANIMAL VETERINARY MEDICINE.

OKLAHOMA IS ONE OF THE LEAST HEALTHIEST STATES RANKING LOW FOR HEALTH OUTCOMES, FRUIT AND VEGETABLE CONSUMPTION, AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AMONG YOUTH AND ADULTS. ADDITONALLY ACCODRING TO THE USDA CENSUS TRACT MANY LOW INCOME OKLAHOMANS LIVE MORE THAN &FRAC12; MILE (URBAN) OR 10 MILES (RURAL) FROM THE NEAREST SUPERMARKET. PRIOR RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT SPATIAL DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES EXIST IN ACCESS TO GREEN SPACES AND PARKS IN URBAN AND RURAL AREAS THAT ARE PREDOMINATELY BLACK AND HISPANIC (WEN, ZHANG, HARRIS, HOLT & CROFT, 2013). ACCORDING TO THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC), FEWER THAN 30% OF OKLAHOMANS LIVE IN ENVIRONMENTS THAT SUPPORT PHYSICAL ACTIVITY. FOOD AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY CHOICES ARE OFTEN INFLUENCED AND DICTATED BY THE FOOD AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS, LOCAL AND NATIONAL POLICIES, AND THE SOCIAL AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH A PERSON FUNCTIONS. THEREFORE, IT IS ESSENTIAL TO ADDRESS THE POLICY, SYSTEMS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTEXT WHERE THESE DISPARITIES FLOURISH AND NOT JUST THE BEHAVIORS THAT LEAD TO THESE HEALTH DISPARITIES.THE BROAD OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO BRIDGE GAPS IN FOOD AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY ACCESS FOR UNDERREPRESENTED (ETHNICITY, RACE, AND INCOME) URBAN AND RURAL COMMUNITIES IN OKLAHOMA BY CREATING AN OUTLET FOR THOSE IN UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE POLICY, SYSTEMS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS THAT LEAD TO HEALTH DISPARITIES. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CULTIVATE RESILIENT COMMUNITIES THAT SUPPORT HEALTH AND WELLNESS. WE WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL BY 1) ESTABLISHING COMMUNITY COALITIONS WITHIN UNDERREPRESENTED AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO ASSESS, PLAN, AND IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY-LED POLICY, SYSTEMS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE INTERVENTIONS, 2) ESTABLISHING YOUTH DEVELOPMENT CLUBS WITHIN UNDERREPRESENTED AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO ASSESS, PLAN, AND IMPLEMENT YOUTH-LED ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE INTERVENTIONS 3) IMPROVING ACCESS TO FOOD AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE LIVING IN UNDERSERVED AND UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES 4) PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS TO ENRICH ACADEMICS BY LINKING THEORY TO PRACTICE.

WE SEEK TO GROW CENTRAL STATE UNIVERSITY'S (CSU) EXERCISE SCIENCE (EXS) PROGRAM AND PROMOTE OUR UNIVERSITY'S LAND-GRANT MISSION BY EXPANDING OUR RESEARCH TO INCLUDE ERGONOMICS SAFETY OF AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION, AS WELL AS POSITIVELY IMPACTING THE OVERALL HEALTH OF THE FARMING COMMUNITY. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL NOT ONLY HELP LOCAL FARMERS AVOID OR REDUCE PHYSICAL INJURY, BUT WILL ALSO ADD TO THE ERGONOMIC SAFETY DATASET CURRENTLY BEING DEVELOPED BY RESEARCHERS TO IMPROVE FARM SAFETY PRACTICES GLOBALLY. A POSTDOCTORAL POSITION WITH A 50% TEACHING/50% RESEARCH FOCUS WILL BE HIRED FOR THE DURATION OF THE GRANT. THE POSTDOC WILL BE TRAINED BY THE CO-PD IN THE AREAS OF CURRICULUM DESIGN AND PEDAGOGICAL PROCESSES. THE POSTDOC WILL BE MENTORED BY THE PD IN ERGONOMIC RESEARCH AND AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION. THE GAITRITE WALKING PATH AND DARTFISH MOTION CAPTURE SYSTEM WILL ENABLE THE PD AND POSTDOC TO PURSUE THIS AREA OF RESEARCH. EXS RESEARCHERS WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S MANUFACTURING ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT TO DEVELOP LOW-COST EQUIPMENT TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE HAZARDOUS MOVEMENTS FOR FARMERS. PHYSICAL THERAPY MEASURES, ALONG WITH EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH, WILL ALSO BE OFFERED. OUR WORK WILL HELP INCREASE THE NUMBER OF MINORITY STUDENTS ENROLLED IN CSU'S EXS PROGRAM, THUS HELPING TO IMPROVE MINORITY REPRESENTATION IN HEALTHCARE FIELDS. FUNDING WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR UP TO FOUR RESEARCH ASSISTANT POSITIONS TO BE FILLED BY CSU EXS STUDENTS ANNUALLY. STUDENTS WILL BE BETTER TRAINED TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTHCARE TO MINORITY AND RURAL COMMUNITIES. THE POSTDOC WILL BE PREPARED TO JOIN THE RANKS OF JUNIOR TENURE TRACK FACULTY.

FOOD SECURITY AND NUTRITION SECURITY EXIST AS THE MAJOR CONCERNS IN MANY COUNTRIES OF THE WORLD. SWEETPOTATO (IPOMOEA BATATAS (L.) LAM.; CONVOLVULACEAE), A PLANT WIDELY GROWN IN ALL TROPICAL AND SUBTROPICAL AREAS, IS AMONG THE 10 MOST IMPORTANT FOOD CROPS WORLDWIDE. HOWEVER, SWEETPOTATO CONTAINS LOWER PROTEIN CONTENT COMPARED TO OTHER STAPLE FOODS, E.G., MAIZE, RICE, WHEAT AND SOYBEAN. MOREOVER, AS A CROP PRODUCED BY VEGETATIVE PROPAGATION, "CULTIVAR DECLINE" DUE TO VIRAL INFECTIONS SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCES SWEETPOTATO YIELD AND STORAGE ROOT QUALITY. IN THIS STUDY, WE WILL APPLY NOVEL BIOTECHNOLOGICAL METHODS TO DEVELOP SWEETPOTATO PLANTS WITH IMPROVED NUTRITION AND VIRAL RESISTANCE, THUS, SWEETPOTATO LINES WITH HIGHER NUTRITIONAL VALUE AND INCREASED YIELD PRODUCTION WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR MISSISSIPPI SWEETPOTATO SEED INDUSTRY AND FARMERS. SPECIFICALLY, OUR OBJECTIVES ARE 1). TO GENERATE ARABIDOPSIS QQS AND SWEETPOTATO NF-YC4 TRANSGENIC SWEETPOTATO TO INCREASE PROTEIN LEVELS AND DISEASE RESISTANCE IN SWEETPOTATO ROOTS VIA AGROBACTERIUM-MEDIATED TRANSFORMATION METHOD; 2). TO GENERATE SWEETPOTATO VIA CRISPR/CAS9 TARGETED MUTAGENESIS FOR OVEREXPRESSION OF SWEETPOTATO NF-YC4 TO INCREASE PROTEIN LEVELS AND DISEASE RESISTANCE IN SWEETPOTATO ROOTS; 3). TO TEST THE COMPOSITION OF PROTEIN AND STARCH FOR THE NEW SWEETPOTATO VARIETIES GENERATED IN OBJECTIVES 1 AND 2; 4). TO TEST VIRAL DISEASE RESISTANCE FOR THE NEW SWEETPOTATO VARIETIES GENERATED IN OBJECTIVES 1 AND 2. SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THIS PROJECT WILL SIGNIFICANTLY BOOST QUALITY OF LIFE AND ENVIRONMENT IN THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND ENHANCE RESEARCH AND EDUCATION CAPACITIES OF ALCORN STATE UNIVERSITY.

THE UNITED STATES (U.S.) IS THE PRE-EMINENT LEADER IN SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY.ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES HAVE CREATED A CRITICAL GLOBAL NEED FOR HIGHLY EDUCATED SCIENTISTS, PROFESSIONALS, AND GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PROCEDURES, POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. UNFORTUNATELY, UNDER-REPRESENTED MINORITIES, ESPECIALLY AFRICAN AMERICANS AND HISPANICS, LAG BEHIND IN EMPLOYMENT WITHIN THE NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES.FORECASTED DEMOGRAPHICS SUGGEST THAT THE U.S. NEEDS TO INCREASE RACIAL/ETHNICAL DIVERSITY IN SCIENTIFIC PROFESSIONS BECAUSE ITS ECONOMIC VIABILITY DEPENDS ON A DIVERSIFIED WORKFORCE. DIVERSITY IS RARELY FOUND AMONG THE RANKS OF SCIENCE DISCIPLINES BECAUSE MOST INSTITUTIONS PRODUCE FEW MINORITY GRADUATES. HOWEVER, ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY (AAMU) HAS BEEN AT THE FOREFRONT OF EFFORTS TO TRAIN MINORITY STUDENTS TO ASSUME LEADERSHIP ROLES IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE DISCIPLINES AS EVIDENCE IN THE COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURAL, LIFE, AND NATURAL SCIENCES, WHICH HAS OVER 90% AFRICAN AMERICAN STUDENT ENROLLMENT. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THENRES SCHOLARS PROGRAM @ AAMUWILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS AND EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES FOR TWO YEARS FOR 10 STUDENTS MAJORING IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE SCIENCES.THIS PROGRAM WILL STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY AND QUALITY OF PROGRAMS THROUGH INTENSIVE RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION EFFORTS; CULTIVATE ACADEMIC COMPETITIVENESS BY ENGAGING IN RIGOROUS CURRICULA AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES; AND PROVIDE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH TRAINING OF ADVANCED AND EMERGING INSTRUMENTATION TECHNIQUES.THE INNOVATIVE ASPECT OF THE PROPOSAL IS THE MULTIDISCIPLINARY TRAINING OF STUDENTS THROUGH ENHANCED INTERACTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL CURRICULA AND HANDS-ON, RESEARCH-BASED EXPERIENCES WHICH RESULTS IN WELL-ROUNDED STUDENTS WHO ARE ADEQUATELY TRAINED AND PREPARED FOR THE NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE WORK FORCE.?

HYPERTENSION IS A MAJOR CONTROLLABLE RISK FACTOR ASSOCIATED WITH CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE, MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION, STROKE, HEART FAILURE AND END-STAGE DIABETES. BOTH DIET AND GUT MICROBIOTA PLAY IMPORTANT ROLES IN HYPERTENSION. THE PREVALENCE OF HYPERTENSION IS 45.4% AMONG ADULTS IN THE UNITED STATES, WITH A HIGHER PREVALENCE AMONG NON-HISPANIC BLACKS (57.1%). ABOUT 76% OF HYPERTENSIVE ADULTS TAKE REGULAR MEDICATION TO LOWER THEIR BLOOD PRESSURE. HOWEVER, MOST COMMERCIAL ANTIHYPERTENSIVE DRUGS CAUSE MANY SIDE EFFECTS. THUS, IT IS IMPORTANT TO EXPLORE SAFER ANTIHYPERTENSIVE ALTERNATIVES TO REGULATE BLOOD PRESSURE. LIMITED STUDIES HAVE SHOWN THAT PEANUT PROTEIN HYDROLYSATE (PPH) INHIBITS THE ACTIVITY OF AN ENZYME (ACE) WHICH PLAYS KEY ROLE IN BLOOD PRESSURE REGULATION AND LOWERS THE BLOOD PRESSURE OF LABORATORY RATS WITH HYPERTENSION. HOWEVER, THE UNDERSTANDING OF HOW PPH INFLUENCES RENIN, ANOTHER KEY ENZYME REGULATING BLOOD PRESSURE, IS LACKING, AND HOW PPH INTERACTS WITH GASTROINTESTINAL/SERUM PROTEASES AND GUT MICROBIOTA IS UNKNOWN. THEREFORE, THE GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO INVESTIGATE THE BLOOD PRESSURE LOWERING PROPERTIES OF PPH USING A SIMULTANEOUSLY HYPERTENSIVE RAT (SHR) MODEL, TO STUDY THE RENIN-INHIBITORY ACTIVITY OF PPH, TO EXPLORE THE RESISTANCE OF PPH TO GI TRACK DIGESTION AND PLASMA PEPTIDASE DIGESTION, AND TO EXAMINE THE INTERACTION BETWEEN PPH AND COMMON GUT MICROBIOTA

THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO DEVELOP THE BASIS FOR A TOOL THAT CAN BE USED TO EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND NUTRITIONAL CONDITIONS ON THE PERFORMANCE OF CHICKENS. IT IS CONSIDERED AN INTEGRATED PROJECT IN THAT UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED IN MACHINE LEARNING OR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (ML/AI) METHODS AND HOW IT CAN BE APPLIED TO GROWTH PERFORMANCE OF ANIMALS. IN ADDITION, IT IS A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT INVOLVING UNIVERSITY, FEDERAL AND PRIVATE INTERESTS AND WILL DIRECTLY INVOLVE GROWERS IN OUR EFFORTS TO DESIGN A TOOL. THE DESIGN OF THIS PROJECT IS TO FIRST USE EXPERIMENTAL DATA TO GENERATE THE ALGORITHM FOR USE IN THE ML/AI (OBJECTIVES 1 AND 2), THEN EXPAND TO GROWERS TO REFINE THE ALGORITHM (OBJECTIVES 3 AND 4). OBJECTIVE 5 IS DIRECTED TOWARDS INSURING STUDENTS ARE BEING TRAINED DURING EACH YEAR OF THE PROJECT, OF WHICH MULTIPLE STUDENTS ARE INVOLVED AS GRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE FINAL PRODUCT IS EXPECTED TO BE A TOOL THAT CAN BE USED BY INDUSTRY IN IMPROVING POULTRY PRODUCTION.

PROJECT SUMMARY    FIVE 1890 LAND-GRANT UNIVERSITIES (UMES, AA&MU, FAMU, SU, AND UAPB) HAVE FORMED A CONSORTIUM THAT AIMS AT ADDRESSING GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY CHALLENGES IN KENYA AND THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO, AND TRAINING A GLOBALLY COMPETENT WORKFORCE. THE PROJECT'S OBJECTIVES ARE TO: (1) DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN STRONG PARTNERSHIPS AMONG THE CONSORTIUM MEMBERS, USDA AGENCIES, AND KENYAN AND DRC'S PARTNERS TO ENHANCE FACULTY AND STUDENTS' TEACHING AND RESEARCH IN GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY; (2) DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE TECHNOLOGIES TO ENHANCE GLOBAL FOOD SUPPLY CHAINS AND REDUCE THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES; (3) INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF SMALLHOLDER FARMERS TO PRODUCE FOOD PRODUCTS AND PROMOTE THE USE OF APPROPRIATE PROCESSING TECHNOLOGIES.   INTEGRATED IN NATURE, THIS PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF A MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM OF FACULTY EAGER TO WORK IN A MUTUAL COLLABORATION WITH THEIR INTERNATIONAL COUNTERPARTS TO FIND SOLUTIONS THAT WOULD ADAPT TO LOCAL FOOD AND NUTRITION SECURITY CHALLENGES. THE CONSORTIUM'S UNIVERSITIES WILL LIAISE WITH MAJOR ACADEMIC AND RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS IN HOST COUNTRIES. THESE PARTNERSHIPS WILL HELP LEVERAGE THE COLLECTIVE CAPACITY AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER STRONG GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY PROGRAMS IN THE REGION. APPROXIMATELY 150 STUDENTS, 20 FACULTY, 12 INTERNATIONAL RESEARCHERS AND 50 STUDENTS AT THE PARTNER INSTITUTIONS WILL BE POSITIVELY IMPACTED BY THE PROJECT IN THE AREAS OF TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND EXTENSION. IN ADDITION, NUMEROUS SMALLHOLDER FARMERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT NOT ONLY DIRECTLY THROUGH TRAINING DONE BY CONSORTIUM'S FACULTY AND STUDENTS, BUT ALSO INDIRECTLY FROM LOCAL SCIENTISTS WHO HAVE BEEN TRAINED BY THEIR U.S. COUNTERPARTS.

ALL STRAINS OF CANNABIS SATIVA L., INCLUDING NON-INTOXICATING INDUSTRIAL HEMP, BECAME ILLEGAL AFTER THE 1937 MARIJUANA TAX ACT. THUS, FOR NEARLY A CENTURY, HEMP AND MARIJUANA REMAINED ILLEGAL IN MOST STATES UNTIL THE AGRICULTURE IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2018 REMOVED HEMP WITH < 0.3% DELTA-9-TETRAHYDROCANNABINOL (D9THC) FROM THE CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE LIST, WHICH ALLOWED HEMP TO BECOME A LEGAL AGRICULTURAL COMMODITY. HOWEVER, DUE TO THE SIGNIFICANT DURATION OF THE BAN, RESEARCH ON PEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES IS LIMITED. INSECT PESTS, DISEASES, AND WEEDS MAKES GROWING HEMP CHALLENGING. MOREOVER, THERE IS LIMITED INFORMATION ON PEST MANAGEMENT TACTICS FOR HEMP. HERE, WE PROPOSE TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: 1) MONITOR CEW MOTH CATCH USING DIFFERENT TRAP TYPES, CORRELATE WITH LARVAL PRESENCE IN THE HEMP FIELDS AND COMPARE LARVAL DENSITY, 2) ASSESS THE HOST PREFERENCES OF KEY INSECT PESTS OF HEMP USING DIFFERENT HEMP VARIETIES. IN ADDITION, FEEDING AND OVIPOSITION SITE SELECTION. 3) EVALUATE THE EFFICACY OF CURRENTLY REGISTERED BIOLOGICAL INSECTICIDES FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF ARTHROPOD PESTS AND DISEASES IN HEMP, 4) EXAMINE THE EFFECT OF CEW DAMAGE AND OTHER ARTHROPODS ON THE LEVEL OF TERPENOID, CBD AND D9THC CONTENT, 5) DETERMINE EFFECTS OF MINIMUM TILLAGE AND COVER CROPPING ON WEED AND INSECT PESTS, NATURAL ENEMY EFFICACY, AND INDUSTRIAL HEMP YIELD, 6) USE A MULTIFARIOUS EXTENSION PLAN TO TRANSFER KNOWLEDGE TO FARMERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, 7) DEVELOP INTRODUCTORY COURSE ON HEMP PRODUCTION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS STANDARD INTEGRATED PROJECT WILL COMBINE BASIC AND APPLIED RESEARCH, AS WELL AS EDUCATION AND EXTENSION TASKS. THE PROJECT WILL YIELD CAPACITY ON HEMP RESEARCH AND EDUCATION, AND TRAIN TWO GRADUATE AND THREE INTERN UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS.

IN AGRICULTURE, NITROGEN (N) BASED FERTILIZER ADDITION MAXIMIZES CROP PRODUCTIVITY AND WAS LARGELY THE REASON MANY COUNTRIES ACHIEVED FOOD SECURITY DURING THE GREEN REVOLUTION. ONE THE OTHER HAND, N-FERTILIZERS ARE PRODUCED BY THE HABER-BOSCH PROCESS WHICH REQUIRE ENVIRONMENTALLY DETRIMENTAL FOSSIL FUELS WHICH ARE AN ADDED EXPENSE TO FARMERS. TO ACHIEVE THE GOAL OF FOOD SECURITY VIA SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES WE MUST WORK TOWARDS SOLUTIONS THAT CAN HELP MITIGATE THE PROBLEMS OF EXCESS N-FERTILIZER USE WHILE RETAINING ALL THE BENEFITS OF NITROGEN AVAILABILITY TO PLANT PRODUCTIVITY. LEGUMES ARE THE MAINSTAY OF SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE BECAUSE THEY CAN ENTER INTO RELATIONSHIPS WITH SOIL BACTERIA CALLED RHIZOBIA OR FUNGI CALLED MYCORRHIZAE THAT, IN EXCHANGE FOR PHOTOSYNTHATES, SUPPLY THE LEGUME WITH PLANT-USABLE NITROGEN (N) AND PHOSPHORUS (P), RESPECTIVELY. OPTIMIZING PLANT INTERACTIONS WITH BENEFICIAL SOIL BACTERIA WHICH CAN HELP PROVIDE ESSENTIAL NITROGEN AND MAKE PLANT GROWTH ENTIRELY FERTILIZER INDEPENDENT IS AN ESSENTIAL STRATEGY TO SOLVING THE N PROBLEM OF AGRICULTURE. UNDERSTANDING THE MOLECULAR BASIS OF THIS INTERACTION THEREFORE IS OF UTMOST IMPORTANCE TO CURRENT LEGUME BREEDING PROGRAMS. WE WILL INVESTIGATE SMALL MOLECULES CALLED PEPTIDE HORMONES ENCODED IN PLANT GENOMES AND TEST THEIR EFFECTS ON THE ABILITY OF THE LEGUME MEDICAGO TRUNCATULA, TO NODULATE. WE WILL CATALOGUE THEIR EFFECTS ON THIS PROCESS USING ADVANCED GENE EDITING TECHNOLOGIES AND MOLECULAR BIOLOGICAL TOOLS. THISWILL HELP US ANTICIPATE CHANGES WE MIGHT EXPECT ON THE 'EPIGENOME' OF PLANTS SHOULD WE CHOOSE TO USE SYNTHETIC VERSIONS OF PEPTIDE HORMONES AS SPRAYS OR SEED COATS TO MODIFY LEGUME INTERACTIONS WITH THEIR SYMBIOTIC PARTNERS.INTEREST IN PLANT BIOLOGY AND AGRICULTURE IS DECLINING AMONG UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS HOWEVER STUDIES SHOW THAT INFUSING RESEARCH PROJECTS INTO PLANT SCIENCE CURRICULA CAN INCREASE INTEREST OF UNDERGRADUATES AND IMPROVE STUDENT RETENTION COMPARED TO LECTURE-BASED TEACHING ALONE. IN PARTICULAR, MODERN TECHNOLOGY INTENSIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS IN SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) FIELDS ARE CRUCIAL FOR STUDENT RETENTION AND ARE POSITIVELY ASSOCIATED WITH ENHANCED STUDENT LEARNING. THROUGH THIS PROJECT WE WILL PROVIDE UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES TO STUDENTSIN CRISPR (CLUSTERED REGULARLY INTERSPACED SHORT PALINDROMIC REPEATS) GENE EDITING; A TECHNOLOGY PROJECTED TO REVOLUTIONIZEAGRICULTURE. MOLECULAR BIOLOGY PROJECTS INVOLVING 'MODEL' PLANTS SUCH ASMEDICAGO TRUNCATULA (A CLOSE RELATIVE OF ALFALFA), CAN BE PERFORMED IN RELATIVELY SHORT PERIODS AND ARE OPTIMAL FORDEVELOPING HYPOTHESIS DRIVEN, ACTIVE-LEARNING RESEARCH PROJECTS FOR UNDERGRADUATES. THEOVERARCHING AIM OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MERGE RESEARCH BASED ON CUTTING EDGE TECHNOLOGIES IN LIFE SCIENCESSPECIFICALLY CRISPR-CAS9 GENE EDITING WITH ENHANCED STUDENT PARTICIPATION BY FACILITATING TIME-LIMITED,HYPOTHESIS-DRIVEN RESEARCH PROJECTS WHICH FIND CREATIVE SOLUTIONS TO THE N-PROBLEM OF AGRICULTURE.

BREAST CANCER IS THE MOST COMMON CANCER (1 IN 8 WOMEN) AND THE SECOND MOST COMMON CAUSE OF DEATH FROM CANCER IN AMERICAN WOMEN. INCREASING DATA SHOW A SIGNIFICANT DISPARITY OF BREAST CANCER OUTCOMES IN AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN (AAW). WHILE FOOD-DERIVED BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS HAVE BEEN EXTENSIVELY INVESTIGATED IN BREAST CANCER, THERE IS A BIG GAP BETWEEN THE REQUIRED HIGH DOSAGE (&MU;M) IN VITRO STUDIES AND THE LOW CIRCULATING LEVELS (NM) OF BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS IN HUMANS; OUR INNOVATIVE APPROACH TO BRIDGING THIS GAP OF CONCENTRATIONS IS TO COMBINE TWO OR MORE BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS TO SUPPRESS BREAST CANCER SYNERGISTICALLY.IN OUR PRELIMINARY STUDIES, WE IDENTIFIED TWO COMBINATIONS OF PHYTOCHEMICALS LUTEOLIN (LUT), CURCUMIN (CUR), OR INDOLE-3-CARBINOL (I3C), ABUNDANT IN COMMON FOODS SUCH AS PEPPERS, CABBAGE, CURCUMA LONGA, KALE, AND BROCCOLI, SYNERGISTICALLY INHIBITED BREAST CANCER IN WHITE WOMEN-DERIVED CELLS AND XENOGRAFT MICE. IN THE PRESENT STUDY, WE WILL INVESTIGATE IF THE TWO COMBINATIONSLUT+CUR, LUT+I3C SYNERGISTICALLY INHIBIT/PREVENT BREAST CANCER IN AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN, WHICH WILL FOCUS ON TWO OBJECTIVES: 1) INVESTIGATE IF AND HOW THE COMBINATIONS OF LUT+I3C AND LUT+CUR INHIBIT BREAST CANCER IN AAW-DERIVED BREAST CANCER CELL LINES AND XENOGRAFT MICE; 2) EXAMINE IF COMBINATORIAL INTAKES OF PHYTOCHEMICALS ARE ASSOCIATED WITH BREAST CANCER RISK AND MORTALITY IN THE SOUTHERN COMMUNITY COHORT STUDY, THE LARGEST COHORT STUDY OF AFRICAN AMERICANS.THE RESULTS OF THIS PROPOSAL WILL PROVIDE SOLID EVIDENCE THAT BREAST CANCER CAN BE TREATED/PREVENTED BY CONSUMING MORE BIOACTIVE CHEMICALS IN ABUNDANT VEGETABLES, WHICH ARE SIGNIFICANTLY LOWER AMONG AFRICAN AMERICANS. COMPLETING THIS PROJECT WILL SIGNIFICANTLY REINFORCE THE CAPACITY OF NUTRITION AND CANCER RESEARCH AT TSU AND ENHANCE THE COLLABORATIONS OF THE THREE INSTITUTIONS ON CANCER RESEARCH IN AFRICAN AMERICANS.

THE FOOD INDUSTRY, INCLUDING THE MEAT PROCESSING INDUSTRY, WAS HARD HIT BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, BOTH IN TERMS OF WORKER HEALTH AND ECONOMIC LOSSES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO GATHER THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS ON HOW TO MITIGATE THE SPREAD OF AIRBORNE VIRUSES IN FOOD INDUSTRY FACILITIES IN THE EVENT OF A FUTURE AIRBORNE VIRUS PANDEMICS.

THIS PROJECT WILL HELP DECREASE BOVINE VIRAL DIARRHEA AND RESPIRATORY DISEASE IN CATTLE IN KENTUCKY. THROUGH EDUCATING SMALL AND LIMITED RESOURCE CATTLE PRODUCERS, TESTING WILL INCREASE AND OVER THE COURSE OF THE GRANT THE POSITIVITY RATE FOR PERSISTENTLY INFECTED CATTLE WILL DECREASE. THE INNOVATION WILL BE BUILDING NEW RELATIONSHIPS AND INCREASING COMMUNICATION BETWEEN EXTENSION SERVICES, RETAIL FARM SUPPLY STORES AND VETERINARIANS IN PRIVATE PRACTICE. THROUGH THESE RELATIONSHIPS THE INDUSTRY AS A WHOLE WILL BE STRENGTHENED, DISEASE WILL DECREASE AND THE NEED FOR ANTIBIOTICS WILL LESSEN THUS PROMOTING SUSTAINABILITY FOR KENTUCKY FARMERS. AS THE GRANT BEGINS, RELATIONSHIPS WILL BE BUILT BY USING NEEDS ASSESSMENT SURVEYS AND FOCUS GROUPS TO HELP DEVELOP A CURRICULUM THAT BESTS SUPPORTS OUR STAKEHOLDERS. INFORMATION GAINED FROM THESE WILL THEN BE USED TO CREATE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND BE DISTRIBUTED TO FARMERS AT THE SAME SITE WHERE VACCINES ARE PURCHASED AS A CONVENIENCE FOR THE STAKEHOLDERS. EXTENSION SERVICES AND SALES STAFF WILL BE FURTHER EDUCATED TO BE ABLE TO ANSWER MORE SPECIFIC QUESTIONS. FOLLOW UPS WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH STAKEHOLDERS TO ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS THEY HAVE SEEN. THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY'S EXTENSION PROGRAM BY EXTENDING THE LIVESTOCK EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, REACH OUT TO NEW STAKEHOLDERS AND DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS WITH REGULATORY AGENCIES AND SMALL BUSINESSES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

ALTHOUGH BREASTFEEDING PROVIDES VALUABLE HEALTH BENEFITS FOR MOTHERS AND CHILDREN, RACIAL DISPARITIES RELATED TO BREASTFEEDING ARE PERVASIVE FOR COMMUNITIES OF COLOR. COMPARED TO THEIR WHITE COUNTERPARTS, BLACK MOTHERS HAVE THE LOWEST BREASTFEEDING RATES AND ARE LESS LIKELY TO RECEIVE ACCESS TO POSTPARTUM BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT COMPARED TO ANY GROUP IN THE UNITED STATES. INCREASING THE NUMBER OF LACTATION CONSULTANTS OF COLOR HAS BEEN PROVEN TO INCREASE BREASTFEEDING RATES AMONG WOMEN OF COLOR. NORTH CAROLINA A&T STATE UNIVERSITY IS THE FIRST PUBLIC HBCU TO OFFER A TRAINING PROGRAM TO PREPARE LACTATION CONSULTANTS. THE PROJECT'S PURPOSE IS TO BUILD A COMMUNITY-BASED LACTATION CLINIC TO ENHANCE STUDENT EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND, THROUGH INCREASED AWARENESS, INCREASE BREASTFEEDING RATES AND REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. BY ESTABLISHING A PROGRAM-BASED CLINIC, WE CREATE AN ADDITIONAL CLINICAL SITE FOR STUDENT PARTICIPATION WHILE PROVIDING THE COMMUNITY WITH INCREASED BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT. THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO: (1) ESTABLISH AND COORDINATE A HUMAN LACTATION COMMUNITY CLINIC TO INCREASE LACTATION ACCESS TO UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS AND BROADEN EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR N.C. A&T PATHWAY 2 STUDENTS; AND (2) SUPPORT STUDENTS' SUCCESS FOR ENTRY INTO THE LACTATION WORKFORCE THROUGH THE DEMONSTRATION OF ACADEMIC SUCCESS AND A 90% OR ABOVE PASS RATE ON THE IBLCE EXAM.

REGULATING A RIVER HAS MULTIPLE BENEFITS SUCH AS TRANSPORT, IRRIGATION, FLOODING CONTROL, HYDROPOWER ELECTRICITY AND ALSO IN DRINKING WATER SUPPLY. THIS REGULATION MODIFIES THE NATURAL RIVER FLOW BY IMPOSING FIELD CONDITIONS TO THE AQUATIC LIFE AND WATER QUALITY. THE IMPOSED FIELD CONDITIONS FAVOR THE PRODUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GASES SUCH AS METHANE, NITROUS OXIDE AND CARBON DIOXIDE WHICH ARE EMITTED TO THE ATMOSPHERE. FOR EXAMPLE, METHANE IS A POTENT GREENHOUSE GAS OF CONCERN IN CLIMATE CHANGE. GREENHOUSE GASES ARE EASILY IDENTIFIED BY BUBBLING IN SHALLOW BAY ZONES WHERE SEDIMENTATION AND STAGNANT WATER OCCUR. TO KNOW THE ROLE OF WATER QUALITY, ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS AND SEDIMENTS IN THE PRODUCTION OF GREENHOUSE GASES, THIS STUDY FOCUSES ON THE WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS PRODUCING METHANE AND CARBON DIOXIDE FOR THE KANAWHA RIVER, WEST VIRGINIA AS AN EXAMPLE OF A REGULATED RIVER. THE HIGH TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL VARIABILITY OF GREENHOUSE GAS FLUXES WILL BE INVESTIGATED WITH THE AIM TO EXPLAIN THE ROLE OF WATER QUALITY. ALSO, THE USE OF STATISTICS WILL ALLOW TO IDENTIFY THE MORE IMPORTANT WATER QUALITY VARIABLES DETERMINING GREENHOUSE GASES AS WELL AS THE POSSIBILITIES TO REDUCE INSTRUMENTATION IN THE FIELD. FINALLY, FIELD DATA COLLECTION AND STATISTICAL ANALYSES WILL SERVE AS A FRAMEWORK TO KNOW THE IMPACT OF GREENHOUSE GASES FROM REGULATED RIVERS IN OTHER REGIONS IN THE COUNTRY AND ELSEWHERE.

WHERE WE LOVE IS HOME---HOME THAT OUR FEET MAY LEAVE, BUT NOT OUR HEARTS. OLIVER WENDELL HOLMES SAID, I THINK, WHAT MOST WEST VIRGINIANS BELIEVE ABOUT THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. SOMETIMES WE MOVE AWAY--SOMETIMES WE HAVE TO FOR GREAT OPPORTUNITIES---BUT OUR HEARTS ARE ALWAYS IN THE FOOTHILLS AND FORESTS. SOWING YOUNG SPROUTS (SYS) AIMS TO INSTILL A LOVE NOT JUST OF APPALACHIA, BUT OF NATURE ITSELF, OF EARTH; TO OPEN YOUTH TO THE OPPORTUNITIES AT HOME AND ABROAD IN STEM FIELDS CONNECTED WITH NATURE, AGRICULTURE, AND CONSERVATION; AND, IN THE PROCESS, CHANGE THEIR RELATIONSHIPWITH SCIENCE AND BROADEN THEIR EXPECTATIONS FOR THE FUTURE.WV RANKS 43RD IN EDUCATION IN THE U.S. IN 2020, 74% OF WV FOURTH-GRADERS WERE NOT PROFICIENT IN READING (ANNIE E. CASEY FOUNDATION, 2021). HOW DO WE CHANGE THAT? THE ONLY PATH, MAYBE EVEN THE BEST PATH, IS NOT THROUGH FORMAL EDUCATION. NOT WHEN WE KNOW THAT ONLY 20% OF A CHILD'S LEARNING TIME IS IN A FORMAL SETTING (MORRIS ET AL., 2019). SYS WILL LEVERAGE THAT INFORMAL TIME BY SHIPPING HANDS-ON, EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING KITS DIRECT TO YOUTH---YOUTH WHO ARE HOMEBOUND OR SIMPLY UNABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN TRADITIONAL MODELS OF 4-H CLUBS, YOUTH WHO DO NOT HAVE ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE, RELIABLE INTERNET. THESE KITS WILL GIVE THEM THE OPPORTUNITIES TO TAP MAPLE TREES AND MAKE THEIR OWN MAPLE SUGAR, TO BUILD POLLINATOR GARDENS, TO EXPLORE WILDLIFE AND CONSERVATION IN REAL WAYS THAT PUT THEM INTO THE ENVIRONMENT AND LET THEM TAKE THE LEAD AS FARMERS, SCIENTISTS, AND CONSERVATIONISTS. WORKING WITH PARTNERS LIKE THE WV DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, WV CONSERVATION AGENCY, AND THE WV RAPTOR REHABILITATION CENTER EACH KIT WILL HAVE A UNIQUE FOCUS WITH CURRICULA DEVELOPED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SUBJECT EXPERTS AND INDIVIDUALS IN THE EXACT CAREER FIELDS THE YOUTH WILL BE EXPOSED TO. THROUGH ONLINE EXPERIENCES, PARTICIPANTS WILL MAKE CONNECTIONS WITH ONE ANOTHER, 4-H AGENTS, AND THE REPRESENTATIVES OF OUR PROGRAM PARTNERS. THEY'LL ALSO HAVE OPPORTUNITIES TO MEET UP IN PERSON AT EVENT DAYS WHERE THEY MIGHT MEET AN OWL GETTING REHABILITATED OR EXPLORE THE WVCA'S SOIL TUNNEL TRAILER.THE PROGRAM WILL PRODUCE CURRICULA AND KITS THAT WILL EVENTUALLY BE MADE AVAILABLE, AT A COST, TO EDUCATORS OUTSIDE OF THE STATE. THIS COST WILL HELP SUPPORT CONTINUING AND EXPANDING THE PROGRAM, FOR FREE, TO WV YOUTH. ALL PARTICIPANTS WILL COMPLETE PRE AND POST-SURVEYS SO THE SYS TEAM CAN GAUGE THE SUCCESS OF THE ACTIVITIES AND CURRICULA, CHANGING THEM AS NEEDED. PARTICIPANTS' ADULTS WILL ALSO BE ASKED TO COMPLETE SURVEYS ON THE PROGRAM, SO WE CAN GAUGE ITS RESPONSIVENESS AND APPROACH. FINALLY, A 4-H ADVISORY BOARD WILL BE ESTABLISHED TO HELP ENSURE THE TEAM IS ACCOUNTABLE FOR MEETING DEADLINES AND MOVING FORWARD AS INTENDED. THE BOARD WILL ALSO BE A MUCH-NEEDED FORUM FOR ONGOING STAKEHOLDER INPUT.WE BELIEVE THIS EXTENSIVE EVALUATION WILL SHOW THAT THE PROGRAM WILL HELP YOUTH HAVE MORE POSITIVE ATTITUDES ABOUT SCIENCE AS WELL AS THEIR BELIEF IN THEIR ABILITY TO DO SCIENCE. WE WANT YOUTH TO LEARN TO BE OPEN TO CHALLENGE AND DISCOVERY, TO BELIEVE THAT EVEN WHEN THINGS ARE HARD THEY CAN ACCOMPLISH THEM WITH HELP AND PERSEVERANCE. IN THE PURSUIT OF THAT, WE EXPECT THEY WILL ALSO LEARN MORE FACTS AND PRACTICES, BUT IT IS THAT QUESTIONING MINDSET, THAT CURIOSITY AND BELIEF IN SELF, THAT ARE MOST VITAL TO LEADING A HAPPY, FULFILLED, AND PRODUCTIVE LIFE; ULTIMATELY, THOSE INNER RESILIENCIES WILL SERVE THEM IN THE FUTURE CAREERS IN STEM WE HOPE THEY PURSUE.THE BROADER IMPACT TO THE WORLD IS BEST SUMMED UP BY JANE GOODALL: "ONLY IF WE UNDERSTAND, WILL WE CARE. ONLY IF WE CARE, WILL WE HELP. ONLY IF WE HELP, SHALL ALL BE SAVED." CLIMATE CHANGE AND CLIMATE REFUGEES AREN'T SOMETHING OF THE FUTURE, THEY EXIST NOW. SPECIES HAVE GONE EXTINCT IN THELIFETIME OF A CURRENT THIRD-GRADER. IN WV, YOUTH IN MANY AREAS HAVE EXPERIENCED NOT HAVING POTABLE WATER FOR WEEKS, MONTHS, OR EVEN YEARS DUE TO THE IMPACT OFPEOPLE. A FUTURE THAT IS SUSTAINABLE FOR EVERYONE RELIES ON SCIENCE AND SCIENCE THAT SEES CONSERVATION AS A RESPONSIBILITY INHERENT IN ITS WORK. IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THAT FUTURE, WE NEED PEOPLE---AND ESPECIALLY SCIENTISTS---THAT CARE FOR THE WORLD. THE BEST WAY TO COME TO CARE IS THROUGH CONNECTION. SYS WILL FOSTER THAT CONNECTION, ENCOURAGE CURIOSITY, AND HOPEFULLY BE A SMALL PART IN CREATING A WORLD THAT IS POPULATED BY THOSE WHO AIM TO DO WORK THAT CHANGES THE WORLD IN POSITIVE WAYS, THAT SEES SCIENCE AS A FORCE OF CREATIVE GOOD, AND THEN WORKS TO MAKE IT EXACTLY THAT.

OUR INTEGRATED PROJECT COMBINES TEACHING (EP) AND RESEARCH TO ADDRESS THE SHORTAGE OF GRADUATES IN THE FOOD, AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES AND NATURAL RESOURCES BY ESTABLISHING NEW UNDERGRADUATE COURSES AND EXPANDING EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING AT WEST VIRGINIA STATE UNIVERSITY (WVSU). WVSU LOST ITS LAND-GRANT PROGRAMS IN THE 1950S, BUT SINCE REGAINING THEM IN 2001, IS ADDING ACADEMIC PROGRAMMING TO COMPLETE ITS TRIPARTITE USDA MISSION. IN FALL 2020, THIS BECAME A REALITY WITH THREE NEW OPTIONS/CONCENTRATIONS IN EXISTING DEGREE PROGRAMS. THE PLANT AND SOIL SCIENCE OPTION IN THE BIOLOGY DEPARTMENT COMBINES THE FIELDS OF BIOLOGY AND CHEMISTRY WITH A PRACTICAL UNDERSTANDING OF CROP AND SOIL MANAGEMENT. THREE UPPER DIVISION CORE COURSES ARE TARGETED TO DEVELOP/TRIAL/ASSESS/REVISE 30 LABS/PROJECTS FOR THE STUDENTS IN THESE CLASSES TO LEARN CONCEPTS AND ADDRESS ISSUES IN THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES. ADDITIONAL EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING WILL BE UNDERTAKEN TO PROVIDE RESEARCH EXPERIENCES IN A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO MANAGE AND RESOLVE MAJOR NATURAL RESOURCE ISSUES IN WEST VIRGINIA. THE EXPERENTIAL LEARNING RESEARCH WILL EXPLORE ACID MINE DRAINAGE, AND ASSESS OUR UNDERSTANDING OF RARE EARTH ELEMENTS (REE) BIOGEOCHEMICAL PROCESSES AND IF PASSIVE TREATMENT FOR ACID MINE DRAINAGE COULD BE USED AS A POTENTIAL RECOVERY SYSTEM FOR REE. ONE HUNDRED TWENTY STUDENTS WILL BE IMPACTED BY THE NEW/REVISED COURSES, 10 WILL BE THE FIRST TO GRADUATE UNDER THE NEW BIOLOGY OPTION DURING THIS PROJECT AND NINE WILL HAVE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN NATURAL RESOURCES. OUR PROJECT BRINGS "AG" BACK TO WVSU ACADEMICALLY AND WILL ADD GRADUATES TO THE FOOD, AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES AND NATURAL RESOURCES PIPELINE.

THIS PROPOSAL FOCUSES ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TEACHING PROGRAM TO STUDY GENETIC PROCESSES AS ELUCIDATED BY MACHINE LEARNING AND PHENOMICS (WHICH HAVE SO FAR NOT BEEN WELL APPLIED IN TODAY'S CROP PHENOMICS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS), WHILE EXPLORING MODERN STRATEGIES OF GENOMICS. SPECIFICALLY, WE WILL PREPARE STUDENTS TO USE UP-TO-DATE PHENOMIC TOOLS THAT HAVE ALLOWED PLANT BREEDERS TO EXTRACT IMPORTANT KNOWLEDGE ABOUT CROP GENOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROPOSAL ISTRAINING OUR STUDENTS IN THE PHENOMIC PIPELINE AND ITS ROLE IN CROP PHENOMICS ANALYSES. WE OFFER OUR EXPERIENCE WITH VARIOUS PROJECTS AS TOOLS FOR EFFECTIVE RESEARCH-BASED TEACHING OF SCIENCE AND FOR A RICH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT EXPERIENCE FOR OTHER FACULTY. PLANT BREEDING HAS BEEN FUNDAMENTALLY CHANGED BY ML DRIVEN PHENOMICS APPROACHES OF CROP PLANTS. AIDED BY THE REVOLUTION IN ML AND PHENOMICS TECHNOLOGY, PROSPECTS FOR IMPROVING SUSTAINABLE YIELD AND QUALITY OF CROPS HAS CAUGHT THE PUBLIC AND COMMERCIAL EYE. ML AND PHENOMICS IS REVOLUTIONIZING THE DETECTION AND LARGE-SCALE SCREENING OF GERMPLASM ACCESSIONS FOR CROP IMPROVEMENT. THE RAPID GROWTH IN THE FIELD OF ML AND SYSTEMS GENOMICS HAS TRIGGERED TODAY'S SEVERE SHORTAGE OF QUALIFIED PROFESSIONALS. EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE SKILLED IN PHENOMICS ARE REGULARLY ANNOUNCED ON THE WEB (E.G., SCIENCE MAGAZINE) AND IN JOURNALS SUCH AS PLANT GENOMICS AND AMERICAN SOCIETY OF PLANT BIOLOGY. WITH THE INCREASE IN NEED FOR PLANT BREEDERS AND GENETICISTS WITH TRAINING IN ML AND PHENOMIC PIPELINES IN PRIVATE AND PUBLIC ENTERPRISES AND IN OUT-SOURCING OF SEQUENCING WORK BY MULTINATIONAL SEED COMPANIES, DEMAND FOR TRAINED PERSONNEL WILL CORRESPONDINGLY INCREASE.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO FAMILIARIZE STUDENTS WITH "MICROBIOMES" AND INTRODUCE THEM TO THE DIVERSITY OF GUT MICROBE ECOLOGY AND ITS RELATIONSHIP WITH VEGETABLES, FRUITS, FIBER-RICH OR PROBIOTIC DIETS. UNDERREPRESENTED AND MINORITY STUDENTS IN WEST VIRGINIA CAN DEVELOP HANDS-ON RESEARCH TO UNDERSTAND EFFECTS OF UNHEALTHY FATTY FOODS AND ARTIFICIAL SUGARS ON MICROBIOME CHANGES. THIS INTEGRATED RESEARCH AND TEACHING ENDEAVOR INTRODUCES STUDENTS TO NEXT-GENERATION SEQUENCING TOOLS AND BIG-DATA SCIENCE WHILE MAKING CONNECTIONS TO THE "TREE OF LIFE" AND UBIQUITY OF MICROBES AND ROLES. MOST IMPORTANTLY, THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON THE GUT BIOME OF THE MODEL ORGANISM DROSOPHILA AND BRINGS OUT THE CONCEPT OF A MINIATURIZED VERSION OF THE HUMAN GUT MICROBIOME. THE CURRENT PROPOSAL IS BASED ON SOUND RESEARCH RESULTS IN GENOME ANALYSIS, AND THE GENERATION OF SINGLE NUCLEOTIDE POLYMORPHISMS (SNPS), GENES, AND SEQUENCE INFORMATION FOR PHYTOCHEMICAL TRAITS INDUCING THE REDUCTION OF BODY WEIGHT IN DROSOPHILA. THIS PROPOSAL HAS A STRONG EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT THAT WILL IMPROVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL LEVELS OF OUR STUDENTS.

METHANE (CH4) FROM ENTERIC FERMENTATION BY RUMINANTS IS NOT ONLY AN IMPORTANT GREENHOUSE GAS ASSOCIATED WITH ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS, IT ALSO LEADS TO FEED ENERGY LOSS OF DIETARY GROSS ENERGY INTAKE (GEI). BIOACTIVE PLANT METABOLITES SUCH AS TANNINS CAN REDUCE CH4 EMISSIONS AND IMPROVE FEED CONVERSION EFFICIENCY. EXPERIMENTS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO EVALUATE TO EVALUATE EFFECTS OF REPLACING CORN WITH TANNIN-RICH SORGHUM GRAIN ON ANIMAL PERFORMANCE, FEED CONVERSION EFFICIENCY, RUMEN MICROBIOME COMPOSITION AND METHANE AND SHORT CHAIN VOLATILE FATTY ACIDS PRODUCTION. SPANISH MEAT GOAT BREEDS WILL BE USED IN PEN FEEDING. INDIRECT RESPIRATION CALORIMETRY TRIALS WHERE TANNIFEROUS SORGHUM GRAIN WILL PROGRESSIVELY REPLACE CORN IN A FORAGE TO CONCENTRATE DIET WILL ALSO BE EVALUATED. A FEEDING INCLUSION LEVEL OF SORGHUM GRAIN THAT LOWERS CH4 EMISSION AND IMPROVES NUTRITION, PERFORMANCE AND FEED CONVERSION EFFICIENCY WILL BE IDENTIFIED. THIS RESEARCH WILL LEAD TO DEVELOPMENT OF PRACTICAL MEANS OF MINIMIZING METHANE EMISSION BY RUMINANT LIVESTOCK BY USE OF SPECIFIC FEEDSTUFF TARGETING PARTICULAR PRODUCTION SETTINGS. RESEARCH CAPACITY WILL BE ENHANCED THROUGH UPGRADING THE CALORIMETRY SYSTEM USED TO QUANTIFY METHANE EMISSION AND CHARACTERIZE ENERGY UTILIZATION AND IMPROVED LABORATORY CAPABILITY AND TRAINING IN RUMEN MICROBIOLOGICAL TECHNIQUES FOR FUTURE RESEARCH IN THIS AND RELATED AREAS.

AS GLOBAL POPULATION CONTINUES TO INCREASE, ONE OF THE GREAT CHALLENGES WE ARE FACING TODAY IS TO INCREASE FOOD, FEED, FIBER, AND FUEL CROP PRODUCTION WHILE REDUCING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS. TO MEET FOOD AND ENERGY DEMANDS, LARGE AMOUNTS OF INORGANIC NITROGEN FERTILIZER ARE APPPLIED EACH YEAR TO AGRICULTURAL LANDS LEADINGTO SERIOUS PROBLEMS WITH SOIL GREENHOUSE GAS (I.E., NITROUS OXIDE N2O, CARBON DIOXIDE CO2 AND METHANE CH4) EMISSIONS TO THE ATMOSPHERE. IN THE PAST DECADES, CLIMATE-SMART AGRICULTURE(CSA) PRACTICES HAVE BEEN PROPOSED TO SIMULTANEOUSLY INCREASE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTIVITY, IMPROVE NITROGEN USE EFFICIENCY, BUILD AGRICULTURAL RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES, AND REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. THOSE AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES INCLUDE TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS THE USE OF LEGUME CROPS AND NITROGENFIXER TO REDUCE NITROGENAPPLICATION, THE USE OF NITRIFICATION INHIBITOR, BIOCHAR, AND NO-TILLAGE TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, PARTICULARLY N2O EMISSION. CROPLANDS ARE CONSIDERED BIOGEOCHEMICAL "HOTSPOTS" OF N2O EMISSION, ASA SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE TOTAL N2O EMISSION TO THE ATMOSPHERE COMES FROM CROPLANDS. HOWEVER, HOW THE CSA PRACRICES INFLLUENCE SOIL N2O EMISSION IN CORN AND SOYBEAN CROPPING SYSTEMS ARE STILL NOT ENTIRELY CLEAR.THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO INVESTIGATE THE IMPACTS OF SEVERAL CSA PRACTICES (I.E., REDUCE NITROGENAPPLICATION, NO-TILLAGE, NITRIFICATION INHIBITOR, BIOCHAR, AND CHICKEN MANURE) ON CROP PRODUCTION, NITROGENUSE EFFICIENCY, AND SOIL N2O EMISSION IN CORN AND SOYBEAN CROPPING SYSTEMS USING BOTH FIELD EXPERIMENTS, META-ANALYSIS, AND ECOSYSTEM MODELS, AND DEVELOP DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEMS AND ECONOMIC IMPACT ANALYSIS TOOLS TO IMPROVE RESOURCE USE EFFICIENCY AND ECONOMIC BENEFITS FOR FARMERS. THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE EFFECTS AND MECHANISMS OF CSA PRACTICES ON CROP PRODUCTION AND SOIL N2O EMISSION, AND SIGNIFICANTLY BUILD AND STRENGTHEN OUR RESEARCH AND EXTENSION CAPACITIES IN AGRO-ECOLOGY, CROP PRODUCTION, GLOBAL CLIMATE CHANGE, SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES.

THIS PROJECT FULLY INTEGRATES AN EFFORT AMONG EXTENSION PROFESSIONALS, FARMERS, AQUACULTURE RESEARCHERS, AND ENGINEERING RESEARCHERS TO ENHANCE DESIGN, MANAGEMENT, AND TRANSFER OF FLOATING RACEWAY TECHNOLOGY. IT FOSTERS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN AQUACULTURE INVESTIGATORS AT KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY, AND ENGINEERING INVESTIGATORS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY, TO TRAIN EXTENSION AGENTS IN THE POTENTIAL OF THIS TECHNOLOGY. INVESTIGATORS WILL IDENTIFY DIVERSE APPLICATIONS AND SELECT EIGHT FARMS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM FOR A FULL SEASON OF PRODUCTION. INVESTIGATORS AND EXTENSION MENTORS WILL FACILITATE INSTALLATION OF A FLOATING RACEWAY UNIT ON EACH FARM AND MONITOR EACH AS A CASE STUDY. THE NEW "SUSPENDED" DESIGN DEVELOPED AT KSU WILL BE EVALUATED FROM AN ENGINEERING PERSPECTIVE TO IMPROVE THE DESIGN BEFORE IT IS DEPLOYED TO THE FARM. INVESTIGATORS WILL EVALUATE A VARIABLE SPEED DEVICE FOR REDUCED ENERGY CONSUMPTION, ASSESS SLOW ROTATIONAL PADDLEWHEEL DESIGN, AND EVALUATE CONTROL SYSTEMS TO OBTAIN ACCURATE DATA AND MINIMIZE ENERGY CONSUMPTION. THEY WILL COMPARE POND AND FLOATING RACEWAY FOR PRODUCTION OF LARGEMOUTH BASS FROM FRY TO FINGERLINGS TO GROW-OUT. THEY WILL ASSESS FISH POPULATIONS AND WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS IN THE POND SUPPORTING THE RACEWAYS AND DEVELOP QUALITY EXTENSION PUBLICATIONS TARGETING THE SMALL FARM. PROJECT FOCUS WILL BE TO IMPROVE CAPACITY FOR SMALL FARMS TO INITIATE AN AQUACULTURE ENTERPRISE TARGETING THE LOCAL MARKET WITH A MODEST INVESTMENT AND RISK. AS SUCH, THIS INTEGRATED PROJECT HAS POTENTIAL TO DRAMATICALLY INCREASE USE OF WATER RESOURCES FOR SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTION OF FISH, ENGAGE NEW FARMERS, AND SUPPLY HIGH QUALITY, HIGH VALUE, HEALTHFUL PRODUCTS TO LOCAL MARKETS.

GLOBALLY AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND FOOD SECURITY ARE THREATENED BY THE WARMING TEMPERATURE. SUMMER TOMATO PRODUCTION IN THE US IS FACING CHALLENGES BY HEAT STRESS (HS)-INDUCED DISRUPTION OF POLLEN PRODUCTION AND FRUIT-SET AND TOMATO RIPENING PROCESS. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO DEVELOP THE RESEARCH/EDUCATION CAPACITY FOR PRODUCING CRISPR-CAS9-GENE EDITED MUTANTS TO BE USED FOR DEVELOPING HEAT-STRESS (HS) RESILIENT TOMATO VARIETIES; IT WILL PRIORITIZE AT IMPROVING THE HEAT TOLERANCE OF MALE GAMETOPHYTES WITH A FOCUS ON THE MOST HS-SENSITIVE POLLEN MOTHER CELLS. THE FOLLOWING THREE OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACHIEVED: OBJECTIVE 1). TO DEVELOP THE RESEARCH PLATFORM FOR PRODUCING AND CHARACTERIZING CRISPR/CAS9 TOMATO MUTANTS, WHICH INCLUDE THREE MODULES: A). PROCEDURES AND TOOLS FOR PREPARATION OF CONSTRUCTS, REGENERATION OF TRANSGENIC LINES AND VALIDATION OF CAS9-EDITED EVENTS AND MUTATIONS AT ON/OFF TARGETED REGIONS USING GENOTYPING; B). SINGLE CELL-TYPE TRANSCRIPTOMICS AND PROTEOMICS ANALYSIS OF POLLEN CELLS IN MUTANT LINES TO CONFIRM MUTATIONS OF THE TARGETED GENES AT TRANSCRIPT AND PROTEIN LEVELS; AND TO IDENTIFY DIFFERENTIAL EXPRESSION IN TRANSCRIPTS/PROTEINS BETWEEN MUTANT AND WILD-TYPE LINES THUS DEFINING THE FUNCTION OF THE GENE MUTATION RELATED TO HS TOLERANCE; C). DEVELOPING A AI MACHINE LEARNING (ML) AND DEEP LEARNING (DL) SYSTEM FOR PHENOTYPING POLLEN HEAT TOLERANCE; AND PHENOTYPING OF MUTANT PLANTS; OBJECTIVE 2). TO GENERATE MUTANT LINES FOR GENES AFFECTING PMCS MEIOTIC ACTIVITIES UNDER HS AND SELECT FOR HS TOLERANCE; OBJECTIVE 3). TO ENHANCE 1890 EDUCATION/TRAINING CAPACITY BY TRAINING GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN BIOTECH AND AI TECHNOLOGIES. PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL STRENGTHEN THE AGRICULTURAL BIOTECH PROGRAM AT 1890S.

RECENT ADVANCES IN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) ESPECIALLY DEEP LEARNING AND BIG DATA ANALYTICS HAVE CREATED EXCITING NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR APPLICATIONS IN PRECISION AGRICULTURE. IN THIS PROJECT, A FRAMEWORK OF AGRICULTURE DATA ANALYTICS FOR CROP/VEGETATION HEALTH PREDICTION AND OPTIMIZATION IS PROPOSED TO CREATE NOVEL PARADIGM-SHIFTING APPROACHES FOR QUANTITATIVELY EVALUATING CROP/VEGETATION HEALTH USING MULTI-SCALE MULTI-RESOLUTION DATA. THREE RESEARCH AND EXTENSION OBJECTIVES ARE PROPOSED TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL: 1) COLLECT MULTI-SCALE MULTI-RESOLUTION DATA OF CROP/VEGETATION HEALTH AT PVAMU RESEARCH FARM, BY GROUND SENSORS AND DRONES, TO COMPLEMENT SATELLITE DATA; 2) APPLY AND DEVELOP CUTTING EDGE DEEP LEARNING ALGORITHMS FOR CROP/VEGETATION HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND PREDICTION; 3) DEVELOP A VISUALIZATION/WEBAPP TOOL FOR THE PROPOSED CROP/VEGETATION HEALTH PREDICTION AND OPTIMIZATION ON PVAMU RESEARCH FARM TO ENHANCE RESEARCH AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES, AND EDUCATE AND TRAIN LIMITED RESOURCE FARMERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS ON OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT. IF SUCCESSFUL, THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT FARMERS AND GROWERS TO APPLY THE BEST AGRICULTURAL MANAGEMENT PRACTICE AND IMPROVEYIELD.
