FURTHERMORE, THIS PROJECT IS MULTIDISCIPLINARY IN NATURE AND IT WILL FOSTER COLLABORATIONS BETWEEN EXPERTS IN AGRICULTURE AND AI RESEARCHERS AND DATA SCIENTISTS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL HELP DIFFERENT STAKEHOLDERS SUCH AS FARMERS TO COLLABORATE WITH SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS, TO APPLY AI ESPECIALLY DEEP LEARNING AND BIG DATA ANALYTICS TO EXTRACT VALUABLE KNOWLEDGE FROM BIG AGRICULTURE DATASETS AND TRANSFORM THE KNOWLEDGE INTO ACTIONABLE STRATEGIES. THIS WILL MAKE AMERICA'S FARMERS MORE COMPETITIVE IN THE GLOBAL AGRICULTURAL MARKET AND CONTRIBUTE TO A STRONG AND SUSTAINABLE ECONOMY.

DEVELOPMENTS IN UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEM (UAS) TECHNOLOGY AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) APPROACHES CONTRIBUTED TO UNPRECEDENTED INTEREST IN DEVELOPING AI-BASED UAS APPLICATIONS (AI-UAS-AG) TO BENEFIT THE AGRICULTURAL SECTOR. HOWEVER, MINORITY FARMERS DID NOT BENEFIT FROM PRECISION AGRICULTURE (PA) TECHNOLOGIES BECAUSE VERY FEW PA TECHNOLOGIES MIGHT BE COST-EFFECTIVE AND ADEQUATE TO THEIR NEEDS. THE MAIN GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD PVMAU'S CAPACITY IN CONDUCTING RESEARCH, TEACHING, AND TRAINING FUTURE MINORITY PROFESSIONALS AND FARMERS IN THE AREA OF PA IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA, TWO USDA-ARS-LABORATORIES, AND THE NEWLY FUNDED UC-DAVIS AIFS CENTER. THE TEAM WILL USE AN INTEGRATED AI-UAS-AG APPROACH THAT HARNESSES THE POWER OF AI, UAS, AND SENSOR-BASED METHODS TO DETECT, IDENTIFY AND QUANTIFY VARIOUS TYPES OF CROP AND ECOSYSTEM STRESSES. THE AI-UAS-AG APPROACH IS BASED ON A: I) NEED TO DEVELOP AI-BASED ANALYTICS FOR COMPLEX DATA REQUIREMENTS IN AGRICULTURE, II) MANDATE TO ASCERTAIN AND DEVELOP PROCEDURES AND BEST PRACTICES THAT ARE SITE, CROP, AND ENVIRONMENT-SPECIFIC, AND III) IMPROVE CAPABILITIES RELATED TO THE DETECTION OF CROP STRESSES WITH REMOTE SENSING. THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE NEEDS OF MINORITY COMMUNITIES, WHO HAVE YET TO PROFIT FROM THESE TECHNOLOGIES. WE ARE FOCUSING ON PLANT STRESSES. FIELD EXPERIMENTS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DEVELOP SITE-SPECIFIC CROP RESPONSES USING AI-UAS-AG TOOLS AND APPROACHES, INCLUDING SMART APPS INTRODUCED TO FARMERS TO HELP THEM UNDERSTAND HOW TO USE THEM AND BENEFIT FROM THEM IN THEIR OPERATIONS. STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED, AND OUR EXTERNAL PARTNERS WILL ENRICH TEACHING CURRICULA IN COLLABORATION.

THIS TEACHING PROJECT WILL DEVELOP ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND COLLABORATIVE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO ENHANCE THE AI EDUCATION IN THE BIOLOGICAL ENGINEERING AND NATURAL RESOURCES CURRICULA THROUGH LECTURES AND PRACTICAL HANDS-ON TRAINING. A SERIES OF AI-BASED LECTURES, LABORATORY EXERCISES AND SEMESTER-LONG COURSE PROJECTS WILL BE DEVELOPED TO BETTER PREPARE AND TRAIN STUDENTS WITH THE NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF AI TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES FOR THEIR APPLICATIONS IN AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD PRODUCTION AND BIO-MANUFACTURING. THE PROJECT'S PRIMARY AUDIENCE WILL BE BACHELOR'S DEGREE STUDENTS IN BIOLOGICAL ENGINEERING AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WHO WILL CONDUCT AI-BASED RESEARCH IN THE PROPOSED DISCIPLINARY FIELDS TOWARD THEIR THESES AND DISSERTATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL PROMOTE COLLABORATIVE LEARNING AMONG UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO INCREASE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF LEARNING AND TEACHING SOPHISTICATED AI TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES WITH LIMITED TIME AND RESOURCES. WITH THE HANDS-ON PRACTICE USING THE AI LABORATORY EXERCISE AND COURSE PROJECTS, LEARNERS WILL BE ABLE TO DESIGN APPROPRIATE AI-BASED SOLUTIONS APPLIED TO THE AGRICULTURAL, FOOD AND BIO-MANUFACTURING INDUSTRIES. AS A RESULT, STUDENTS WILL BE BETTER PREPARED TO COMPETE FOR JOBS IN THE EMERGING AI FIELD AND REVOLUTIONIZE THE AGRICULTURAL AND FOOD PRODUCTION SYSTEMS. THE AI LABORATORY UNITS WILL ALSO INCREASE THE VISIBILITY OF MODERN INSTRUMENTS AND ENGINEERING TOOLS IN OUR RESEARCH LABS TO ASSIST WITH STUDENT RECRUITMENT AND FACILITATE INDUSTRIAL COLLABORATION.

IN 2020-2025, 59,400 JOB OPENINGS IN FOOD, AGRICULTURE, RENEWABLE NATURAL RESOURCES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT (FARNRE) WILL BE AVAILABLE ANNUALLY FOR NEW COLLEGE GRADUATES TO FILL FROM FARNRE AND ALLIED DISCIPLINES, WITH 31% OF THESE JOBS AVAILABLE IN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, AND 13% IN FOOD AND BIOMATERIALS. IT IS KNOWN THAT FEWER THAN 40% OF STUDENTS ENROLLED IN STEM COMPLETE THEIR DEGREES, AND MERELY INCREASING THE STEM RETENTION FROM 40% TO 50% COULD PRODUCE THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF STEM GRADUATES. ONE OF THE RECOMMENDED STRATEGIES FOR RETAINING AND RECRUITMENT OF STEM STUDENTS IS MODIFYING PEDAGOGICAL APPROACHES TO INTEGRATE RESEARCH EXPERIENCE TO ALL STUDENTS ENROLLED IN A COURSE BY OFFERING COURSE BASED UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH EXPERIENCE (CURE/CRE). ACCORDINGLY, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO STRENGTHEN OUR CAPACITY BY ACQUIRING EQUIPMENT CAPABLE OF HIGH-THROUGHPUT PROCESSING, AND INTEGRATING THE TECHNOLOGY WITH AGRICULTURE CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION. THE FIRST OBJECTIVE IS TO UPGRADE OUR EXISTING BIOLOG MICROSTATION TO OMNILOG PHENOTYPIC MICROARRAY FOR CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION TO ALLOW BOTH IDENTIFICATION OF MICROBES, AND ASSESS THEIR METABOLIC SIGNATURES. THE SECOND OBJECTIVE IS TO INTRODUCE MODIFIED-CRE IN EIGHT UNDERGRADUATE CORE COURSES (SIX IN AGRICULTURE AND TWO IN BIOLOGY) AND USE THE OMNILOG FOR STUDENT LED DISCOVERY OF CORE MICROBIOLOGY/AGRICULTURE CONCEPTS. THE EIGHT COURSES TAUGHT BY SIX INSTRUCTORS COVERING A RANGE OF COURSES WILL OFFER URE TO 195 STUDENTS PER YEAR. THE MODIFIED-CRE WILL BE EVALUATED USING LATEST EVALUATION TOOLS LIKE EVALUATEUR-CURE. OVER THE PERIOD OF THIS PROJECT, EIGHT COURSES OFFERED THREE TIMES WILL OFFER INSIGHTS INTO THE ADOPTION OF THIS PEDAGOGICAL APPROACH IN AGRICULTURE CURRICULUM. BY THE INTRODUCTION OF MODIFIED-CRE IN AGRICULTURE MICROBIOLOGY EDUCATION, WE AIM TO BUILD CAPACITY IN INTEGRATING NOVEL AND MODERN PEDAGOGICAL STRATEGIES PREVIOUSLY NOT ADOPTED IN THE AGRICULTURE CURRICULA AT ALCORN.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ADDRESS THE NEED FOR AGE-SPECIFIC NUTRITION EDUCATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF MINORITY, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED, AND UNDERSERVED SENIOR ADULTS, 65 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP IN CREATING AWARENESS TOWARDS HEALTHY EATING, AND INCREASED REQUIREMENT OF CERTAIN NUTRIENTS WHILE AGING, (E.G. QUALITY PROTEINS, CALCIUM, AND VITAMIN D), IN DAILY DIET. THIS PROJECT WOULD ALSO INCLUDE EDUCATING SENIORS ABOUT THE INCORPORATION OF EASILY DOABLE PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES IN THE DAILY ROUTINE.THE COVID-19 GLOBAL PANDEMIC HAS BROUGHT TO LIGHT THAT OLDER ADULTS WITH COMORBIDITIES, INCLUDING CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS LIKE DIABETES AND HYPERTENSION, OBESITY, WERE AT GREATER RISK OF SEVERE ILLNESS, NEEDING HOSPITALIZATION, AND MEDICAL ASSISTANCE. THE BABY BOOMER GENERATION MAKES UP A SUBSTANTIAL SEGMENT OF THE POPULATION IN THE UNITED STATES (21%) AND IS A SIGNIFICANT PART OF THE WORLD POPULATION. THIS GENERATION IS NOW AGING, AND A LARGE NUMBER IS ABOVE THE AGE OF 65 YEARS. THE CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS ARE MORE PREVALENT IN MINORITY, SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED, AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. THERE IS AN URGENT NEED FOR DEVELOPING EASY-TO-COMPREHEND NUTRITION EDUCATION RESOURCES, CATERING TO THE SPECIFIC NUTRITION AND DIET NEEDS OF OUR ELDERLY AND RESOURCES TO EDUCATE THEM ABOUT BEING PHYSICALLY ACTIVE AS ONE GETS OLDER, THROUGH SIMPLE ACTIVITIES AND EASY EXERCISES. GAINING UPDATED KNOWLEDGE ABOUT EATING HEALTHY FOOD, MAINTAINING A GOOD NUTRITION STATUS, AND INCLUDING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY IN DAILY ROUTINE WILL HELP THEM IN MANAGEMENT OF CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS.NUTRITION PLAYS A MAJOR ROLE IN MAINTAINING THE PHYSICAL, MENTAL, AND SOCIAL HEALTH OF AGING ADULTS. NUTRITION GREATLY INFLUENCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN OLD AGE WHEN MAJOR PHYSIOLOGICAL CHANGES OCCUR IN OUR BODY. THESE CAN INCLUDE DECREASED BONE DENSITY, INCREASED NEED FOR QUALITY PROTEINS, AND REDUCTION OF CALORIC NEEDS. THERE ARE PHYSICAL LIMITATIONS LIKE LIMITED MOBILITY, COMPROMISED HEALTH, INABILITY TOCOOK AND EAT FOOD, REDUCED VISION, AND MANY MORE. OLD AGE CAN ALSO BRING MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL CHANGES LIKE DECREASED MEMORY, FORGETFULNESS, AND FEELING OF LONELINESS. SIMPLE THINGS BECOME DIFFICULT TASKS, LIKE OPENING A JAR OR CAN, CHEWING CERTAIN FOODS, OR HOLDING A PLATE FULL OF FOOD. FOR VARIOUS REASONS, GROCERY SHOPPING, INCLUDING READING FOOD LABELS AND EXPIRATION DATES AND DECIDING WHAT TO BUY, CAN BECOME DIFFICULT AS WE AGE. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, WE WILL EDUCATE OUR SENIORS TO MAKE HEALTHY AFFORDABLE FOOD CHOICES, COOK SIMPLE-TO-MAKE RECIPES, TIPS FOR GROCERY SHOPPING, WORKING SAFE IN THE KITCHEN, UNDERSTAND FOOD REQUIREMENTS ACCORDING TO MEDICAL NEEDS, AND OTHER RELATED TOPICS. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF HEALTHY EATING HABITS, AND LIFESTYLE CHANGES USEFUL IN OLD AGE, THROUGH NUTRITION EDUCATION AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY SESSIONS.WE WILL BEGIN WITH CONDUCTING NEEDS ASSESSMENT SURVEYS, FOCUS GROUPS, DISCUSSION, AND LISTENING SESSIONS AT SENIOR CENTERS AND SENIOR LIVING FACILITIES, TO UNDERSTAND CHALLENGES AND PERSPECTIVES OF OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY. WE WILL DEVELOP 'SENIOR ADULT NUTRITION EDUCATION CURRICULUM' AND OTHER RESOURCES, DIRECTED BY NEEDS ASSESSMENT CONDUCTED EARLIER. THE TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE COUNTY-BASED EXTENSION PROFESSIONALS TO RECRUIT PARTICIPANTS, CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL SESSIONS AND DOING HANDS ON HEALTHY RECIPE DEMONSTRATIONS WITH THE SENIOR ADULT PARTICIPANTS. WE WILL POST THE EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES ONLINE, ON THE SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS LIKE, COUNTY FACEBOOK PAGES, INSTAGRAM, AND YOUTUBE FOR REACHING OUT TO WIDER AUDIENCE. GRADUATE STUDENTS FROM MINORITY AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WILL BE INVOLVED AND TRAINED TO ASSIST WITH ALL THE ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT. PRE AND POST-EDUCATIONAL SURVEYS WILL BE CREATED AND CONDUCTED IN THE BEGINNING AND AT THE END OF THE SESSIONS. THE FOLLOW UP SURVEYS, TO ASSESS THE BEHAVIORAL AND LIFESTYLE CHANGES, WILL BE CONDUCTED AFTER 3 TO 4 MONTHS USING CONTACT INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE PARTICIPANTS AT THE TIME OF REGISTRATION. THE DATA COLLECTED WILL BE EVALUATED BY ASSIGNED EVALUATION COMMITTEE MEMBERS FOR THIS PROJECT. THE EVALUATIONS WILL MEASURE THE IMPACT AND SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT IN CREATING HEALTHY EATING AWARENESS AND MAKING POSITIVE LIFESTYLE CHANGES BY THE SENIOR ADULT PARTICIPANTS IN DAILY LIFE. THE RESULTS WILL BE SHARED TO SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY AND THE TARGET AUDIENCE THROUGH PROFESSIONAL CONFERENCES, WEBINARS, PEER REVIEWED PUBLICATIONS, NEWS ARTICLES, INFORMATION SHEETS, AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS.AT THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT, WE ARE EXPECTING PARTICIPANTS TO GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND ADOPT HEALTHY EATING HABITSTO FULFILL AGE SPECIFIC NUTRITION REQUIREMENTS. WE ARE EXPECTING PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME PHYSICALLY MORE ACTIVE AND INCLUDE SOME ACTIVITY IN DAILY LIFE. WE ARE HOPING THAT THE OLDER ADULTS WILL MAKE INFORMED FOOD CHOICES BY APPLYING KNOWLEDGE GAINED THROUGH NUTRITION EDUCATION. WE ARE LOOKING FORWARD TO SEE THAT OUR OLDER ADULT POPULATION HAS KNOWLEDGE TO MAINTAIN HEALTHY NUTRITIONAL STATUS AND WILL BE BETTER EQUIPPED TO MANAGE THEIR CHRONIC HEALTH ISSUES, BY EATING HEALTHY FOOD AND BEING PHYSICALLY ACTIVE.

LOW FERTILIZER UTILIZATION RATE AND FREQUENT DROUGHT ARE TWO MAJOR CHALLENGES IN THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY. HYDROGELS WITH HIGH WATER ABSORPTION CAPACITY HAVE BEEN EXPLORED AS NOVEL MATERIALS FOR SOIL WATER RETENTION TO ALLEVIATE THE IMPACT OF DROUGHT. HOWEVER, HYDROGELS HAVE LOW MECHANICAL STRENGTH, AND THEIR SWELLING IS DRAMATICALLY SUPPRESSED IN SOIL MATRIX, SIGNIFICANTLY INHIBITING THEIR EFFECTIVENESS IN WATER RETENTION IN SOIL. THIS COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH WILL EMBED CROSSLINKED CARBON NANOTUBES (XCNT) AS NANO-SKELETONS IN HYDROGELS TO SUBSTANTIALLY INCREASE THEIR MECHANICAL STRENGTH AND MAXIMIZE THEIR SWELLING SPACES IN THE SOIL IN MULTIPLE WETTING-DRYING CYCLES. SIMULTANEOUSLY, THE XCNT-HYDROGEL NANOCOMPOSITE WILL FUNCTION AS A SLOW-RELEASING FERTILIZER. UREA WILL BE USED AS A MODEL FERTILIZER TO INVESTIGATE THE FERTILIZER LOADING CAPACITY AND RELEASING KINETICS OF THE HYDROGEL NANOCOMPOSITE. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE (1): TO SYNTHESIZE AND CHARACTERIZE XCNT-EMBEDDED HYDROGEL NANOCOMPOSITE; (2) TO DEMONSTRATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROPOSED HYDROGEL NANOCOMPOSITE FOR ENHANCED SOIL MOISTURE RETAINMENT AND FERTILIZER UTILIZATION IN GREENHOUSE STUDIES; AND (3) TO INVESTIGATE THE EFFICACY OF HYDROGEL NANOCOMPOSITES IN FIELD CONDITIONS IN TEXAS. OVERALL, THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES MULTIPLE CRITICAL NEEDS IN THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY BY DEVELOPING A NOVEL MULTIFUNCTIONAL NANOCOMPOSITE THAT CAN SIMULTANEOUSLY MAXIMIZE WATER RETENTION, SUSTAIN FERTILIZER RELEASE, AND MINIMIZE NEGATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL CONSEQUENCES FROM AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION. THE PROPOSAL WILL STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY BUILDING IN DIFFERENT AREAS AT PRAIRIE VIEW A&M UNIVERSITY, INCLUDING SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, CHEMISTRY, MATERIALS SCIENCE, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE.

THE MAJOR GRAIN CROPS PROVIDE MOST OF THE GLOBAL CALORIC NEEDS. THE DEMAND FOR THESE CROPS WILL INCREASE IN THE COMING DECADES TO FEED THE GROWING WORLD POPULATION. HOWEVER, THE RELATIVE YIELD GAINS OF THESE CROPS HAVE DECLINED IN RECENT DECADES, AND GROWING THESE CROPS IS BECOMING LESS PROFITABLE FOR US FARMERS. OUR LONG-TERM GOAL IS TO INCREASE THE YIELD OF THESE CROPS THROUGH OPTIMIZING SHOOT BRANCHING, WHICH IS A MAJOR TRAIT THAT SIGNIFICANTLY INFLUENCE RESOURCE USE EFFICIENCY AND YIELD. THE MAJOR CROPS DEVELOP MANY BRANCHES DURING THE VEGETATIVE AND REPRODUCTIVE STAGE. MOST OF THE BRANCHES ARE NOT PRODUCTIVE BECAUSE THEY SENESCE BEFORE FLOWERING AND PRODUCING GRAINS. THE UNPRODUCTIVE BRANCHES COMPETE FOR LIGHT AND NUTRIENTS WITH THE PRODUCTIVE BRANCHES. THE COMPETITION FOR RESOURCES REDUCES THE GROWTH AND YIELD OF THE PRODUCTIVE BRANCHES. DEVELOPING NEW CROP TYPES WITH FEWER UNPRODUCTIVE BRANCHES COULD IMPROVE THE GROWTH OF THE PRODUCTIVE BRANCHES AND INCREASE YIELD. HOWEVER, MORE KNOWLEDGE OF GENES THAT REGULATE SHOOT BRANCHING IS NEEDED TO DEVELOP THE NEW CROP TYPES. BRANCHES DEVELOP FROM BUDS IN THE AXIL OF LEAVES. THE BUDS EITHER GROW INTO BRANCHES OR REMAIN DORMANT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY CANDIDATE GENES THAT CONTROL AXILLARY BUD DORMANCY AND OUTGROWTH USING SORGHUM AND MAIZE AS MODELS. THE GENES WILL BE IDENTIFIED USING TWO APPROACHES, MOLECULAR AND GENETIC. THE GENES WILL ENABLE TO IMPROVING SHOOT BRANCHING AND INCREASING CROP YIELD, AND ENSURE SUSTAINABLE AND PROFITABLE CROP PRODUCTION IN THE US, AND SATISFY THE GLOBAL DEMAND FOR FOOD.

THE FASHION INDUSTRY HAS BEEN DRAMATICALLY IMPACTED BY INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY IN THE PAST DECADE, ESPECIALLY IN TECHNOLOGY IN APPAREL/FASHION DESIGNING AND TEXTILE PRODUCTIONS AND DIGITAL CHANNELS AND ONLINE COMMUNICATION BY FASHION BRANDS. THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC PUSHED FASHION PROGRAMS TO BE MORE OPEN TO DIGITAL TEACHING AND LEARNING OPTIONS. AT THE SAME TIME, THE CRISIS FORCED CHANGES IN THE FASHION INDUSTRY AND A HIGHER DEMAND FOR DIGITAL-WORK TRENDS PREVAILS IN THE CURRENT MARKET. AS THE INDUSTRY OPENS UP UNCONVENTIONAL CAREER PATHS AND WORK PATTERNS, FASHION PROGRAMS MUST EVOLVE AND ADAPT TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO SUCCEED IN A NEW MARKET. THE PROPOSED PROJECT SUPPORTS THE CURRENT DEMAND OF THE FASHION INDUSTRY BY EXPANDING COURSE DELIVERY AND LEARNING OPTIONS AND OPENING ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS TO LEARN AND EXPLORE DIGITAL TOOLS RELEVANT TO CURRENT FASHION INDUSTRY TRENDS. IT WILL ENABLE FASHION EDUCATORS TO DEVELOP DISTANCE-LEARNING COURSES FOR PART-TIME FASHION STUDENTS AND DEVELOP NEW TEACHING FORMATS SUCH AS HYBRID, BLENDED OR FLIPPED LEARNING, THAT CAN BRING MORE FLEXIBILITY TO TEACHING AND LEARNING. THIS PROJECT AID STUDENT BY ENHANCING THEIR DESIGN KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS DUE TO MORE PERSONALIZED NATURE OF LEARNING, BRING FLEXIBILITY IN THE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT BY ENABLING ACCESS OF COURSE MATERIAL TO STUDENTS AT ANY PLACE AND TIME; AND ENHANCED OPPORTUNITIES TO SECURE WELL-PAID JOB POSITIONS IN THE FASHION INDUSTRY OR PURSUE HIGHER EDUCATION

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE RUMINANT NUTRITION LABORATORY (IRNL) TO PROVIDE MINORITY UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WITH IMMERSIVE LEARNING EXPERIENCES TO HELP THEM DEVELOP THREE FUNDAMENTAL SKILLS (FEED FORMULATION AND EVALUATION, PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION, AND DATA MANAGEMENT) REQUIRED FOR GRADUATE SCHOOL OR EMPLOYMENT IN THE LIVESTOCK FEED INDUSTRY. FOUR FACULTY AND 5 INDUSTRY AND USDA-ARS COLLABORATORS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO CREATE A ROUTE FOR MINORITY STUDENTS TO INTEGRATE CLASSROOM LEARNING AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING TO DEVELOP THESE INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC SKILLS. THIS WILL BE ADDRESSED BY FOLLOWING THESE OBJECTIVES: 1) DEVELOP A MODIFIED COURSE-BASED UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH EXPERIENCE (CURE) WITH A SPECIAL FOCUS ON FEED FORMULATION AND PRODUCTS EVALUATION, 2) DEVELOP A SECOND MODIFIED CURE DESIGNED FOR PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, AND 3) DEVELOP A THIRD MODIFIED CURE TO IMPROVE STUDENTS' PROBLEM-SOLVING AND COMPUTATIONAL SKILLS THROUGH DATA MANAGEMENT. EACH YEAR, 30 STUDENTS FROM THESE 3 CLASSES WILL BE RECRUITED INTO THE IRNL TRACK TO UNDERTAKE INDEPENDENT SMALL-TEAM (5 STUDENTS) RESEARCH STUDIES. TO ACHIEVE THE THREE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES, THE TEAM WILL INTEGRATE THE PROPOSED PROJECT WITH TWO OTHER FEDERALLY FUNDED PROJECTS BY THE PD TO MAKE THE LEARNING PROCESS AS REAL AS POSSIBLE FOR THE STUDENTS. ABOUT 660 STUDENTS (220 STUDENTS/YEAR) WILL BE REACHED THROUGH THE MODIFIED CURES AND 90 STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED IN THE IRNL TRACK. THE IRNL WILL ALSO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING ACTIVITIES LIKE SMALL GROUP AND INDIVIDUAL STUDIES, SUMMER INTERNSHIPS, FIELD TRIPS, OPPORTUNITIES TO SERVE AS RESEARCH MENTORS, TEAM-BUILDING EXERCISES AND WORKSHOPS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE, LEADERSHIP AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS.

QUINOA GRAIN IS EATEN WORLDWIDE AS A HEALTHY FOOD, BUT CONSUMPTION OF QUINOA LEAVES IS UNCOMMON. THE FRESH YOUNG LEAVES AND TENDER SHOOTS OF QUINOA CAN BE EATEN IN SALADS OR COOKED AS VEGETABLES. THE TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE SUGGESTS THAT DAILY INTAKE OF AT LEAST ONE SERVING OF LEAFY GREENS CAN PREVENT CHRONIC DISEASES, INCLUDING HEART DISEASES, CANCER, DIABETES, OBESITY, AND MICRONUTRIENTS DEFICIENCIES; HOWEVER, SCIENTIFICALLY, VERY LITTLE IS KNOWN ON THE NUTRITIONAL, PHYTOCHEMICAL COMPOSITIONS, AND HUMAN HEALTH BENEFITS OF GREEN LEAVES OF QUINOA. WE HYPOTHESIZE THAT CONSUMPTION OF QUINOA LEAVES PROVIDES NUTRIENTS THAT PREVENT AND/OR TREAT CHRONIC DISEASE. WE WILL TEST OUR HYPOTHESIS BY FOLLOWING THE OBJECTIVES TO (1) ASSESSES NUTRITIONAL COMPOUNDS, (2) CHARACTERIZE THE BIOACTIVE COMPONENTS FOR ANTIOXIDATION AND HEALTH BENEFITS, (3) EXPLORE THE GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF BENEFICIAL BACTERIA IN THE HUMAN INTESTINE, AND (4) EDUCATE AND TRAIN STUDENTS IN CROP PRODUCTION. IN ADDITION, WE WILL DISSEMINATE THIS INFORMATION TO FARMERS, CONSUMERS AND SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY THROUGH DEMONSTRATION PLOTS, FIELD DAYS, WORKSHOPS, AND PUBLICATIONS. OUR COLLABORATIVE, INTEGRATED-MULTIDISCIPLINARY APPROACH ADDRESSES THE CBG PROGRAM PRIORITY AREA "HUMAN HEALTH, OBESITY AS IT RELATES TO NUTRITION AND HUMAN SCIENCES." OUR PROPOSAL IS INNOVATIVE BECAUSE CHARACTERIZATION OF NUTRITIONAL AND HEALTH BENEFITS OF QUINOA LEAVES WILL HELP US TO INTRODUCE A NUTRIENT-RICH VEGETABLE IN AMERICAN FOOD CHAIN AND BRING ECONOMIC BENEFITS TO THE FARMERS.

SUMMARY:THE SCHOOL AND WORKPLACE INTERCONNECTIVITY (SWI) PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO CREATE A PIPELINE FOR CONTINUOUS INVESTMENT IN STUDENT SUCCESS AND WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS. AS AN INTEGRAL PART OF LANGSTON UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF AGRICULTURE AND APPLIED SCIENCES ACADEMIC PROGRAMMING, THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE STUDENT RECRUITMENT AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS AND ENGAGEMENTS WITH SCHOOLS, AND PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS. THIS WILL INCREASE DIVERSITY IN THE FOOD, AGRICULTURE, NATURAL RESOURCES AND HUMAN SCIENCES (FANH) WORKFORCE, ESPECIALLY AMONG AFRICAN AMERICANS AND UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITIES (URM) STUDENTS AND GRADUATES. PROJECT GOAL WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH THREE SECONDARY OBJECTIVES, (1) FOSTER DEVELOPMENT OF STUDENT WORKFORCE POTENTIAL AND PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES BY NETWORKING WITH COMMUNITY BASED AND PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE PROTOTYPICAL MENTORS AND POTENTIAL EMPLOYERS OF GRADUATES; (2) SUPPORT RECRUITMENT THROUGH ESTABLISHMENT OF STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS ANDEFFECTIVE LINKAGES WITH HIGH SCHOOLS IN SELECTED URBAN AND RURAL COUNTIES AS WELL AS WITH OTHER RELATED OUTREACH RECRUITMENT ACTIVITIES. (3) FORGE MULTIDISCIPLINARY MENTORSHIPS, LEADERSHIP, AND RESEARCH ENGAGEMENTS WITH LU FACULTY WITHIN A VARIETY OF FANH FIELDS.ALTHOUGH OFTEN TAKEN FOR GRANTED, MANY MINORITY COLLEGE STUDENTS FROM LIMITED RESOURCE BACKGROUND ARE NOT EXPOSED TO PROFESSIONAL MENTORING AND FIRST-HAND EXPERIENCE IN THE WORK-PLACE, HENCE REDUCING EMPLOYABILITY AND ATTACHMENT TO PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS. IN MANY RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AS WELL AS FOR LARGE NUMBERS OF MINORITIES, INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE PAID BY EMPLOYER COMPANIES ARE SPARSE. THE LU 1890 SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM, A "GAME CHANGER" WILL PROVIDE TUITION AND OTHER SUPPORT, HOWEVER, IT WILL NOT FUND STUDENT RECRUITMENT ACTIVITIES, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH HIGH SCHOOLS AND PROFESSIONAL BODIES, THE SWI PROJECT WILL SIMULTANEOUSLY CONNECTS DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION, ANDWORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT WHILE ADDRESSING A COMPLEX SET OF ISSUES NOT USUALLY INTEGRATED IN SUPPORT OF FANH.

PRODUCTION OF SHEEP AND GOATS IS GROWING IN THE UNITED STATES, MAINLY WITH SMALL AND LIMITED RESOURCE FARMERS IN THE SOUTHEAST.HOWEVER,SEVERAL THINGS ARE LIMITING THE GROWTH OF THE SMALL RUMINANT INDUSTRY IN THIS REGION. THESE INCLUDE MARGINAL SOILS UNSUITABLE FOR HIGH-INPUT FORAGE PRODUCTION, INFECTION WITH INTERNAL PARASITES, AND LACK OF FARMER ACCESS TO EXPERT ASSISTANCE ON PASTURE PRODUCTION, ANIMAL HEALTH, AND PARASITE MANAGEMENT. THROUGH ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) TECHNIQUES, A TEAM OF PLANT AND ANIMAL SCIENTISTS, PARASITOLOGISTS, EXTENSION SPECIALISTS, AGRICULTURE ENGINEER AND COMPUTER MODELERS WILL WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP AN AUTOMATED DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEM (ADSS) FOR FORAGE AND PARASITE MANAGEMENT THAT FARMERS CAN ACCESS THROUGH THEIR CELLPHONES. THE WORK WILL INCLUDE A COMPUTER MODEL TO SHOW FARMERS THE BEST PLACES TO GROW SERICEA LESPEDEZA, AN ANTI-PARASITIC FORAGE PLANT, BASED UPON SOIL PROPERTIES, RAINFALL, AND OTHER CLIMATIC PARAMETERS. WE WILL ALSO DEVELOP A SMARTPHONE APP FOR FARMERS TO IDENTIFY AND TREAT PARASITE-INFECTED ANIMALS BASED UPON THEIR MOVEMENT ON PASTURES. WE WILL TRAIN FARMERS ON HOW TO USE THE ADDS TO GROW HIGH-QUALITY FORAGES THAT CAN KEEP THEIR ANIMALS HEALTHY, AND FINALLY, WE WILL INSTALL A NEW AI COMPUTER LABORATORY FOR USE BY SCIENTISTS AND STUDENTS AT FORT VALLEY STATE UNIVERSITY TO SUPPORT THIS WORK.

BLUEBERRY (VACCINIUM SECTION CYANOCOCCUS) IS AN ECONOMICALLY IMPORTANT SMALL-FRUIT CROP NATIVE TO NORTH AMERICA. MOST OF THE NORTHERN HIGHBUSH BLUEBERRY (NHB) CULTIVARS HAVE V. CORYMBOSUM GENETIC BACKGROUND. BLUEBERRY PRODUCTION WAS EARLIER RESTRICTED TO TEMPERATE REGIONS OF CANADA AND NORTHERN PARTS OF THE UNITED STATES. HOWEVER, MORE THAN 38 STATES, INCLUDING MANY OF THE COUNTRY'S SOUTHERN STATES, AND SEVERAL COUNTRIES WORLDWIDE ARE CULTIVATING BLUEBERRY AS A COMMERCIAL CROP. THE COMMERCIAL RELEVANCE HAS BEEN STEADILY GROWING FOR THE PAST TWO DECADES OWING TO AN INCREASED AWARENESS OF THE BENEFITS OF BLUEBERRY TO HUMAN HEALTH. BLUEBERRY PLANTS HAVE STRINGENT GROWTH CONDITIONS, AND SLIGHT INCREASES IN THE TEMPERATURE CAN ADVERSELY IMPACT GROWTH AND YIELD. A DECREASE IN PLANT SURVIVAL AND FRUIT QUALITY HAS BEEN OBSERVED IN SOME BLUEBERRY CULTIVARS WHEN AVERAGE DAYTIME TEMPERATURES EXCEEDED 30&DEG;C. THUS, HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS IS A PIVOTAL FACTOR IN BLUEBERRY PRODUCTION AND YIELD, ESPECIALLY WITH THE HIGH TEMPERATURES AND INCREASED HEAT WAVES ANTICIPATED BY GLOBAL WARMING.THE ADAPTABILITY OF BLUEBERRY PLANTS TO HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS CONDITIONS VARIES AMONG GENOTYPES. VARIOUS SOUTHERN SPECIES OF BLUEBERRY, SUCH AS V. DARROWII, ARE REPORTED TO ADAPT TO WARMER CLIMATES. SUCH SPECIES MAY CARRY NEW GENES/ALLELES THAT ALLOW THE PLANT TO SURVIVE AND GROW IN RELATIVELY WARMER CONDITIONS. IDENTIFYING SUCH GENES/ALLELES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF MOLECULAR MARKERS ASSOCIATED WITH HIGH-TEMPERATE STRESS TOLERANCE TRAITS WILL FACILITATE THE SELECTION AND BREEDING OF NEW HEAT-TOLERANT BLUEBERRY CULTIVARS. WE USED V. DARROWII &TIMES; V. CORYMBOSUM CROSS PROGENIES (320 PLANTS) FOR GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATION STUDY (GWAS) WITH GENOTYPING-BY-SEQUENCING (GBS) TECHNOLOGY. WE IDENTIFIED 1,323 SINGLE NUCLEOTIDE POLYMORPHISMS (SNPS) SIGNIFICANTLY ASSOCIATED WITH HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS-TOLERANCE TRAITS.IN THIS GRANT, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP KOMPETITIVE ALLELE-SPECIFIC PCR (KASP) AND CLEAVED AMPLIFIED POLYMORPHIC SEQUENCE (CAPS) MARKERS FOR HIGH-TEMPERATURE STRESS TOLERANCE IN BLUEBERRIES. WE WILL DESIGN THE PRIMERS FOR THE MOST SIGNIFICANT SNPS AND VALIDATE THEIR ASSOCIATION WITH THE TRAITS. THE DEVELOPED MARKERS WILL BE TESTED AND VALIDATED IN F2 PROGENIES FROM THE V. DARROWII &TIMES; V. CORYMBOSUM CROSS AND 80 AVAILABLE BLUEBERRY ACCESSIONS. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL TRAIN POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCH ASSOCIATES AND GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN MODERN PLANT BREEDING TECHNIQUES AND HELP BUILD A SMALL-FRUIT BREEDING PROGRAM AND RESEARCH CAPACITY AT DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY (DSU).

ACCORDING TO THE COMMISSION ON DIETETIC REGISTRATION (2020), ONLY 2.6 % OF DIETITIANS ARE BLACK, 3.3% HISPANIC, AND 3.9% ASIAN. THE BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS PREDICTED AN 11% INCREASE IN EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIETITIANS (2018 TO 2028), MAKING THIS PROFESSION AN ATTRACTIVE EDUCATIONAL OPTION FOR STUDENTS. THE INCREASE IS PARTIALLY DUE TO THE AGING POPULATION AND RISE IN CHRONIC DISEASES REQUIRING MORE EFFECTIVE PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND MEDICAL NUTRITION THERAPY. WE ARE RESPONDING TO THESE NEEDS BY PROPOSING TO DEVELOP AN MS IN DIETETICS WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING A SIMULATION LAB THAT TRAINS STUDENTS TO PROMOTE HEALTH, AND PREVENT AND TREAT THE INCIDENCE OF CHRONIC DISEASES. BY 2024, THE MINIMUM ENTRY-LEVEL REGISTRATION ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR DIETITIANS WILL CHANGE FROM A BACCALAUREATE TO A GRADUATE DEGREE IN ADDITION TO CURRENT ACADEMIC AND SUPERVISED PRACTICE REQUIREMENTS, MIRRORING OTHER ALLIED HEALTH PROFESSIONS. THE MISSION OF THE MS IN DIETETICS WILL BE TO TRAIN LEADERS TO PROVIDE CULTURALLY COMPETENT FOOD AND NUTRITION SERVICES. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO: (1) DEVELOP AN ACEND ACCREDITED MS IN DIETETICS; 2) DEVELOP A SIMULATION LAB AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES; 3) DEVELOP INTERPROFESSIONAL LEADERSHIP SKILL TRAINING; AND 4) DEVELOP STUDENT ASSIGNMENTS FOR EDUCATING BOTH PARAPROFESSIONALS AND DIVERSE, UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THROUGH EXTENSION PROGRAMMING. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE MS IN DIETETICS, ENROLLMENT OF A DIVERSE STUDENT POPULATION, INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF PARAPROFESSIONALS, OUTREACH TO LOW INCOME DELAWARE RESIDENTS THROUGH EDUCATION PROGRAMMING AND EXTENSION WEBSITES, AND WELL-PREPARED, CULTURALLY COMPETENT, INTERPROFESSIONALLY TRAINED GRADUATES WHO INCREASE THE DIVERSITY OF CREDENTIALED DIETITIANS IN THE MID-ATLANTIC REGION.

OBESITY AND TYPE II DIABETES ARE SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH CHALLENGES, AFFECTING NOT ONLY AMERICANS, BUT MANY IMMIGRANT POPULATIONS. EPIDEMIOLOGICAL DATA REVEALED THAT RISING LEVELS OF OBESITY AND DIABETES AMONG AFRICAN-BORN IMMIGRANTS CONTRIBUTE TO RISING HEALTHCARE COSTS. DIET IS A SIGNIFICANT, MODIFIABLE RISK FACTOR ASSOCIATED WITH OBESITY AND TYPE II DIABETES AND PLAYS A CRUCIAL ROLE IN WEIGHT CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT OF DIABETES. DIET IS AN INTEGRAL TOOL MANAGEMENT OF DISEASES, FROM PREVENTION TO TREATMENT. FOOD ANALYSIS OF INDIGENOUS FOODS IS ESSENTIAL TO ASSESS DIETARY QUALITY AND DEVELOP NUTRIENT INTAKE RECOMMENDATIONS AND DIETARY PATTERNS WITH INDIGENOUS FOODS BASED ON USDA DIETARY GUIDELINES. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ASSESS DIETARY PATTERNS OF AFRICAN ETHNIC FOODS USING METHODOLOGIES DEVELOPED BY THE USDA AND NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE TO ASSESS DIET QUALITY BASED ON THE 2020-2025 DIETARY GUIDELINES FOR AMERICANS. THIS IS AN IMPORTANT PROJECT BECAUSE CURRENT KNOWLEDGE ON ETHNIC FOODS CONSUMED BY AFRICANS LIVING IN THE USA IS LIMITED. PROJECT OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1) ASSESS AFRICAN BORN IMMIGRANT COMMUNITY PERCEPTION OF HEALTHY EATING HABITS AND EXERCISE, 2) CONDUCT NUTRIENT ANALYSIS OF IDENTIFIED STAPLE FOODS AND DETERMINE THE RECOMMENDED PORTION SIZE FOR THE SELECTED IMMIGRANT STAPLE FOODS AND 3) DEVELOP TRAINING/EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS IN COLLABORATION WITH THE COMMUNITY. PROPOSED FOOD PATTERN EQUIVALENTS AND AFRICAN RECIPE COLLECTION/COOKBOOK WILL ASSIST EXTENSION SPECIALISTS, HOSPITAL FOOD SERVICE DEPARTMENTS AND HEALTH PROFESSIONALS TO GUIDE AFRICAN-BORN IMMIGRANTS IN MAKING HEALTHY DIETARY CHOICES AND SERVE AS THE RESEARCH-BASED FOUNDATION FOR NUTRITION POLICIES AND PROGRAMS ACROSS THE US

IMPROVING THE DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY OF RAINBOW TROUT COULD REDUCE ORGANIC WASTES, INCREASE THE USE OF ALTERNATIVE PROTEINS AND OILS OF NON-MARINE SOURCES THAT WOULD ALLOW AQUACULTURE TO REMAIN ECONOMICALLY AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SUSTAINABLE. IDENTIFYING AND SELECTING RAINBOW TROUT STRAINS/FAMILIES WITH FAST AND EFFICIENT MUSCLE GROWTH THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH IMPROVED DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY WILL AFFECT THE PROFITABILITY OF SALMONID AQUACULTURE. THE EFFICIENCY OF DIGESTION IS AN INTIMATE INTERPLAY BETWEEN GENETICS, NATURE OF DIETS AND PHYSIOLOGICAL STATUS OF THE ANIMAL. THE EVOLUTION TOWARDS MORE SUSTAINABLE AQUACULTURE INDUSTRY IMPLIES LIMITING INPUTS AND TO MAKING USE OF THE ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF THE ANIMALS TO CHANGING AND EVEN UNFAVORABLE DIETARY CONDITIONS, INCLUDING USE OF NON-ANIMAL PROTEIN AND OIL AS WELL AS INSECT-BASED SOURCES. THIS REQUIRES A BETTER UNDERSTANDING AND INTEGRATION OF ADAPTIVE TRAITS IN BREEDING PROGRAMS, INCLUDING DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY AND GUT MICROBIOME COMPOSITION, IN ORDER TO FAVOR THE USE OF A WIDER VARIETY OF FEEDSTUFFS. THIS PROJECT WILL STUDY ASSOCIATION OF GENETIC SELECTION FOR MUSCLE YIELD WITH DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY, ALTERNATIVE FEED/DIET-TEMPERATURE INTERACTIONS/FISH GUT MICROBIOME IN RAINBOW TROUT. OBJECTIVE 1. ASSESS POTENTIAL DIFFERENCES IN DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY BETWEEN RAINBOW TROUT DIVERGENTLY SELECTED FOR FAST GROWTH RATE AND HIGH (ARS-FY-H) OR LOW (ARS-FY-L) YIELD FED VEGETABLE-BASED AND INSECT-BASED INGREDIENT SOURCES. SUB-OBJECTIVE 1A - CHARACTERIZE AND COMPARE DIFFERENTIAL EFFECTS OF FISH VERSUS VEGETABLE VERSUS INSECT PROTEINS ON DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY BETWEEN RAINBOW TROUT SELECTED FOR FAST GROWTH RATE AND HIGH- AND LOW- MUSCLE YIELD; SUB-OBJECTIVE 1B - EVALUATE EFFECTS OF FISH VERSUS VEGETABLE VERSUS INSECT-DERIVED FATS ON DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY BETWEEN FAMILIES OF RAINBOW TROUT SELECTED FOR FAST GROWTH RATE HIGH- AND LOW- MUSCLE YIELD; OBJECTIVE 2 - COMPARE GUT MICROBIOME COMPOSITION BETWEEN FAST-AND SLOW-GROWTH RATE AND HIGH- AND LOW- MUSCLE YIELD GROUPS TO ESTABLISH HOW SELECTION FOR FAST GROWTH RATE AND MUSCLE YIELD AFFECTED DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY AND GUT MICROBIOME COMPOSITION; OBJECTIVE 3 - CHARACTERIZE THE INTERACTIVE EFFECTS OF TEMPERATURE AND DIETARY COMPOSITION ON GUT MICROBIOME COMPOSITION AND ITS ASSOCIATION WITH DIGESTIVE EFFICIENCY IN RAINBOW TROUT LINES SELECTED FOR IMPROVED GROWTH RATE AND YIELD CHARACTERISTICS; AND OBJECTIVE 4 - DEVELOP AN EDUCATION/TRAINING PROGRAM TO INSPIRE FUTURE GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS. DIRECTLY INCORPORATING RESEARCH ACTIVITIES INTO STUDENT EDUCATION AND TRAINING AND FOCUSING ON UNDER-REPRESENTED STUDENTS WILL DIVERSIFY STEM-RELATED WORKFORCE.

RIPE ROT CAUSED BY COLLETOTRICHUM SPP. OFTEN CAUSES HUGE ECONOMIC LOSSES IN THE HUMID SUBTROPICAL AND TROPICAL REGIONS BECAUSE OF ITS BROAD HOST RANGE, AND THE DEVASTATION OF ESSENTIAL CROPS.IN THIS PROJECT, WE PROPOSE TO USE ADVANCES IN SEQUENCING TECHNOLOGY AND AVAILABLE GERMPLASM RESOURCES TO UNDERSTAND RIPE ROT TOLERANCE USING GRAPE AS A MODEL PLANT. THE MAJOR OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE: (I) TO IDENTIFY THE SPECIES DYNAMICS AND DISTRIBUTION OF GRAPE RIPE ROT, (II) MONITOR GLOBAL TRANSCRIPTOME PROFILE IN RIPE ROT SUSCEPTIBLE AND TOLERANT GRAPEVINES, (III) PHENOTYPING AND GENOTYPING TO IDENTIFY GENETIC VARIANTS AND DEVELOP GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATION MAPS (GWAS) FOR RIPE ROT RESISTANCE, AND (IV) ENGAGE 1890 STUDENTS IN RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH MODERN PLANT BREEDING TECHNIQUES. KNOWLEDGE WILL BE TRANSFERRED VIA SUAREC EXTENSION ACTIVITIES, PUBLICATIONS, PRESENTATIONS, AND FIELD TOURS.

WITH THE GROWING NUMBER OF DIAGNOSES OF OBESITY, HYPERTENSION, CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASES, AND CANCERS, WORLDWIDE AWARENESS OF FOOD SAFETY AND QUALITY HAS INCREASED TREMENDOUSLY. DATA SUGGEST THAT SOME GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATIONS ARE MORE PRONE TO SPECIFIC DISEASES. WITH THE EVER-INCREASING HUMAN POPULATION, WORLD FOOD CONSUMPTION HAS INCREASED. WHILE HIGHER QUANTITIES OF FOOD ARE NEEDED, A CHALLENGING PROBLEM WILL BE TO MAINTAIN THE QUALITY AND THE SAFETY OF THE FOOD AS CONTAMINATION COULD BE INCREASED WITH PRODUCTION. POLLUTANTS ARE ADDED TO THE ENVIRONMENT THROUGH NATURAL CAUSES, INDUSTRIAL PROCESSES, AND TRANSPORTATION EMISSIONS THAT DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY INFLUENCE FOOD SAFETY. IN THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT, THE PI INTENDS TO SET UP A BIOLOGICAL ASSAY AT PRAIRIE VIEW A&M UNIVERSITY TO IDENTIFY MULTIPLE TOXIC CHEMICALS PRESENT IN A VARIETY OF FOOD THAT ISHARMFUL TO HUMANS. THE TARGETED TOXINS ARE KNOWN TO BE PRESENT IN FOOD, AND THIS METHOD HAS THE CAPABILITY OF DETECTING MULTIPLE CONTAMINANTS IN A SINGLE ASSAY. THE BIGGEST ADVANTAGE OF USING THIS METHOD IS ONCE THE TOXIN LEVELS IN TESTED FOOD ARE KNOWN, THE CONSUMPTION GUIDELINES CAN BE DEVELOPED WITH RESPECT TO BODY WEIGHT AND GENDER. THIS PROJECT WILL BE BENEFICIAL TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES, THE STATE, AND THE NATION AND BRING AWARENESS TO CONSUMERS AND PRODUCERS. FOOD SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED FROM LOCAL GROCERY STORES AND FARMS, AND THE FINDINGS WILL BE PRESENTED AT LOCAL AND NATIONAL SYMPOSIA, AND RESULTS WILL BE PUBLISHED IN RESEARCH JOURNALS. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL GAIN AWARENESS ABOUT FOOD SAFETY AND WILL GET TRAINED IN METHODS OF ASSESSING FOOD QUALITY AND SAFETY.

THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO BUILD RESEARCH COMPETENCY IN AGRICULTURE-NUTRACEUTICAL RESEARCH IN TERMS OF INVESTIGATING ANTI-DIABETIC EFFECTS OF GARLIC SCAPES, DISCARDED BYPRODUCTS OF GARLIC BULBS PRODUCTION THROUGH INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH, AND INTEGRATING EXTENSION WORK. OBJECTIVE 1 IS TO OPTIMIZE GARLIC SCAPES GROWTH AND YIELD AND TO EXTRACT AND IDENTIFY THEIR BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS. SEVERAL GARLIC CULTIVARS WILL BE GROWN AND THE BEST CULTIVARS THAT GROW IN NORTH CAROLINA WILL BE SELECTED BY MEASURING VARIOUS PLANT GROWING CRITERIA. THE SELECTED GARLIC SCAPE WILL BE USED FOR EXTRACTING BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS, MEASURING NUTRITIONAL VALUE, AND IDENTIFYING BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS. OBJECTIVE 2 INVESTIGATES THE EFFECTS OF GARLIC SCAPES EXTRACT AND ITS IDENTIFIED MAJOR BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS ON INTESTINAL CARBOHYDRATE-HYDROLYZING ENZYMES IN VITRO. OBJECTIVE 3 IS TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTS OF GARLIC SCAPES EXTRACT ON INTESTINAL GLUCOSE UPTAKE USING HUMAN INTESTINAL CELLS BY MEASURING THE CELL'S FUNCTION AND METABOLOME. OBJECTIVE 4 IS TO EDUCATE GARLIC GROWERS, EXTENSION EDUCATORS, AND CONSUMERS ON THE PRODUCTION AND HEALTH BENEFITS OF GARLIC SCAPES BY PROVIDING DISSEMINATION ACTIVITIES AND MATERIALS INCLUDING GARLIC SCAPE GROWING SKILLS AND HEALTH EFFECTS. SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD STATE-OF-THE-ART CAPACITY IN NUTRACEUTICAL RESEARCH AT CAES OF N.C. A&T AND MAKE FACULTY AND STUDENTS PROMOTE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS IN NUTRACEUTICAL RESEARCH USING FOOD BYPRODUCTS ON IMPROVING HUMAN HEALTH. THEREFORE, THE PROJECT GOALS ALIGN WITH CBG'S GOAL TO ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE QUALITY OF THE RESEARCH PROGRAM IN FOOD, AGRICULTURAL, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND HUMAN FANH) SCIENCES.

MISCANTHUS X GIGANTEUS (MXG) IS A C4 GRASS CLOSELY RELATED TO MAIZE, SORGHUM, AND SUGARCANE; IT IS A TALL, HERBACEOUS, HIGH YIELDING, PERENNIAL GRASS CONFERRING ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS WITH POTENTIAL AS AN IMPORTANT CROP FOR THE EMERGING BIOENERGY AND BIOPRODUCTS INDUSTRIES. IN MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN U.S. INCLUDING ALABAMA, INTERMITTENT DROUGHT IS A FREQUENT PROBLEM, ESPECIALLY MID TO LATE SEASON. CLIMATE CHANGE AND SHALLOW TOPSOILS COMMON IN THE SOUTHERN U.S. FURTHER EXACERBATE THE CHALLENGES OF DROUGHT IN THIS REGION. THIS MAKES AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE GENETICS BEHIND DROUGHT TOLERANCE CRITICAL TO BREEDING MISCANTHUS HIGHLY ADAPTED TO THIS REGION. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL TO CONDUCT GENETIC MAPPING FOR IDENTIFYING MOLECULAR MARKERS AND CANDIDATE GENES ASSOCIATED WITH DROUGHT TOLERANCE IN MISCANTHUS. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO IDENTIFY LOCI RESPONSIBLE FOR DROUGHT TOLERANCE, FOCUSING ON THE MORPHOLOGICAL AND GROWTH-RELATED ASPECTS, IN BOTH CONTROLLED-ENVIRONMENT GREENHOUSES AND UNDER FIELD CONDITIONS; WE ALSO AIM TO IMPROVE GENETIC MAPPING PRECISION BY COMPARATIVELY EVALUATING THREE BIOINFORMATIC STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS THE GENETIC MAPPING CHALLENGES DUE TO THE HIGH HETEROZYGOSITY OF ITS GENOME STRUCTURE. WE WILL LEVERAGE ONE WELL-ESTABLISHED INTERSPECIFIC F2 POPULATION OF MISCANTHUS SENESIS X MISCANTHUS LUTARIORIPARIUS AND THE GENOMIC RESOURCES DEVELOPED THROUGH OUR CURRENT WORK ON A COLLABORATIVE MISCANTHUS PROJECT FUNDED BY USDA AFRI. WE SEEK TO BUILD THE CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE FOR GENOMICS-ENABLED PLANT GENETICS & BREEDING RESEARCH AND TRAINING AT ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY. THIS PROPOSED RESEARCH IS RELEVANT TO THE CBG PROGRAM: "TO ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE QUALITY OF RESEARCH PROGRAMS AT THE 1890 INSTITUTIONS".

GASTROINTESTINAL PARASITE INFESTATION AND LACK OF GOAT BREEDS THAT ARE TOLERANT TO PARASITES RESULT IN HIGHER INPUT COSTS, LOWER PERFORMANCE RATES, AND DIMINISHED PROFIT, CAUSING MANY PEOPLE TO QUIT THE GOAT PRODUCTION BUSINESS. MEANWHILE, USE OF ANTHELMINTIC DRUGS HAS BEEN SHOWN TO HAVE A MINIMAL IMPACT ON THE CONTROL OF GASTRO-INTERNAL PARASITES. ALTERNATIVELY, ANIMAL SELECTION AND BREEDING MANAGEMENT CAN BE A SUSTAINABLE APPROACH TO CONTROL INTERNAL PARASITES. BLACK FARMLANDS IN THE U.S. HAVE BEEN AND CONTINUE TO DECLINE DUE THE LACK OF AGRICULTURAL INVESTMENT AND LIMITED KNOWLEDGE AND RESOURCES FOR MINORITY PRODUCERS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH THREE DEMONSTRATION SITES: THE MAIN DEMONSTRATION SITE AT ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY (AAMU), AND TWO OTHER SITES IN EACH OF UNION SPRINGS, AND CUBA, ALABAMA. THESE DEMONSTRATION SITES WILL BE ESTABLISHED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE SOUTHEASTERN GOAT COOPERATIVE AND THE EAST ALABAMA BLACK BELT FARMERS' COOPERATIVE. THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO 1) EDUCATE SMALL RUMINANT PRODUCERS AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MOSTLY FROM UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ON INTEGRATED PARASITE CONTROL AND BREEDING MANAGEMENT, AND 2) DEMONSTRATE THE BENEFITS OF USING SELECTION AND BREEDING MANAGEMENT AS A VIABLE METHOD FOR PARASITE MANAGEMENT. THIS 3-YEAR EXTENSION PROJECT ADDRESSES THE NIFA PRIORITY AREA OF GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY, ENABLING PRODUCERS TO ACHIEVE THEIR PRODUCTIVITY AND ECONOMIC GOALS BY MAKING SOUND RESEARCH AVAILABLE TO THEM.

CERULEAN WARBLER (SETOPHAGA CERULEA) (CERW), ONE OF THE FASTEST DECLINING SONGBIRD SPECIES IN NORTH AMERICA, HAS LOST 70% BREEDING POPULATION SINCE 1960S. ONE OF THE MAJOR FACTORS CONTRIBUTED TO THIS FAST DECLINE IS THE LOSS OF SUITABLE FORESTED HABITAT. NORTHERN ALABAMA HISTORICALLY REPRESENTED CERW'S SOUTHERN-MOST BREEDING RANGE WHERE THEY WERE COMMON, NOW IS THE PLACE OF THE GREATEST CONSERVATION NEED OF THE SPECIES. AN ISOLATED POPULATION HAS PERSISTED AT BANKHEAD NATIONAL FOREST (BNF). LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT WHY THE SPECIES OCCURS THERE, LESS IS KNOWN ABOUT SPECIES' POPULATION STATUS, BREEDING SUCCESS, HABITAT USE, AND THE EFFECT OF FOREST COMPOSITION, STRUCTURE, AND MANAGEMENT. WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES CALLED FOR CERW STUDIES IN ALABAMA TO PROVIDE MORE ACCURATE POPULATION ESTIMATES AND BREEDING INFORMATION; FOREST RESOURCE MANAGERS INCLUDING THE STAFF AT BNF ARE SEEKING SCIENTIFIC BASES FOR EFFECTIVELY MANAGING THEIR FORESTS FOR THE CERW. THIS PROJECT IS IN RESPONSE TO THESE REQUESTS WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF GAINING BETTER KNOWLEDGE OF THE BREEDING ECOLOGY AND HABITAT ASSOCIATION OF CERW AND THE EFFECT OF FOREST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, INCLUDING TORNADO-CREATED FOREST OPENINGS. OUR SPECIFIC GOALS ARE TO 1) HAVE A BETTER KNOWLEDGE OF THE POPULATION STATUS OF CERW AT BNF, 2) EXAMINE AVIAN COMMUNITY ASSOCIATIONS OF THE CERW TO FACILITATE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE INTERACTIONS OF CERW WITH OTHER SPECIES, 3) IDENTIFY LANDSCAPE AND MICROHABITAT CONDITIONS RELATED TO FOREST COMPOSITION, STRUCTURE, AND VEGETATION FEATURES THAT BEST EXPLAIN CERW OCCURRENCE, AND 4) EXAMINE IF FOREST OPENINGS CREATED BY NATURAL DISTURBRANCE AND FOREST MANAGEMENT PROVIDE SUITABLE HABITAT FOR CERW. THE PROJECT WILL HELP US TO HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPACTS OF FOREST HABITAT CHANGE ON WILDLIFE AND HOW THE COLLECTIVE CHANGES IN FOREST STRUCTURE DUE TO FOREST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND NATURAL DISTURBANCES AFFECT POPULATION DYNAMICS OF A THREATENED AND CONSERVATION PRIORITY SPECIES AND ULTIMATELY, BIODIVERSITY. THE STUDY RESULTS WILL ADDRESS CURRENT KNOWLEDGE GAPS THAT ARE PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT FOR THE BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES OF FOREST RESOURCES THAT WILL BENEFIT THE CONSERVATION OF WILDLIFE SPECIES AND FOREST ECOSYSTEM. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES WORKFORCE, PARTICULARLY FOR MINORITIES.

AS ALABAMA CITIES AND ECONOMIES ARE GROWING, THE REALITIES OF SOCIAL AND RACIAL INEQUITIES CONTINUE TO CREATE BARRIERS TO SUSTAINABLE, HIGH-WAGE EMPLOYMENTIN LIMITED-RESOURCE COMMUNITIES.ALTHOUGH MANY AMERICANS BELIEVE HARD WORK CAN CREATE ECONOMIC MOBILITY, DEFINED AS IMPROVED WELL-BEING IN ONE'S LIFETIME, ONLY 5.2% OF POOR ALABAMIANS WILL MAKE IT INTO THE WEALTHY CLASS. FURTHERMORE, DATA SHOWS THAT INEQUITY IS EXACERBATED ALONG RACIAL LINES, MEANING THAT LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES OF COLOR EXPERIENCE THE MOST CHALLENGES IN ECONOMIC ADVANCEMENT. TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES, ALABAMA COOPERATIVE EXTENSION SYSTEM AT ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY WILL IMPLEMENT A 2-YEAR PROJECT TO INVESTIGATE THE STATE OF ECONOMIC MOBILITY IN FOUR ALABAMA URBAN CENTERS, CONVENE CROSS-SECTOR PARTNERS TO CREATE NEW RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES, AND IMPLEMENT HOLISTIC PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE BUSINESS TRAINING AND SUPPORTTO LIMITED-RESOURCED ENTREPRENEURS OF COLOR.THE UPWARD ALABAMA PROJECT CENTERS AROUND ONE KEY QUESTION: HOW CAN WE PROVIDE COLLABORATIVE AND HOLISTIC RESOURCES TO CHRONICALLY UNEMPLOYED AND UNDER-EMPLOYED ALABAMIANS AND CREATE PATHWAYS TOWARDS ECONOMIC MOBILITY? THE PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN TWO PHASES: COMMUNITY RESEARCH AND PROGRAMMING. FIRST,WE WILL COLLECT DATA FROM TARGETED COMMUNITIES IN HUNTSVILLE, BIRMINGHAM, MONTGOMERY, AND MOBILE TO ANALYZE THE VARIOUS CHALLENGES, NEEDS, AND SERVICE GAPS THAT ARE PERPETUATING ECONOMIC INEQUITIES.WE WILL THEN APPLY FINDINGS TO THE CREATION OF THE GO-GETTER PROGRAM, WHICH WILL COMBINE COMMUNITY PARTNER HUBS, COHORT-BASED WORKSHOPS, AND MENTORSHIP TO TRANSFORM LIVELIHOODS THROUGH SMALL BUSINESS ENTREPRENEURSHIP. THIS PROJECTWILL PRODUCE NEW KNOWLEDGE ON URBAN ECONOMICS VIA THE COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS OF HUNDREDS OF SURVEYS; WILL INCREASE CROSS-SECTOR COLLABORATION TOWARDS EQUITYBY CONVENING DOZENS OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS, PRIVATE EMPLOYERS, AND MAJOR INSTITUTIONS; AND ULTIMATELY CATALYZE ECONOMIC MOBILITY FOR HUNDREDS OF ALABAMIANS. CONTINUATION PLANS BEYOND THIS GRANT PERIOD INCLUDETHE EXPANSION OF THE GO-GETTER PROGRAM INTO TWO PATHWAYS, ONE FOR ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND ANOTHER FOR CAREER DEVELOPMENT. RESEARCH AND PROGRAM EVALUATION FINDINGS WILL BE SHARED BROADLY TO SUPPORT ECONOMIC EQUITY PROJECTS IN OTHER COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.

ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY (AAMU) REVITALIZED ITS ACADEMIC PROGRAMS LEADING TO THE LAUNCH OF THE NEW ANIMAL BIO-HEALTH SCIENCE (ABHS) DEGREE IN 2014, AND, THE RECRUITMENT OF A LARGE ANIMAL EXPERT IN 2020. DESPITE THE HUGE SUCCESS IN ABHS ENROLLMENT, GRADUATING ABHS STUDENTS HAVE REPEATEDLY EXPRESS CONCERN REGARDING INSUFFICIENT LARGE ANIMAL "HANDS-ON" LEARNING EXPERIENCE IN THE PROGRAM. THIS IS BECAUSE OFLACK OF A WELL-EQUIPPED LARGE ANIMAL TEACHING AND RESEARCH LABORATORY TO SUPPORT STUDENT'S EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING. THEREFORE, THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD CAPACITY IN LARGE ANIMAL TEACHING AND RESEARCH, AND, PREPARE WELL-TRAINED UNDERSERVED STUDENTS FOR THE LIVESTOCK INDUSTRY, VETERINARY SCHOOL OR GRADUATE SCHOOL. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE ABHS STUDENTS WITH HANDS-ON LEARNING EXPERIENCE IN LARGE ANIMAL BEHAVIOR, HEALTH, REPRODUCTION, AND MICROBIOMES. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE TO ESTABLISH A SUSTAINABLE LARGE ANIMAL TEACHING AND RESEARCH LABORATORYTHAT WOULD ENHANCE EFFECTIVE ABHS COURSE INSTRUCTION, FACILITATE LARGE ANIMAL BEHAVIOR, HEALTH, REPRODUCTION AND MICROBIOME TRAINING, SUPPORT STUDENT MENTORING AND LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND ACCELERATE STUDENT PARTICIPATION IN A LARGE ANIMAL RESEARCH TRIAL TO INVESTIGATE THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN ROAD TRANSPORT DURATION AND BEHAVIOR, HEALTH AND MICROBIOME OF BEEF CATTLE IN THE SUMMER. SPECIFICALLY, A LARGE ANIMAL TEACHING AND RESEARCH LABORATORY WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND EQUIPPED WITH ESSENTIAL INTRUMENTS FOR SAFE LARGE ANIMAL HANDLING, TWO COURSES IN THE ABHS PROGRAM WILL BE REVISED TO INCORPORATE LARGE ANIMAL EXPERIENTIAL LABS, STUDENTS IN THE ABHS PROGRAMWILL BE RECRUITED AND RECEIVE INTENSIVETRAINING IN LARGE ANIMAL ULTRASOUNDAND ACTIVITY MONITORING SYSTEMS DURING THE SUMMER, STUDENTS WILL BE EXPOSED TO NATIONAL ANIMAL SCIENCE CONFERENCES FOR IMPROVED NETWORKING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND STUDENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN A STUDY TO EVALUATE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN ROAD TRANSPORT DISTANCE AND HEALTH, BEHAVIOR AND MICROBIOME OF BEEF CATTLE IN THE SUMMER.THE PROPOSEDPROJECTDIRECTLY ADVANCES AAMU CAPACITY TO DELIVER QUALITY LARGE ANIMAL HANDS-ON EDUCATION TO UNDERSERVED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL NOT ONLY IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF ABHS GRADUATES, BUT ALSO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE ABHS PROGRAM IN DELIVERING LARGE ANIMAL PRE-VETERINARY EDUCATION, AN AREA IN WHICH AFRICAN AMERICANS ARE DISPROPORTIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED.

STUDENTS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES HAVE BEEN SERIOUSLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN THE AGRICULTURAL, NATURAL, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES ACADEMIC PROGRAMS AND RESEARCH. KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY'S (KSU)'S AGRICULTURE FOOD AND ENVIRONMENT (AFE) PROGRAM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO FULFILL THE DEMAND FOR INCREASING DIVERSITY IN THE WORKFORCE. ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND GEOSPATIAL (GIS AND REMOTE SENSING) COURSES ARE RELEVANT TO MULTIPLE DISCIPLINES IN AGRICULTURE, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND OTHER STEM FIELDS. INCREASING DEMANDS FOR CROSS-DISCIPLINARY GISCIENCE, PRECISION AGRICULTURE, AGRIINFORMATICS, AND EMERGING TECHNOLOGY-RELATED JOBS HAVE BEEN EMERGING AT THE STATE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND INDUSTRIES. KSU CURRENTLY PROVIDES A CERTIFICATE IN ENVIRONMENTAL MEASUREMENT AND A CERTIFICATE AND MINOR IN GEOSPATIAL TECHNOLOGY APPLICATION. SOLVING THE ENVIRONMENTAL WORKFORCE SHORTAGE WITH GEOSPATIAL RESEARCH AND CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS IN KENTUCKY IS OF GREAT IMPORTANCE BECAUSE SUCH A WORKFORCE WILL BE MORE CAPABLE OF ADDRESSING THE AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS MORE EFFICIENTLY IN THE STATE. THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE CONCENTRATION WILL STRENGTHEN THE AFE PROGRAM BY DEVELOPING AND OFFERING RELEVANT COURSES THAT WILL APPEAL TO MINORITY AND UNDER-SERVED STUDENTS, PROVIDE HANDS-ON LEARNING EXPERIENCES, CREATE AN INNOVATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT, AND USE ADVANCED INSTRUMENTS AND TEACHING TECHNOLOGIES FOR EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING. BUILDING COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS WITH HIGH SCHOOLS TO ATTRACT TRADITIONAL STUDENTS, AS WELL AS REACHING OUT TO BUSINESSES AND OTHER INDUSTRIES TO ATTRACT NON-TRADITIONAL STUDENTS, WILL FURTHER PROMOTE THE AFE PROGRAM. THE INCREASE IN STUDENT ENROLLMENT WILL SUPPORT KSU'S OVERALL STRATEGIC GOALS. COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS WITH HIGH SCHOOLS AND BUSINESSES ALSO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY TO OFFER THE COURSES ONLINE FOR NON-TRADITIONAL STUDENTS AND STUDENTS AT OTHER 1890 SCHOOLS. MARKET-RESPONSIVE AND COMPETITIVE CURRICULA WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON EXPERIENTIAL AND ACTIVE LEARNING MODULES AND INSTRUMENTATION WILL ENHANCE TEACHING CAPACITY, ENROLLMENT, AND DISTANCE-LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES. THIS PROJECT HAS ADOPTED MANY INNOVATIVE METHODS FOR STRENGTHENING EXISTING COURSES AND FOR PROVIDING STATE-OF-THE-ART TEACHING AND LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS. THE CURRENT ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE OPTION AREA WILL BE STRENGTHENED IN SUCH A WAY THAT PROJECT- AND INQUIRY-BASED LEARNING MATERIALS AND TECHNIQUES WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO THE CURRICULA. THE COURSE MATERIALS WILL BE INTEGRATED WITH ADDITIONAL VISUAL AIDS AND INNOVATIVE HANDS-ON LAB ASSIGNMENTS WITH REAL-TIME ONLINE DATA CREATED BY GEOSPATIAL INSTRUMENTS TO ASSIST STUDENTS WITH DIVERSE LEARNING CAPABILITIES. THESE CURRICULA WILL PROVIDE BOTH THEORIES WITH EXAMPLES AND CASE STUDIES FROM REAL-LIFE EXAMPLES. SENIOR-LEVEL COURSES WILL BE INTEGRATED WITH GEOSPATIAL, CLIMATE AND LAND COVER, WATER QUALITY, AND SOIL PROPERTIES CHANGE DATA. THE PROJECT ADOPTS AN INNOVATIVE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING APPROACH TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TEACHING CAPACITY AT KSU TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS. COMBINING TIME-SERIES REMOTE-SENSING, LIGHT DETECTING AND RANGING (LIDAR), THE USE OF UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES (UAVS, ALSO KNOWN AS DRONES), AND HIGH-RESOLUTION AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY IMAGES WITH PHYSICAL, ECONOMIC, AND SOCIAL DATA WILL CREATE MULTIPLE SENIOR RESEARCH AND CAPSTONE CLASS PROJECTS FOR STUDENTS. KSU WILL SEEK SUPPORT FOR CONTINUOUS RECRUITMENT ACTIVITIES, ENHANCING CLASSROOMS AND GEOSPATIAL LABS, AND CREATING MORE FACULTY TRAINING, INTERNSHIPS, AND CO-OP OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS THROUGH COLLABORATING PARTNERS WITH INDUSTRIES, GOVERNMENT OFFICES, AND OTHER HBCUS AND EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS.THIS TEACHING ENHANCEMENT PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN KSU'S FACULTY CAPACITY UTILIZING EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES AND SHARED RESOURCES FOR RESEARCH AND EDUCATION NEEDS. THE TRAINING OF FACULTY, STUDENTS AND RESEARCH STAFF FOR THE USE OF INSTRUMENTS BOUGHT FROM THE PARTIAL SUPPORT OF THIS GRANT WILL ALSO ASSIST IN PRODUCING NEW KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS ON EMERGING TECHNOLOGY TO ADDRESS A VARIETY OF NEEDS, INCLUDING THE IMPACTS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN CREATING PRELIMINARY DATA, ENGAGE MINORITY STUDENTS IN EXPERIENTIAL RESEARCH AND LEARNING, AND WILL ENHANCE THE ABILITY TO APPLY FOR MULTI-DISCIPLINARY COLLABORATIVE, COMPETITIVE GRANTS FOR LONG-TERM RESEARCH ON THE ISSUES OF ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING, CLIMATE CHANGE, AGROFORESTRY, RENEWABLE ENERGY, AND OTHER AGRICULTURE AND HUMAN SCIENCE DISCIPLINES. COLLECTED AND COMPILED DATA AND RESULTS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP HANDS-ON EDUCATION MODULES AND CASE STUDIES FOR USE IN TEACHING. THE PROJECT POSSESSES A HIGH LEVEL OF MERIT IN DEVELOPING EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING PROJECTS FOR VARIOUS COURSES. THE OTHER BENEFITS AND IMPACTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THROUGH THE IMPROVEMENT OF STUDENT LEARNING AND STUDENTS RECRUITED AND RETAINED, AS WELL AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPETITIVE AND STRONG ACADEMIC PROGRAM. SUCH EFFORT WILL LEAD TOWARD AN INCREASE IN REVENUE GENERATION THROUGH INCREASED ENROLLMENT AND FUNDING THROUGH EXTERNAL RESOURCES. THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT ITS CORE COMPETENCIES IN PROVIDING A STRUCTURED LEARNING ENVIRONMENT OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM THROUGH FIELD TRIPS, MAPPING, AND COLLECTING REAL-TIME CLIMATE, LANDSCAPE, INSECTS, AND INVASIVE SPECIES DATA USING REMOTELY SENSED INSTRUMENTS. THE OUTCOMES OF SUCH PROJECTS WILL BE COMMUNICATED CREATIVELY AND INNOVATIVELY VIA CONFERENCE PRESENTATIONS, STORY MAPS, AND PUBLICATIONS.

GASTROINTESTINAL NEMATODE (GIN) PARASITES ARE POSING A SERIOUS HEALTH RISKS TO RUMINANT LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION, ESPECIALLY FOR THE ORGANIC SHEEP AND GOAT RAISING ENTERPRISES. THE GINS CAUSE SIGNIFICANT ANIMAL AND ECONOMIC LOSSES TO THE INDUSTRY WHILE MOST OF AVAILABLE CHEMICAL ANTHELMINTIC (CAHC) ARE BECOMING DRUG RESISTANCE AND CAUSING CONTAMINATIONS IN PASTURE, SOIL AND ANIMAL PRODUCTS. AS THESE RISK FACTORS INCREASE AND GIN PARASITE INFECTIONS SPREAD IN THE REGION, AND AS PROHIBITED USE OF CAHC IN ORGANIC ANIMALS, AN URGENT AND PRACTICAL SOLUTION MUST BE SOUGHT FOR GOAT AND SHEEP FARMING ENTERPRISES. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES AN ORGANIC AND ALTERNATIVE CONTROL OF GIN PARASITES IN SMALL RUMINANT ANIMALS BY FEEDING SELECTED ANTHELMINTIC HERBAL PLANT, NEMATOPHAGUS FUNGAL FEED SUPPLEMENT, AND ROTATIONAL GRAZING ANTHELMINTIC PASTURES. THE SPECIFIC RESEARCH OBJECTIVES FOLLOW: (1) EVALUATE THE ANTHELMINTIC EFFICACY OF ARTEMISIA HERBAL PLANT AS AN ORGANIC DEWORMING AGENT TO CONTROL GIN INFECTIONS IN SMALL RUMINANTS; (2) EVALUATE A NEMATOPHAGOUS FUNGUS AS A PROBIOTIC AGENT TO PREVENT GIN INFECTIONS IN SMALL RUMINANTS; AND (3) ESTABLISH AN ANTI-PARASITIC PASTURE FOR GRAZING ORGANIC ANIMALS TO AVOID CAHC USE AND SOIL CONTAMINATION. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PRODUCERS PERTAINING TO BIOCONTROL OF GIN PARASITES IN SMALL RUMINANTS, ENHANCE ORGANIC FARMING SUSTAINABILITY, AND INCREASE SHEEP AND GOAT ENTERPRISING PROFITS. PROJECT PROGRESS, ACHIEVEMENTS, AND FINAL RESULTS WILL BE REPORTED TO SCIENTIFIC AND FARMING COMMUNITIES AS WELL AS ORGANIC GOAT AND SHEEP PRODUCERS IN THE FORM OF NEWSLETTERS, WEBSITES, CONFERENCES, TRAINING WORKSHOPS, RESEARCH PRESENTATIONS, REPORTS, AND JOURNAL ARTICLES.

IN SUMMARY, THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE FACTORS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUCCESS OF SMALL FARM AND AGRIBUSINESS RELATED OPERATIONS IN SOUTH CAROLINA. THE GOAL IS TO DETERMINE WHY SOME SMALL FARMERS IN SOUTH CAROLINA ARE SUCCESSFUL AND OTHERS ARE NOT, THENUSETHAT DATA TO DEVELOP AN AGRICULTURAL AND ENTREPRENEURIAL LEADERSHIP MODEL TO GROW AND SUSTAIN SMALL FARMS THAT CAN BE REPLICATED BY OTHERS.

THIS PROPOSAL FALLS UNDER THE RURAL COMMUNITIES, APPLIED RESEARCH, WITH BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND SOCIETY USDA PRIORITIES. THE FOCUS OF THIS RESEARCH IS THE ECONOMIC IMPACT OF HEIR PROPERTY, OR LAND HELD WITHOUT CLEAR TITLE, ON INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY WEALTH. HEIR PROPERTY IS LAND PASSED DOWN THROUGH GENERATIONS WITHOUT A WILL AND IS COMMONLY FOUND AMONG ETHNIC AND ECONOMIC MINORITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES IT IS COMMON FOR MULTIPLE GENERATIONS TO HAVE OWNERSHIP CLAIMS ON ONE PARCEL OF LAND.THE LARGE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH CLAIMS TO LAND MAKES HEIR PROPERTY AN UNSTABLE FORM OF OWNERSHIP. MANY ECONOMICALLY BENEFICIAL MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES REQUIRE ALL HEIRS TO BE IN AGREEMENT, WHICH IS DIFFICULT. THEREFORE, PROPERTY IS NOT USED TO ITS FULL POTENTIAL. LANDS WITH CLEAR TITLE HOLDERS, HOWEVER, DO NOT FACE THIS BARRIER. AS A RESULT, LANDS WITH CLEAR TITLES MAY HAVE HIGHER TAX ASSESSMENTS COMPARED TO HEIR PROPERTY. THIS MEANS LOCAL GOVERNMENTS POTENTIALLY LOSE A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT IN TAX REVENUES ON HEIR PROPERTY, REVENUES THAT COULD BE USED FOR COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT.THIS RESEARCH EXAMINES THE IMPACT OF REGION AND RACE ON HEIR PROPERTY AND COMMUNITY WELL-BEING. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS RESEARCH ARE TO: (1) ASSESS THE AMOUNT AND VALUE OF HEIR PROPERTY WITHIN AND AMONG THREE REGIONS OF ALABAMA, BASED ON RACE: THE BLACK BELT-PREDOMINANTLY AFRICAN AMERICAN, THE TENNESSEE VALLEY-PREDOMINANTLY EUROPEAN AMERICAN; AND THE WIRE GRASS-MIX; AND (2) ANALYZE AND COMPARE THE ASSESSED VALUE OF HEIR PROPERTY IN TERMS OF TAX GENERATION TO SIMILAR LAND WITH CLEAR TITLE IN EACH REGION.

SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY ARE CRITICAL ISSUES THAT ARE OF GLOBAL CONCERN DUE TO THEIR IMPACT ON FOOD SAFETY, ANIMAL HEALTH AND WELFARE, HUMAN HEALTH, AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE. IN RECENT YEARS, THERE HAS BEEN AN INCREASE IN DEMAND FOR POULTRY PRODUCTS (MEAT AND EGGS) RAISED UNDER NATURAL CONDITIONS, WITHOUT ANTIBIOTIC AND SYNTHETIC SUBSTANCES. SIMILARLY, ENRICHMENT OF POULTRY PRODUCTS WITH OMEGA 3 FATTY ACIDS HAVE BEEN SUGGESTED AS A MEANS TO PROMOTE HUMAN HEALTH ESPECIALLY IN THE WESTERN DIETS WHICH HAVE BEEN REPORTED TO BE DEFICIENT IN OMEGA 3 FATTY ACIDS. UTILIZATION OF PURSLANE WHICH IS RICH IN OMEGA 3 FATTY ACIDS AND PHYTOCHEMICALS AS A FEED INGREDIENT HAS BEEN REPORTED BUT MORE RESEARCH IS NEEDED DUE TO ITS POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE QUALITY OF POULTRY PRODUCTS. THIS RESEARCH PROPOSAL OBJECTIVES ARE TO: - (1) EVALUATE THE ROLE OF PROBIOTIC AND PREBIOTIC IN POULTRY PERFORMANCE AND PREVALENCE OF FOODBORNE PATHOGENS IN PASTURED POULTRY. (2) DETERMINE PHENOLIC COMPOUND PROFILE AND ANTIOXIDANT CAPACITY ANALYSES FOR PURSLANE. (3) COMPARE EGG AND MEAT QUALITY OF DIFFERENT CHICKEN STRAINS RAISED ON PURSLANE PASTURE WITH THOSE FED DIET SUPPLEMENTED WITH PURSLANE UNDER CONVENTIONAL CONDITION(4)EVALUATE SOIL AND WATER QUALITY IN CROP AND POULTRY AGROECOSYSTEM UNITS.(5) RECRUIT AND TRAIN STUDENTS IN AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES

HEMP IS A MULTIPURPOSE CROP WITH HIGH POTENTIAL FOR ECONOMIC BENEFITS TO THE FARMERS. THE U.S IS THE LARGEST IMPORTER OF HEMP PRODUCTS, MAINLY SEED AND FIBER. THE USE OF SPECIFIC METABOLITES IN COSMETICS AND HUMAN HEALTH FURTHER INCREASES ITS DOMESTIC DEMAND. THE CROP PRODUCTION TO MEET THE DOMESTIC DEMAND IS HINDERED BY SEVERAL BOTTLENECKS INCLUDING LIMITED KNOWLEDGE OF PRODUCTION STRATEGIES AND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, LACK OF CULTIVARS WITH WIDE ADAPTABILITY, 'HOT' PLANTS IN THE FIELD AND VERY LESS BREEDING TOOLS. HEMP IS REINTRODUCED RECENTLY IN MISSOURI AFTER MORE THAN 100 YEARS WITH NO ADAPTED VARIETIES AND SO NO MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. TO ESTABLISH THE HEMP PRODUCTION IN MISSOURI AND EXPAND TO THE MIDWEST, SUITABLE VARIETIES MUST BE SELECTED/DEVELOPED FOR DIVERSE PRODUCTION ENVIRONMENTS. LONG TERM GOAL IS TO ADDRESS MAJOR PRODUCTION CHALLENGES OF HEMP IN MISSOURI AND ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO ALLEVIATING NATIONAL PRODUCTION CHALLENGES. MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS INTEGRATED, MULTIDISCIPLINARY PROJECT ARE TO (1) IDENTIFY SUITABLE HEMP VARIETIES FOR VARIOUS AGRO-ECOLOGICAL REGIONS OF MISSOURI AND TEST CROP MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, (2) DEVELOP GENETIC AND GENOMIC RESOURCES TO GENERATE BREEDING TOOLS FOR CROP IMPROVEMENT, (3) DISSECT MOLECULAR MECHANISMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE HEMP PLANT GETTING 'HOT' AND REGULATE IT, (4) DISSEMINATE HEMP PRODUCTION INFORMATION, EDUCATE AND BUILD PARTNERSHIP WITH THE HEMP FARMERS AND PROCESSORS, AND (5) TRAIN GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN HEMP GENETICS, MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, AND BREEDING STRATEGIES. THE PROJECT APPROACHES AND OUTCOME WILL FORM A STRONG FOUNDATION FOR ATTRACTING ADDITIONAL FUNDING FROM PUBLIC-PRIVATE STAKEHOLDERS AND ALSO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO AGRICULTURAL BIODIVERSITY AND SUSTAINABILITY.THIS

STUDENTS MUST USE CRITICAL THINKING IN DECIPHERING TODAY'S DATA TSUNAMI AND ARE TURNING TO STATISTICS TO EVALUATE AND SUMMARIZE THIS CONSTANT FLOW. THUS, THE EFFECTIVE TEACHING OF UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STATISTICS COURSES IS ELEMENTAL IN ESTABLISHING CRITICAL THINKING FOUNDATIONS FROM A DATA STANDPOINT. AGRICULTURAL STUDENTS ARE HAMPERED BY TEXTBOOKS THAT LACK REAL DATA WITH AN AGRICULTURAL CONTEXT AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE AGRICULTURAL PROCESS. THE PUBLICATION "METHODS OF LIVESTOCK RESEARCH ON SMALLHOLDER FARMS" (MLR) WAS DEVELOPED THROUGH A PROJECT SUPPORTED BY THE USDA FAS PRIMARILY AS AN AID FOR JUNIOR RESEARCHERS, PARTICULARLY FROM DEVELOPING COUNTRIES, IN CONDUCTING ON-FARM RESEARCH. HOWEVER, THE MLR WOULD HAVE GREATER VALUE IF IT WAS TRANSFORMED FROM A HANDBOOK TO A TEXTBOOK. THE GENERAL OBJECTIVE IS TO ENHANCE THE EXISTING PUBLICATION 'METHODS OF LIVESTOCK RESEARCH ON SMALLHOLDER FARMS' AND INCREASE ITS USAGE AS AN EDUCATIONAL TEXTBOOK FOR UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE INSTRUCTION EMPHASIZING LIVESTOCK RESEARCH 'ON-FARM' AND 'ON-STATION' IN THE USA AND ABROAD. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE 1) CONDUCT ON-FARM RESEARCH YIELDING REAL-LIFE DATA SETS FOR EXAMPLE ANALYSES, ADD EXAMPLES OF ON-STATION RESEARCH SETTINGS COMMON IN PARTNER COUNTRIES, 2) DEVELOP UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE COLLEGE COURSE CURRICULA (PRODUCT) AND PROVIDE TRAINING IN PARTNER COUNTRIES IN THE USE OF THE PRODUCT, 3) IMPROVE THE PRODUCT VIA A FEEDBACK LOOP OF STUDENT AND INSTRUCTOR PARTICIPANT INTERVIEWS. THE DEVELOPMENT OF UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STATISTIC COURSES, INSTRUCTOR'S MANUAL, AND ASSOCIATED SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIAL DEPLOYED ON A MOODLEBOX WILL ALLOW THE PRODUCT/PACKAGE TO BE DISSEMINATED AND UTILIZED ANYWHERE AT AN ENGLISH-SPEAKING COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY WORLDWIDE. THIS HAS THE POSSIBILITY OF CREATING AN OPEN-SOURCE COMMUNITY FOR MLR2, WHICH CAN EXPAND AND INNOVATE THE PROJECT FURTHER. THE INDESIGN FILES USED TO CREATE THE PDF AND EPUB VERSION OF THE TEXTBOOK WILL BE SHARED VIA DROPBOX WITH ALL PARTNERS. ANY MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY WILL BE ABLE TO ADD, MODIFY, OR DELETE CONTENT SO THAT THE TEXTBOOK CAN BE ENHANCED OR CUSTOMIZED TO AN UNIVERSITY'S SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS.

SCIENCE IS UNDER ASSAULT. THE RESPONSE TO THE "ASSAULT ON SCIENCE" IS NOT BETTER SCIENCE, BUT BETTER SCIENCE COMMUNICATION. THE CRUCIAL NEED FOR SUPERIOR SCIENCE COMMUNICATION IS DEMONSTRATED BY DISCOURSE SURROUNDING CLIMATE CHANGE AND THE CURRENT PANDEMIC. THE QUALITY OF SCIENCE COMMUNICATION IN AGRICULTURE CAN INFLUENCE ADOPTION OF BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES. AGRICULTURAL EXTENSION SPECIALISTS HAVE A UNIQUE ROLE IN SCIENCE COMMUNICATION. THE IMPORTANCE OF SCIENCE COMMUNICATION TRAINING IN AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IS HEIGHTENED BY DEVELOPMENTS IN DIGITAL COMMUNICATION AND SOCIAL MEDIA. ULTIMATELY, SCIENTISTS MUST BE ADEPT AT COMMUNICATING WITH THEIR COLLEAGUES, THE GENERAL PUBLIC, AND DECISIONMAKERS. OTHER INSTITUTIONS HAVE ADOPTED SPECIALIZED PROGRAMS THAT TRAIN STUDENTS TO BE SCIENCE COMMUNICATORS, SOMETIMES USING NOVEL TECHNIQUES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY BUILDING PROPOSAL IS TO IMPROVE THE PEDAGOGY OF SCIENCE COMMUNICATION AT UAPB BY TRAINING A TRAINER, WHO WILL IN TURN, PASS ALONG NEW TECHNIQUES AND INSIGHTS INTO SCIENCE COMMUNICATION TO FACULTY, STAFF, STUDENTS, AND YOUNG PROFESSIONALS AT UAPB AND BEYOND. THIS GOAL ALIGNS WITH THE GOAL OF THE CBG PROGRAM WHICH IS TO STRENGTHEN TEACHING CAPACITY. ANOTHER CBG PROGRAM GOAL IS TRANSLATIONAL AGRICULTURE RESEARCH THAT DIRECTLY BENEFITS SOCIETY. IMPROVED SCIENCE COMMUNICATION ALLOWS AGRICULTURE RESEARCH TO MORE RAPIDLY AND THOROUGHLY BENEFIT SOCIETY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A BUSINESS INCUBATOR. THE FASHION AND APPAREL BUSINESS "FAB" LABORATORY WILL SPECIFICALLY FOCUS ON FASHION DESIGN AND APPAREL ENTREPRENEURSHIP. THE FAB LAB WILL SUPPORT STUDENTS ENROLLED IN APPAREL, MERCHANDISING AND TEXTILES (AMTX) AT SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY AND A&M COLLEGE (SUBR) WISHING TO START OR IMPROVE ON AN EXISTING FASHION, APPAREL AND/OR TEXTILES RELATED SMALL BUSINESS. THE FAB LAB WILL ALSO TARGET MINORITY HIGH SCHOOL AGED YOUTH IN BATON ROUGE AND SURROUNDING RURAL AREAS. THIS UNDERSERVED POPULATION WILL LEARN ENTREPRENEURIAL SKILLS THROUGH A SUMMER YOUTH PROGRAM SPONSORED THROUGH THE FAB LAB.ALTHOUGH CURRENT TRENDS INDICATE THAT THERE IS A RISE IN ENTREPRENEURSHIP AMONG PEOPLE OF COLOR, MINORITIES STILL MAKE UP JUST 14.6% OF SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS IN THE U.S. (HECHT, 2014). MANY FACTORS UNDOUBTEDLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEARTH OF ENTREPRENEURIAL ACTIVITY AMONG WOMEN AND PEOPLE OF COLOR; ONE SIGNIFICANT FACTOR IS ENTREPRENEURIAL SELF-EFFICACY (ESE). ENTREPRENEURIAL SELF-EFFICACY REFERS TO AN INDIVIDUAL'S LEVEL OF SELF-CONFIDENCE OR THEIR BELIEF THAT THEY HAVE THE NECESSARY SKILLS AND ABILITIES TO SUCCEED IN CREATING A BUSINESS (BOYD & VOZIKIS, 1994). EVIDENCE INDICATES THAT ENTREPRENEURSHIP EDUCATION INITIATIVES HAVE A POSITIVE CORRELATION ON ESE AMONG MINORITIES THEREBY RESULTING IN A STRENGTHENED PIPELINE OF POTENTIAL ENTREPRENEURS AMONG THESE GROUPS (BRYANT, FABIAN, KINNAMON, & WRIGHT, 2012). FURTHER, THE ENHANCEMENT OF ESE IN CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS ALSO INCREASES THEIR DRIVE TO BECOME AN ENTREPRENEUR OR DISPLAY ENTREPRENEURIAL SKILL SETS (STUDDARD, DAWSON & JACKSON, 2011).RESIDENTS OF RURAL AREAS REPRESENT ANOTHER SEGMENT OF SOCIETY WHERE PARTICIPATION IN ENTREPRENEURIAL ACTIVITY IS LOW. RURAL AREAS PRESENT UNIQUE CONDITIONS THAT HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH ADVERSITY FOR RURAL ENTREPRENEURS AND SMALL BUSINESSES, INCLUDING LOWER LEVELS OF POPULATION DENSITY, CONSUMER INCOME, AND EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT (USDA, 2002). LOW POPULATION DENSITY HINDERS BUSINESS GROWTH, AND AS A RESULT, RURAL BUSINESSES TEND TO BE SMALL WITH A VAST MAJORITY OF OWNERS OPERATING BUSINESSES IN THEIR AREA RESIDENCE (KUGLER, MICHAELIDES, NANDA & AGBAYANI, 2017). RURAL COMMUNITIES LAG BEHIND CITIES IN INVESTMENTS IN INFRASTRUCTURE AND BANDWIDTH CAPACITY DUE TO REMOTENESS AND LOW POPULATION DENSITY WHICH OFTEN RESULTS IN REDUCED COMPUTER ACCESS AND USE (SHIELDS, 2005). IN ADDITION TO ENTREPRENEURSHIP EDUCATION, THE FAB LAB WILL PROVIDE UP-TO-DATE EQUIPMENT, TOOLS, MATERIALS AND RESOURCES USUALLY UNOBTAINABLE TO RURAL RESIDENTS TO FOSTER THE DEVELOPMENT OF SUSTAINABLE FASHION AND APPAREL BUSINESSES WITHIN THEREGION.

CURRENTLY BABYBOOMERS REPRESENT 28% OF THE U.S. POPULATION, AND AS THEY CONTINUE TO AGE, MANY FACE HEALTHCARE CHALLENGES SUCH AS; DIABETES, CANCER, HEART DISEASE AND ALZHEIMER AND RELATED DISEASES. IN LOUISIANA APPROXIMATELY 1.6 MILLION (32%) OF PEOPLE ARE 50 YEARS OLD AND OLDER. THE SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND EXTENSION CENTER (SUAREC), EXTENSION PROGRAM'S FAMILY CONSUMER SCIENCES UNIT (FCS), AND COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURAL,FAMILY AND CONSUMER SCIENCES STRATEGIC GOALS ALIGN WITH THE INTENT OF THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF FOOD AND AGRICULTURE (NIFA). NIFA STRATEGIC GOAL 4; OBJECTIVE 4.1; "TO IMPROVE THE NATION'S NUTRITION AND HEALTH" ALIGNS WITH THE FOUNDATION OF THIS COLLABORATIVE PROPOSED PROJECT. THEREFORE, THIS PROJECT WILL PROMOTE PREVENTIVE CARE, SELF-HELP HEALTH MANAGEMENT, LONGEVITY, AND A GOOD QUALITY OF LIFE WHICH IS ALSO ADDRESSED IN THE CONTENT OF KNOWLEDGE AREAS; 703, 724, 801, 802, AND 805 IN THE SUAREC'S 2019 PLAN OF WORK. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1. TO IDENTIFY AND RECRUIT FAMILIES, AND RECOGNIZE THEIR LACK OF ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE; 2. TO DEVELOP HEALTH LITERACY JOURNAL AND SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIALS; 3. TO INCREASE INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY'S KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS IN HEALTH LITERACY AND HEALTH HISTORY; 4. TO ESTABLISH A TRAINING GROUND FOR EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING FOR DIETETIC INTERNS. PROGRAM EVALUATION DATA WILL BE COLLECTED IN WORKSHOP SESSIONS. ALSO, A SERIES OF ANALYSIS WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY THE BABYBOOMERS AND AGING POPULATION, DETERMINE KNOWLEDGE GAINED AMONG FAMILIES AND LACK OF ACCESSIBILITY AND AFFORDABILITY OF MEDICAL AND PREVENTATIVE CARE IN URBAN AND RURAL LOUISIANA.

INDUSTRIAL HEMP IS BEING INVESTIGATED CURRENTLY AS A POTENTIAL NEW CASH CROP IN THE US WITH THEPASSAGE OF THE 2014 AND 2018 FARM BILLS. HEMP SEEDS ARE UTILIZED IN THE PRODUCTION OF HEMP OILAND RESULT IN THE PRODUCTION OF HEMPSEED MEAL (HSM). THE HSM IS HIGH IN CRUDE PROTEIN, AND FIBERMAKING IT AN IDEAL CANDIDATE AS A FEEDSTUFF FOR RUMINANT ANIMALS. HOWEVER, HSM HAS NOT BEENAPPROVED FOR USE AS ANIMAL FEEDSTUFFS BY USDA/FDA/CVM TO DATE. TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY IS AMONGFIVE ALABAMA UNIVERSITIES LICENSED BY THE STATE TO GROW AND STUDY INDUSTRIAL HEMP. THE GOAL OF THISCOLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO CONDUCT NECESSARY FEEDING TRIALS INVOLVING GOATS AS RUMINANTMODELS SO THAT HSM CAN BE APPROVED AS A NOVEL ANIMAL FEED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES. SPECIFICOBJECTIVES ARE TO: ESTABLISH AN AVERAGE NUTRIENT PROFILE BY EVALUATING SAMPLES GROWN IN DIFFERENTSTATES, DETERMINE APPARENT DIGESTIBILITY, DETERMINE THE OPTIMAL INCLUSION RATES OF HSM FOR DIFFERENTCLASSES OF MEAT GOATS AND THEIR IMPACTS ON GROWTH PERFORMANCE, RUMEN PROFILE, BLOOD CHEMISTRY,IMMUNITY, CARCASS QUALITY, SUBMIT APPLICATION FOR NEW INGREDIENT DEFINITIONS TO AAFCO(ASSOCIATION OF AMERICAN FEED CONTROL OFFICIALS), AND ULTIMATELY SEEK APPROVAL FOR HSM AS AFEEDSTUFF FROM THE USDA/FDA. IT IS EXPECTED THAT THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A GROUNDWORK FORAPPROVAL OF HSM AS A FEEDSTUFF FOR GOATS AND SUPPORT INDUSTRIAL HEMP INDUSTRY. THE PROPOSEDPROJECT WILL AID IN ACHIEVING USDA-NIFA STRATEGIC GOALS TO ENSURE THE SUSTAINABLE/RURALCOMMUNITIES FOR 21ST CENTURY (EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR SMALL BUSINESS AND SMALL FARMS.

WE HOPE TO TRAIN FUTURE FISH AND WILDLIFE SCIENTISTS WITH HANDS-ON LEARNING GAINED THROUGH LAB EXERCISES IN COLLEGE COURSES AND PARTICIPATION IN UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH PROJECTS. WE WILL USE ON-LINE LEARNING TOOLS INCLUDING HOME-MADE VIDEOS OF OUR HANDS-ON LAB EXERCISES AND OTHER INTERACTIVE TRAINING MODULES AND MATERIALS. STUDENTS WILL ALSO INTERACT WITH THE PUBLIC THROUGH PLANNED PUBLIC OUTREACH EVENTS AT WATER FESTIVALS, EARTH DAY EVENTS, PUBLIC SCHOOL FAIRS AND OTHER SIMILAR ACTIVITIES WHERE THEY WILL DEMONSTRATE OUR WATERSHED STREAM EROSION MODEL AND OUR AQUACULTURE AND AQUAPONICS SYSTEMS AT OUR AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH STATION. THROUGH THESE EFFORTS WE HOPE TO FURTHER DEVELOP SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE, SCIENTISTS AND FOOD PRODUCTION SYSTEMS THAT CAN BE USED BY SMALL BUSINESS FARMERS AND LIMITED RESOURCE HOUSEHOLDS.

FOOD DESERTS HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED THE UNITED STATES POPULATION. INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE LIVING IN FOOD DESERT AREAS ARE AT RISK FOR IMPAIRED COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT, NUTRITION INEQUALITY, OBESITY/OVERWEIGHT, CHRONIC DISEASES AND POOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH PARTNERSHIPS WITH PREK-12 SCHOOLS, ADMINISTRATORS, TEACHERS, STAFF, STUDENTS, PARENTS AND THE COMMUNITY. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP CURRICULUM FOR PREK-12 STUDENTS, INCORPORATE SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATH'S (STEM), NEXT GENERATION SCIENCE STANDARDS (NGSS) AND PROVIDE CLASSROOM TRAINING AND FIELD EXPERIMENTATIONS. TEACHERS WILL LEARN HOW TO INTEGRATE GARDENING INTO THEIR CURRICULUM SO THAT CHILDREN CAN ENGAGE IN PROBLEM-SOLVING, CRITICAL THINKING, DECISION MAKING, TEAMWORK, AND INTERACT WITH NATURE AND SOCIETY. STUDENTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO ENGAGE IN BOTH INDOOR AND OUTDOOR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, HANDS-ON LEARNING WHERE THEY WILL MAKE PREDICTIONS, OBSERVE, DRAW CONCLUSION, SEARCHFOR ANSWERS, COLLECT DATA, ANALYZE DATA AND REPORT THEIR FINDINGS IN BOTH A WRITTEN AND ORAL MANNER. ALSO, THIS PROJECT WILL HELP STUDENTS TO LEARN HOW TO PLANT, MAINTAIN, HARVEST THEIR VEGETABLES AND COOK HEALTHY FOOD. STUDENTS WILL LEARN HOW TO SUSTAINABLY GROW FOOD IN INDOOR OR BACKYARD GARDENS, BUILD SURVIVAL SKILLS AND EAT HEALTHIER. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO SOLVE FOOD DESERT ISSUES, RAISE AWARENESS ABOUT FOOD DESERTS AND EDUCATE STUDENTS, THEIR FAMILIES AND THE PUBLIC.

OPTIMAL NUTRITION PLAYS A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN DETERMINING THE WELLBEING AND REDUCE THE RISK OF CONTRACTING DISEASES. THE INCIDENCE OF GUT RELATED DISORDERS IS ON THE RISE, AND DUE TO COMPLEX NATURE OF THE DISEASE AND ORGAN, NO EFFECTIVE TREATMENT IS AVAILABLE TO ADDRESS THE MALADY. IT HAS BEEN SHOWN THAT DYSBIOSIS AND OXIDATIVE STRESS IN THE GUT CONTRIBUTES TO THE PROGRESSION OF INTESTINAL INFLAMMATORY BOWEL DISEASE (IBD) AND LEAKY GUT SYNDROME. IN ELDERLY, LEAKY GUT LEADS TO ACTIVATION OF IMMUNE MECHANISMS LINKED INFLAMMATION AND AUTOIMMUNITY LEADING TO SYSTEMIC COMPLICATIONS AND NUTRITIONAL DEFICIENCIES. RESEARCH HAS ESTABLISHED THAT ENTERIC BACTERIA PLAYS A MAJOR ROLE IN MAINTAINING HOMEOSTASIS. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT ABOUT 1000 TRILLION BACTERIA AND >1000 MICROORGANISMS RESIDE IN THE GI TRACT OF HUMAN. THESE ORGANISMS HAVE DEVELOPED A SYMBIOTIC RELATIONSHIP WITH THE HOST BODY AND HELP NOT ONLY EXCHANGE MATERIAL AND INFORMATION BUT CONTRIBUTE TO THE HOST'S NUTRITION, METABOLISM, EXCRETION, IMMUNITY, ETC. INTESTINAL BACTERIA HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO INFLUENCE CENTRAL PHYSIOLOGICAL FUNCTIONS SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF LYMPHATIC TISSUE, THE INDUCTION OF MUCOSAL TOLERANCE, ANGIOGENESIS, FAT STORAGE AND NEURO-ENDOCRINE FUNCTIONS. IN THIS RESPECT, PROBIOTICS ARE GAINING WIDESPREAD RECOGNITION AS NEW PREVENTION STRATEGIES OR THERAPIES FOR SEVERAL CHRONIC DISEASES. FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION (FAO) AND THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION (WHO) DEFINED PROBIOTICS AS: "LIVE MICROORGANISMS", WHICH, WHEN ADMINISTERED IN ADEQUATE AMOUNT CONFERS A HEALTH BENEFIT ON THE HOST. THE INTESTINE REMAINS THE GATEWAY TO MOST OF THE HEALTH EFFECTS DUE TO PREBIOTICS, WHICH MEDIATES THE MODULATION OF PROBIOTIC MICROORGANISMS.CURRENT PREBIOTICS ARE PREDOMINANTLY CARBOHYDRATE-BASED, BUT OTHER SUBSTANCES SUCH AS POLYPHENOLS AND POLYUNSATURATED FATTY ACIDS ALSO EXERT PREBIOTIC EFFECTS AND SUBSTANTIALLY INCREASE BIFIDOBACTERIA, LACTOBACILLI AND BUTYRATE PRODUCTION. GENERALLY REGARDED AS SAFE (GRAS) LACTOBACILLUS (INTESTINE) AND BIFIDOBACTERIUM (COLON) ARE THE TWO PROMINENT GROUPS WHICH ARE FREQUENTLY EMPLOYED IN FOODS AND OCCUPY IMPORTANT ECOLOGICAL POSITIONS IN THE HUMAN GASTROINTESTINAL TRACT. A PROBIOTIC MAY BE A SINGLE BACTERIAL STRAIN OR CONSORTIUM OF YEAST OR MOLD AS FOUND IN YOGHURT, FERMENTED AND UNFERMENTED FOODS AND BEVERAGES. SEVERAL SECONDARY METABOLITES PRESENT IN PLANTS LIKE RESVERATROL, QUERCETIN, POLYSACCHARIDES, COCOA HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS PREBIOTICS. PREBIOTICS HELP MAINTAIN OPTIMAL BALANCE OF PROBIOTIC ORGANISMS. ONE OF THE HALLMARKS OF AGEING AND PHYSIOLOGICAL DECLINE IS THE LOSS OF GUT INTEGRITY LEADING TO 'LEAKY GUT'. THIS CAUSES LEACHING OF GUT MICROBIOME, PATHOGENS AND EXTERNAL MOLECULES INTO BLOOD STREAM LEADING TO INFLAMMATORY RESPONSES, HYPER-IMMUNE ACTIVATION, ETC. CURRENTLY THERE ARE NO PRESCRIPTIONS FOR TREATING THIS CONDITION.DIET AND NUTRITION PLAY A MAJOR ROLE IN DETERMINING THE WELLBEING, DELAY AGE RELATED DEGENERATION, IMPROVE REGENERATION AND REDUCE THE RISK OF GUT DISEASES. THE LEAKY GUT STARTS INFLAMMATION AND AUTOIMMUNITY LEADING TO SYSTEMIC COMPLICATIONS AND NUTRITIONAL DEFICIENCIES. APPLICATION OF PHYTOCHEMICALS TO MODULATE GUT MICROBIOME AND IMPROVE GUT INTEGRITY MAY BE A POTENTIAL SOLUTION TO REMEDY THIS DISORDER. SEVERAL PHYTOCHEMICALS ALONG WITH GUT MICROBIOME AND ITS METABOLITES HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN MAINTAINING GUT INTEGRITY/HEALTH IN MODEL ORGANISMS AND HUMANS. SYNBIOTICS ARE SUBSTANCES WHICH PROVIDE GUT MICROBIOME ENHANCING MOLECULES AND SIMULTANEOUSLY CONTRIBUTE BENEFICIAL ORGANISMS TO THE GUT MICROBIAL CONSORTIA. PLANT METABOLITES HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO PROMOTE WELLNESS AND REDUCE DAMAGE, OR ENHANCE THE ORGANISM'S CAPACITY TO REPAIR THE DAMAGE, LEADING TO REDUCED RISK OF DISEASES AND EXTENDED LONGEVITY. PRIMARY AND SECONDARY METABOLITES OF PLANTS ARE KNOWN TO ENHANCE ORGANISM'S CAPACITY TO REDUCE/REPAIR THE DAMAGE LEADING TO REDUCED RISK OF AGE-RELATED DISEASES AND EXTENDED LONGEVITY. AMONG THE METABOLITES, RESVERATROL, A STILBENOID IS RECOGNIZED TO HAVE BENEFICIAL EFFECTS ON METABOLIC SYNDROME-RELATED ALTERATIONS, INCLUDING GLUCOSE AND LIPID HOMEOSTASIS IMPROVEMENT AND A REDUCTION IN FAT MASS, BLOOD PRESSURE, LOW-GRADE INFLAMMATION, AND OXIDATIVE STRESS AS WELL AS ENHANCE THE GROWTH OFLACTOCOCCUS LACTISAND INHIBIT THE GROWTH OF ENTEROCOCCUS FAECALIS. PLANT DERIVED STILBENOID RESVERATROL AND CURCUMIN ARE SUCCESSFULLY BEING USED TO TREAT VARIOUS AILMENTS. RESVERATROL MODULATES GUT MICROBIOTA, AND ITS BIOTRANSFORMATION BY GUT MICROBIOTA HELP MAINTAIN GUT HOMEOSTASIS. RESVERATROL IS PARTIALLY METABOLIZED BY GUT MICROBIOTA INDUCING CHANGES IN BACTERIAL COMPOSITION ASSOCIATED WITH BENEFICIAL METABOLIC OUTCOME. BERRY PHYTOCHEMICALS HAVE ALSO SHOWN TO EXHIBIT NUMEROUS HEALTH BENEFITS INCLUDING ANTICANCER, ANTI-INFLAMMATORY, ANTI-HYPERTENSION, AND ANTIOXIDANT ACTIVITIES.MUSCADINE GRAPE (VITIS ROTUNDIFOLIA) IS A RICH SOURCE OF FLAVONOIDS, STILBENES AND PROANTHOCYANIDINS WITH ANTIOXIDANT, ANTI-MICROBIAL, ANTI-CANCER, ANTI-DIABETIC, ANTI-INFLAMMATORY, IMMUNOMODULATORY, CARDIOPROTECTIVE, ANTI-OBESITY AND ANTI-LIPID ACCUMULATION PROPERTIES BUT ITS IMPACT ON GUT MICROBIOME AND GUT HEALTH IS UNKNOWN. IN VIEW OF THIS POTENTIAL, WE HYPOTHESIZE THAT MUSCADINE GRAPE COULD BE A SUPERIOR SOURCE OF PHYTOCHEMICALS TO MODULATE GUT MICROBIOME AND REDUCE AGE INDUCED 'LEAKY GUT'. THIS WOULD PROVIDE A POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITY TO ESTABLISH THE REJUVENATIVE EFFECT OF THE MUSCADINE GRAPE, LEARN THE IDENTITY OF BIOACTIVE COMPOUNDS AND ITS POTENTIAL AS A NUTRACEUTICAL FOOD SUPPLEMENT TO AID GUT HEALTH AND PROMOTE HEALTHY AGEING. HOWEVER, LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT THE PRE- AND PRO-BIOTIC POTENTIAL OF MUSCADINE GRAPE PHYTOCHEMICALS AND ENDOPHYTES IN ENHANCING GUT HEALTH. ACCORDINGLY, THIS STUDY IS AIMED AT EMPLOYING CUTTING EDGE TECHNOLOGIES TO DETERMINE THE EFFICACY OF MUSCADINE GRAPE FOR AUGMENTING GUT MICROBIOME AND REDUCE AGE RELATED 'LEAKY GUT'. THIS RESEARCHWILL UTILIZE MODEL ORGANISM TO DETERMINE THE EFFICACY OF MUSCADINE BERRY EXTRACT, IDENTIFY AND CHARACTERIZE ITS PHYTOCHEMICALS AND ENDOPHYTES WITH A POTENTIAL TO POSITIVELY MODULATE THE QUANTITY, QUALITY, PHYSIOLOGY OF GUT BACTERIA FOR IMPROVING GUT HEALTH. BERRIES SHOWING HIGH LEVELS OF PROBIOTIC AND PREBIOTIC POTENTIAL WILL BE CHARACTERIZED FOR THEIR PHYTOCHEMICALS AND ENDOPHYTES CONTENT AND COMPOSITION. THE IDENTIFIED GRAPE BERRY EXTRACTS AND ENDOPHYTES WILL BE CO-CULTURED WITH HUMAN GUT CELLS (CACO2) FOR TESTING THEIR AGGREGATION, INTEGRATION, AND SAFETY TO IDENTIFY THEIR MOLECULAR TARGETS AND VALIDATE THE POTENTIAL NUTRACEUTIC POTENTIAL OF MUSCADINE GRAPE EXTRACT TO PROMOTE GUT HEALTH.

THIS INTEGRATED PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO ENHANCE THE MUCH-NEEDED INFRASTRUCTURE AND QUALITY OF TEACHING, RESEARCH, ANDEXTENSION AT THE TUSKEGEE UNIVERSITY COLLEGE OF VETERINARY MEDICINE (TUCVM), THE ONLY HBCU WITH A CVM. THE PROPOSED PREHARVESTFOOD SAFETY FOCUS IS CRITICAL FOR TRAINING MINORITY GRADUATE STUDENTS (MS AND PHD) AND VETERINARY STUDENTS, WITH UPDATED"FOOD SAFETY MBIO 512" COURSE INCORPORATING STATE-OF-THE-ART MICROBIOME, NANO-BIOSENSORS, AND GENOMICS STUDIES. GRADUATESTUDENTS WILL GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN THESE CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGIES TO STUDY THE MICROBIOME OF CATTLE IN THE FARMS OF SMALLRESOURCE FARMERS IN THE "BLACK-BELT" REGION OF WEST ALABAMA AND CATEGORIZE COWS INTO SUPER SHEDDERS, INTERMITTENT SHEDDERS,AND NON-SHEDDERS OF SELECTED FOODBORNE PATHOGENS.
