BOTH ADULT AND LARVAL STAGES OF POLLINATORS ARE IMPORTANT FOR THE COLONY'S HEALTH AND VULNERABILITY UNDER BIOTIC STRESS (SUCH AS PATHOGENIC VIRAL INFECTIONS) AND ABIOTIC STRESS (SUCH AS PESTICIDE EXPOSURES). HOWEVER, THE GAP OF KNOWLEDGE IS HOW FARM LANDSCAPE TYPES (ORGANIC FARMS, CONVENTIONAL FARMS, AND ROADSIDE) AFFECT LEVELS OF THESE STRESSES AND BEE DEVELOPMENT. WE AIM TO USE THE HONEYBEES AND SMALL CARPENTER BEES TO INVESTIGATE I) THE VIRAL PREVALENCE AMONG COLONIES AND NESTS, II) PRODUCE 3D-PRINTED BEE VIRUS MODELS FOR EDUCATION ON BEE DISEASE; III) THE PESTICIDE RESIDUE IN THE POLLEN SAMPLES OF TWO BEE MODELS; IV) THE DIVERSITY OF POLLEN AND FLOWERING RESOURCES BETWEEN TWO BEE MODELS, AND V) OXIDATIVE STRESS LEVELS OF LARVAE. OUR INNOVATIVE HYPOTHESIS WILL GAIN SIGNIFICANT AND UNIQUE KNOWLEDGE ON POLLINATOR HEALTH UNDER THESE BIOTIC AND ABIOTIC STRESSORS IN THE FIELD, AND PROVIDE AFRICAN-AMERICAN STUDENTS LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES ON POLLINATOR HEALTH, MICROBIOLOGY, ECOLOGY, AND CHEMISTRY. CENTRAL STATE UNIVERSITY IS THE SOLE 1890 LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION IN OHIO. WE PLAN TO TRAIN FIFTEEN AFRICAN-AMERICAN STUDENTS FROM CENTRAL STATE UNIVERSITY AND ONE GRADUATE STUDENT FROM OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY WHO WILL BE TRAINED BY THE BEST RESEARCHERS FROM THIS INTERNATIONAL COLLABORATION ON POLLINATOR BIOLOGY, OPPORTUNITIES FOR CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCHER TOOLS AND TOPICS, ENTER SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE CAREER AND GAIN GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES FOR A FUTURE IN THE SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE AND AGRICULTURAL ECONOMY.

THE STATE OF FLORIDA IS VULNERABLE TO ALL TYPES OF DISASTER, BOTH NATURAL AND MANMADE. AS THE WEATHER PATTERNS AND CLIMATE CHANGES, IT IS A PRIORITY THAT OUR CITIZENS AND COMMUNITIES HAVE ADEQUATE KNOWLEDGE ON HOW TO PREPARE FOR, RESPOND TO, RECOVER FROM AND MITIGATE AGAINST DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES AND THEIR IMPACTS. WITHIN THE LAST 5 YEARS, THERE HAVE BEEN A SERIES OF DISASTERS WHICH HAVE SEVERELY IMPACTED RESIDENTS IN THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE, RESULTING IN MILLIONS OF PROPERTY DAMAGE, LOSS OF HOMES AND CROPS. RURAL AND AT-RISK URBAN COMMUNITIES ARE PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE DUE TO THEIR LOCATION AND LACK OF ACCESS TO RESOURCES. THEREFORE, THEIR CAPACITY TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY AND THEIR RECOVERY TIME IS OFTEN AMONG THE SLOWEST. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP AN EFFECTIVE AND TIMELY MECHANISM FOR PROVIDING RESEARCH BASED INFORMATION THAT WILL HELP RURAL AND AT-RISK RURAL COMMUNITIES, LIMITED RESOURCE FARMERS, AND THE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES LIVING IN THESE AREAS. TO BE MORE RESILIENT,LOCAL COMMUNITIES MUST BUILD COMMUNITY CAPACITY TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC VULNERABILITY TO DISASTERS AND COMMUNITY RECOVERY FROM DISASTERS. GIVING THESE PERSONS AND GROUPS THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NEEDED TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY WILL HELP INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY MOBILIZE BEFORE, DURING AND AFTER AN EMERGENCY. THE INTENT IS TO DEVELOP AN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM THAT CAN BE REPLICATED TO INCREASE PREPAREDNESS AND RESILIENCY. ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THIS GOAL AND SUPPORTING OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH DEVELOPING PEERREVIEWED CURRICULA, CONDUCTING WORKSHOPS/TRAININGS, RECRUITING TRAIN-THE-TRAINERS/PARTICIPANTS AND EVALUATING RESULTS. THE 4-H/YOUTH DELOPMENT COMPONENT WILL CONSIST OF DISASTER EDUCATION AND CAREER EXPLORATION IN RELATED AREAS INCLUDING NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, WEATHER, CLIMATE AND WATER.

THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO UTILIZE TECHNIQUES IN PRECISION BREEDING AND GENOME EDITING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF POWDERY MILDEW RESISTANT GRAPE CULTIVARS. GRAPEVINE IS AFFECTED BY SEVERAL FUNGAL DISEASES, WHICH ARE A SERIOUS THREAT TO GRAPE PRODUCTION WORLDWIDE. AMONG THE FUNGAL DISEASES AFFECTING GRAPEVINE, POWDERY MILDEW IS THE MOST DEVASTATING DISEASE WORLDWIDE. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE 1) IDENTIFICATION AND ISOLATION OF TARGET MLO CANDIDATE GENES FROM THE VITIS GENOME FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF CRISPR/CAS9 CONSTRUCTS, 2) TARGETING MLO GENES IN EMBRYOGENIC CULTURES TO GENERATE EDITED GRAPE PLANT LINES, 3) GREENHOUSE SCREENING OF EDITED PLANT LINES TO POWDERY MILDEW RESISTANCE AND 4) QUANTIFYING PLANT RESPONSE TO POWDERY MILDEW INFECTION USING SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPY.THE PROJECT UTILIZES GRAPE GENOME INFORMATION ALONG WITH GENOME EDITING TECHNOLOGY TO GENERATE TARGETED MUTATIONS WHILE KEEPING DESIRED VITICULTURAL TRAITS INTACT. GENOME EDITING, WHICH INVOLVES MODIFICATION OF DNA SEQUENCES SOLELY FROM THE GRAPE GENOME, IS CONSUMER AND ECOFRIENDLY INASMUCH IT DISRUPTS THE GENOME MUCH LESS THAN TRADITIONAL BREEDING AND SHOULD CAUSE NO GMO-RELATED CONCERNS. DISEASE RESISTANT GRAPE CULTIVARS WILL PROVIDE MAJOR ADVANTAGES SUCH AS DECREASED PRODUCTION COSTS, DRAMATICALLY REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF FUNGICIDES THEREBY LOWERING EXPOSURE OF WORKERS AND NON-TARGET ORGANISMS, AND IMPROVEMENT OF BIODIVERSITY IN VINEYARDS. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO MINORITY GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS THEREBY ENHANCING CAPACITY BUILDING IN RESEARCH AND TEACHING. MULTI-DISCIPLINARY EXPERTISE OF COLLABORATORS WILL COMPLEMENT INDIVIDUAL PROGRAMS AND EXPAND CUTTING EDGE RESEARCH IN AREAS OF GENOMICS AND PLANT BREEDING THAT CAN BE UTILIZED BY 1890 INSTITUTIONS FOR MINORITY STUDENT RESEARCH AND TRAINING.

ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORKS (ANN), AN INFORMATION PROCESSING TECHNIQUE, CONTINUES TO REVOLUTIONIZE AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES FROM PRECISION FARMING TO ECONOMICAL PRODUCTION OF HEALTHY FOOD ITEMS, RELYING HEAVILY ON COMPUTER-BASED INSTRUMENTATION AND MEASUREMENT. THE DEMAND FOR THESE INTERDISCIPLINARY 'AGRI-ANN TECHNOLOGIES' IS VERY HIGH AND UNDERSCORES THE NEED FOR A NEW BREED OF GRADUATES WITH SOLID TRAINING IN ANN AND ADEQUATE KNOWLEDGE OF THE AGRICULTURAL PROBLEMS TO BE SOLVED.MANY RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS HAVE RESPONDED TO THE DEMANDS OF THEIR STUDENTS AND MARKETPLACE BY REVISING THEIR CURRICULA TO INCLUDE AGRI-ANNS AS MINOR AND/OR MAJOR PROGRAM. HOWEVER, DUE TO LACK OF WELL-THOUGHT-OUT PEDAGOGY AND ACCOMPANYING TECHNOLOGY-RICH LEARNER-FACILITY (LACK OF BASIC COMPUTERS AND INSTRUCTIONAL DELIVERY SYSTEMS), STUDENTS AT FORT VALLEY STATE UNIVERSITY (FVSU) HAVE NOT BEEN ACTIVELY PREPARED IN AGRI-ANN.THEREFORE, THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO ENHANCE STUDENTS' COMPETENCIES IN AGRI-ANN BY DEVELOPING INQUIRY-BASED CURRICULUM AND LEARNER-SUPPORTING TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE AND FACULTY PREPARATION TO ASSIST WITH STUDENTS' EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN THE SUBJECT. THE NEW HIGH-TECH LABORATORY WILL INCLUDE STATE-OF-THE-ART COMPUTERS EQUIPPED WITH DATA ACQUISITION AND ANALYSIS SOFTWARE AS WELL AS VARIOUS INSTRUCTIONAL-DELIVERY SYSTEMS TO FACILITATE FACULTY TO EFFECTIVELY CONDUCT THE HANDS-ON EXERCISES OF AGRI-ANN MODULES AND COMPUTER-BASED SIMULATIONS OF EXISTING COURSES IN THE DEPARTMENT.THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL: (1) STRENGTHEN THE TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURE, THUS HELPING STUDENTS GARNER A SOLID KNOWLEDGE IN AGRI-ANN APPROACHES, (2) ENRICH FVSU FACULTY PREPARATION IN AGRI-TECHNOLOGY CURRICULUM AND INSTRUCTIONAL DELIVERY TOOLS, (3) PROMOTE INTERDEPARTMENTAL TEACHING AND RESEARCH COLLABORATIONS, AND (4) ENSURE AN INCREASED RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF MERITORIOUS STUDENTS

ANIMAL POPULATIONS ARE NOW SELECTED USING NOT ONLY THE PEDIGREE AND PHENOTYPIC BUT ALSOTHEGENOMIC INFORMATION. THESTANDARDMETHOD FOR ANALYSIS IS SSGBLUP, WHICH CONSIDERS ALL THREESOURCES OF INFORMATION JOINTLY.BIASES OF GENOMIC PREDICTIONS HAVE BEEN OBSERVED PREDOMINANTLY IN DAIRY CATTLE WHEN THEPEDIGREES ARE INCOMPLETE. THISIS DUE TO IGNORING OF DIFFERENT GENETIC LEVEL OFDIFFERENT GROUPS OF UNKNOWN PARENTS. OLD METHODS ACCOUNTING FOR UNKNOWN PARENT GROUPS WERE NOT SUCCESSFUL. WE WILL BE APPLYING A NEW METHOD CALLED METAFOUNDERS THAT SHOWED PROMISE IN SIMULATIONS AND ANALYSES OF SMALL FIELD DATA.WHEN ANIMALS AREEVALUATED GENETICALLY, IT IS DESIRABLE TO HAVE A MEASURE OF ACCURACY OF THEIR EVALUATIONS. CURRENT METHODS FORAPPROXIMATIONS OF ACCURACY ARE LIMITED TO SIMPLE MODELS AND ARE LESS ACCURATE WITH LARGE DATA SETS. WE WILL TRY TO EXTEND SUCH METHODS TO ARBITRARILY LARGE DATA SETS AND TO COMPLEX MODELS FOR ANALYSES.THERE IS AN INTEREST IN FINDING ACTUAL NUCLEOTIDES CALLED CAUSATIVE SNPTHATAFFECT TRAITSOF INTEREST. CURRENT METHODS ARE LIMITED TO SINGLE MODELS AND ARE PRONE TO FALSE READINGS REFLECTING THE POPULATION STRUCTURE AND NOT THEACTUAL CAUSATIVE SNP.THE METHOD OF SSGBLUP THAT IS ABLE TO USE ALL AVAILABLEINFORMATION (PEDIGREE, PHENOTYPES, GENOMIC) JOINTLYWAS MODIFIEDFOR GENOME WIDE ASSOCIATION (GWAS) WITH OPTION FOR SIGNIFICANCE TESTING (P-VALUES). WE WILL EXTEND THIS METHOD FOR VERY LARGE DATA SETS AND WILL USE IT FOR IMPUTED SEQUENCE DATA.

DUE TO CLIMATE CHANGE, INCREASED IMPERMEABLE SURFACES, AND AGING DRAINAGE SYSTEMS, FLOOD FREQUENCY IS GETTING HIGHER AND THE SEVERITY OF THE DAMAGE HAS BECOME GREATER IN MANY CITIES WORLD-WIDE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE CONSTRUCTED WETLANDS TO REMEDIATE SURFACE WATER RUNOFF AND REDUCE THE POTENTIAL OF FLASH FLOODING IN HIGH RISK URBAN AREAS. THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO: 1) CREATE A UNIQUE STRUCTURAL SOIL THAT MIMICS WETLANDS NATURAL SOILS, 2) DETERMINE WHAT CONSTRUCTED WETLAND DESIGN WORKS BEST, 3) DETERMINE THE PHYTOREMEDIATION POTENTIAL OF DESIGNED CONSTRUCTED WETLAND, AND 4) DETERMINE HIGH RISK FLOOD AREA. TO CREATE THE PROPRIETARY STRUCTURAL WETLAND SOIL, SODIUM POLYACRYLATE (HYDRO GEL) WILL BE USED TO ENSURE MAXIMUM ABSORPTION PER UNIT AREA OF SOIL. A CONSTRUCTED WETLAND WITH RETENTION CELLS AND FLOW THROUGH PLANTERS WILL BE DESIGNED AND USED WITH VARIATIONS OF BIOREACTORS AND WATER FLOW REGULATING MATERIALS WITHIN EACH CELL. TO DETERMINE HIGH RISK FLOOD AREA, GIS 3D MODELING WILL BE USED. THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN IDENTIFYING FLASH FLOODING RISK IN URBAN AREAS AND HOW INNOVATIONS IN GREEN ENGINEERING CAN MITIGATE THE RISK. THE PROJECT INNOVATION INCLUDES ADDRESSING THE URGENT NEED FOR FLOOD MITIGATION BY USING CONSTRUCTED WETLAND AND ITS ASSOCIATED SYNTHETIC SOIL, AND DEVELOPING STRATEGIES IN FLOOD WATER CONTROL, MANAGEMENT, AND MOVEMENT. THE PROJECT IS INALIGNMENT WITH SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY'S, ALONG WITH THE USDA'S PRIORITY AREA IN GLOBAL CLIMATE CHANGE AND WATER QUALITY.

THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT ALIGNS DIRECTLY WITH SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH AND EXTENSION CENTER'S (SUAREC) LONG-RANGE GOALS. THESE INCLUDE DELIVERING: A) NEW RESEARCH-BASED TECHNOLOGIES; B) QUALITY AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS; C) SERVICES TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC CONDITIONS; AND D) QUALITY OF LIFE FOR LIMITED-RESOURCE FARMERS WHILE BUILDING RESEARCH CAPACITY IN PLANT-BASED NUTRACEUTICAL RESEARCH. SUAREC IN COLLABORATION WITH USDA AND GRAPE GROWERS WILL USE BIOSTIMULATOR AND LEDS TO ENHANCE THE PHYTO-NUTRACEUTICALS IN GRAPES FOR INCREASING THEIR ANTIOXIDANT CAPACITY AND SUBSEQUENTLY ENHANCE THEIR HUMAN HEALTH BENEFITS. THE MULTIDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH APPROACH INCLUDES: (I) APPLICATION OF BIOSTIMULATOR/STIMULANTS TO RIPENING AND RIPE MUSCADINE BERRIES; (II) DETERMINING CHANGES IN GENE EXPRESSION ASSOCIATED WITH FLAVONOID/STILBENOID SYNTHESIS; (III) ELUCIDATE THE EFFECT OF BERRY EXTRACTS ON INFLAMMATORY RESPONSES AND STUDY THE PROFILE/ACTIVITY OF PROTEASOME VARIANTS AND AUTOPHAGY MECHANISM IN LUNG PRIMARY AND ADENOCARCINOMA EPITHELIAL CELLS; AND (IV) DEVELOP LEADERSHIP AND TECHNICAL SKILLS OF MINORITY STUDENTS IN AGRICULTURE/ CANCER/MOLECULAR BIOLOGY RESEARCH. IN BRIEF, WE WILL USE NATURALLY OCCURRING BIOSTIMULATOR MELATONIN AND EMERGING LED LIGHTING TECHNOLOGY TO ENRICH GRAPE NUTRACEUTICAL COMPOUNDS WITH AIM TO DEVELOP PRODUCTS WITH IMPROVED HEALTH BENEFITS. OUR FINDINGS WILL ENHANCE SCIENCE-BASED KNOWLEDGE AND WILL SUPPORT THE TRAINING OF UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS IN CHROMATOGRAPHY, MASS SPECTROMETRY, ANIMAL CELL CULTURES AND GENE EXPRESSION/ACTIVATION STUDIES. THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED WILL EXPAND OUR IDEAS ABOUT THE APPLICATION OF BIOSTIMULATORS/LED TECHNOLOGY TO OTHER SMALL FRUITS AND NICHE CROPS THAT WILL INCREASE THEIR UTILIZATION AND MARKET VALUE. THE ACQUIRED RESEARCH EXPERIENCES AND COLLABORATION WILL STRENGTHEN SOUTHERN UNIVERSITY RESEARCH CAPABILITIES AND COMPETITIVENESS.

A SERIOUS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUE CONFRONTING THE STATE OF FLORIDA, AS WELL AS THE NATION, IS THE DECLINING HEALTH OF SPRINGS AND SPRING RUNS DUE TO VARIOUS ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS (AND THEIR INTERACTIONS) THAT INCLUDE GROUNDWATER DEPLETION, NUTRIENT ENRICHMENT, FLOW REDUCTION, INVASIVE SPECIES (E.G., HYDRILLA), AND INCREASED ALGAL GROWTH. THISPROJECT FOCUSESON SPRINGS AND SPRING-FED STREAMS OF FORESTED WATERSHEDS OF PUBLIC LANDS WITHIN THE UPPER HEADWATER PORTIONS OF THE ST. MARKS RIVER BASIN, WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE NORTH FLORIDA PANHANDLE. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO BUILD INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY IN WATERSHED RESEARCH THROUGH THE INVESTIGATION OF AQUATIC INDICATOR SPECIES AT THE WATERSHED SCALE. FIELD SURVEYS WILL BE CARRIED OUT TO COLLECT IMPORTANT BASELINE DATA ON THE AQUATIC INSECT AND AQUATIC PLANT DIVERSITY. FIELD-SURVEY DATA WILL THEN BE ANALYZED TO DETERMINE AQUATIC INSECT SPECIES THAT ARE THE BEST BIOINDICATORS OF HEALTHY AQUATIC HABITATS WITHIN THE BASIN. THE RESPONSES OF AQUATIC BIOINDICATOR SPECIES TO CHANGES IN ENVIRONMENTAL PARAMETERS (E.G., WATER TEMPERATURE, DISSOLVED OXYGEN, FLOW RATES) WILL BE INVESTIGATED FURTHER UNDER FIELD AND CONTROLLED LABORATORY SETTINGS. THE BIODIVERSITY SURVEY DATA AND BIOPHYSICAL DATA (FIELD AND LABORATORY) WILL BE INTEGRATED AND DEVELOPED INTO A NOVEL CONCEPTUAL MODEL, SO-NAMED THE BIOPHYSICAL INDICATOR-SPECIES MODEL (BISM). THE MODEL WILL USED AS A TOOL FOR GUIDING LAND USE/FOREST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES THAT HELP TO ENHANCE WATER RESOURCES BY MAKING THEM MORE SUSTAINABLE AND RESILIENT TO CLIMATE CHANGE.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ENROLL AND GRADUATE 15 STUDENTS IN AGRICULTURAL BIOTECHNOLOGY AT FVSU THROUGH SYSTEMATIC AND PROVEN OUTREACH TO LOCAL HIGH SCHOOLS FOCUSING ON UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS. IT WILL EXPAND THE STUDENT TRAINING EXPERIENCE AND IMPROVE THE EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH TRAINING CAPACITY OF THE FVSU'S IN THE AREA OF BIOTECHNOLOGY, GENOMICS AND PLANT SCIENCES.

THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO UTILIZE FUNDING TO RECRUIT AND EQUIP TWO UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCHERS WHO WILL WORK WITH DR. JOSHUA RINGER, DR. TRACEY PAYTON-MILLER, AND DR. NIRODHA DE SILVA TO SURVEY RURAL TRADITIONALLY UNDERSERVED PRODUCERS. COMMUNITY LEADERS AND FOOD ENTREPRENEURS WILL BE ENGAGED TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL MARKETS FOR LOCAL FOOD PRODUCTION AND SPECIALTY CROP PRODUCTION. PROMISING VALUE CHAINS WILL BE IDENTIFIED TO INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE AGRIPRENEURSHIP SMALL FARMS PROGRAM. UTILIZING THIS INFORMATION AND RELATIONSHIPS WILL HELP INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF SMALL FARM PRODUCTION MODELS THAT HAVE THE MOST ECONOMIC VIABILITY AND CAN BE TIED INTO RURAL AND URBAN MARKETS. THE PROGRAMMING DEVELOPED IN THE SMALL FARMS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A UNIQUE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT BASED AT LANGSTON UNIVERSITY WHERE LANGSTON UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURE STUDENTS HAVE HANDS ON EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES WITH APPROPRIATE SCALE EQUIPMENT, NO-TILL AND REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE, AND SOUND ECONOMIC PRINCIPLES FOR STARTING AND OPERATING A SMALL RURAL OR URBAN FARM. THE SMALL FARMS PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND AN ANNUAL SMALL FARMS CONFERENCE THAT WILL BRING PRODUCERS FROM AROUND THE STATE AND THE SOUTHERN GREAT PLAINS TO SEE THE LATEST IN PRODUCTION MODELS, SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, AND MEET FOOD BUYERS. THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO GIVE LANGSTON UNIVERSITY STUDENTS OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD AGRIBUSINESS PROPOSALS AND TO PITCH THESE TO A NETWORK OF POTENTIAL IMPACT INVESTORS AND LENDERS. IF FUNDED, THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE LANGSTON UNIVERSITY TO BECOME A LEADER IN SMALL FARMS PROGRAMMING THAT WILL BENEFIT LANGSTON UNIVERSITY STUDENTS AND AFFILIATED COMMUNITIES THROUGH GREATER OPPORTUNITY TO OPERATE MORE PROFITABLE AND SUSTAINABLE FARMS.

THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE NEED TO PROVIDE MULTIDISCIPLINARY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS IN ALL ASPECTS OF "REAL-WORLD" FUNDAMENTAL AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE. THE UNIQUE APPROACH OF FORMING AN ADVISORY COMMITTEE MADE UP OF CURRENT AGRICULTURE TEACHERS TO STEER THE WORKSHOP CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT WILL ENSURE THAT WORKSHOPS ARE BOTH RELEVANT AND CURRICULUM SUPPORTING. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE LACK OF HANDS-ON AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH PHYSICAL AND/OR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE:1) TO PROVIDE HANDS-ON DEMONSTRATION OPPORTUNITIES THAT EXPOSE STUDENTS TO STATE-OF-THE-ART EQUIPMENT AND CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGY; 2) TO CREATE AN ADA-COMPLIANT BRAILLE TRAIL AT THE ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND RESEARCH CENTER (EERC) THAT WILL PROVIDE UNIQUE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO INDIVIDUALS WITH PHYSICAL IMPAIRMENTS OR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES; 3) TO CREATE HANDS-ON PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TEACHERS IN AGRICULTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE; AND 4) TO CREATE A HANDS-ON AGRICULTURE SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) LABORATORY THAT WILL ACT AS A FACILITY TO CARRY OUT WORKSHOPS AND DEVELOP HANDS-ON EXPERIENCES FOR STUDENTS. THIS PROJECT EDUCATES STUDENTS ON THE IMPORTANCE OF AGRICULTURE, THE DEMAND FOR MORE FOOD DUE TO A GROWING WORLD POPULATION, AND THE IMPORTANCE OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSCIOUSNESS. LASTLY, THIS PROJECT WILL NOT ONLYREINFORCE CONCEPTS LEARNED IN THE CLASSROOM, BUT WILL ALSO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO INVESTIGATE POTENTIAL COLLEGE AND CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE FIELDS.

THE COMMON TECHNIQUES USED FOR THE ESTIMATION OF TREE CANOPY COVERAGE ARE LINE-INTERCEPT, SPHERICAL DENSIOMETER, MOOSEHORN OR HEMISPHERICAL PHOTOGRAPHY, ALL OF WHICH DEMAND INTENSIVE MANUAL OPERATIONS BOTH IN DATA COLLECTION (TYPICALLY UNDERNEATH THE TREES) AND IN POST-PROCESSING THE RESULTS, CALCULATIONS AND REPORTS. THESE LABOR-INTENSIVE TECHNIQUES RESULT IN HIGH COSTS AND ARE DIFFICULT TO APPLY AT LARGE SCALE AREAS. WE PROPOSED TO ACQUIRE AIRBORNE IMAGES BY FLYING A LOW-ALTITUDE DRONE LOADED WITH A DIGITAL CAMERA OVER LARGE-SCALE VINEYARD. THE AIRBORNE IMAGES CONVEY ALL NECESSARY INFORMATION, AND THE IMAGE ANALYSIS TECHNIQUES PLUS DEEP LEARNING NEURAL NETWORK CAN CREATE A SET OF REGRESSION MODELS FOR THE ANTICIPATED CALCULATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, WE CAN PREDICT THE CANOPY COVERAGE, THE DENSITY OF TREE, THE INTER-TREE SPACE, THE CROWN VOLUME, THE TOTAL LEAF AREA, AND THE TOTAL DRY LEAF WEIGHT OF ONE PLANT, WHICH WILL GUIDE IN PLANTING INTERCROPS LIKE LEGUMES, CONDIMENTS (TURMERIC AND GINGER), OR COVER CROPS (HAIRY VETCH) TO PREVENT SOIL EROSION, AND IN APPLYING THE REQUIRED QUANTITY OF COMPOST OR FERTILIZER.THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS TO PRECISELY AND EFFICIENTLY PREDICT THE CANOPY COVERAGE, INTER-TREE SPACE, TOTAL LEAF AREA, AND TOTAL DRY LEAF WEIGHT BY FLYING A DRONE WITH A BUILT-IN CAMERA OVER A LARGE-SCALE VINEYARD. THE MEASURED CANOPY RESULTS WILL GUIDE IN PLANTING INTERCROPS OR COVER CROPS TO PREVENT SOIL EROSION, AND IN APPLYING THE REQUIRED QUANTITY OF COMPOST OR FERTILIZER.

AS WE ENTER AN ERA IN WHICH GLOBAL FOOD PRODUCTION IS LIKELY TO DOUBLE AS THE HUMAN POPULATION INCREASES, SHARING PRIME AGRICULTURAL LANDS AND RESOURCES FOR FOOD AND ENERGY PRODUCTION BECOMES AN EVEN GREATER CHALLENGE. A BREAKTHROUGH TECHNOLOGY THAT ENABLES THE CULTIVATION OF AN ENERGY CROP ON A VAST AREA OF MARGINAL LANDS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES. GIVEN THE ECONOMIC VALUE OF SEED COMPOUNDS, AGRICULTURE-BREEDING RESEARCH HAS FOCUSED EXTENSIVELY ON IMPROVING TRAITS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE COMPOUNDS. METABOLIC ENGINEERING STRATEGIES HAVE BEEN INSTRUMENTAL IN DEVELOPING MECHANISMS TO IMPROVE SEED COMPOUNDS IN CROPS. RECENTLY, THE USE OF METABOLIC ENGINEERING AND CRISPR/CAS9 IN ENERGY CROPS IMPROVED THE PRODUCTION OF OLEIC ACID IN THE SEEDS FOR IMPROVED OIL OXIDATIVE STABILITY AND OMEGA-3 FATTY ACIDS. OUR OVERALL GOAL IS TO GENERATE OIL-RICH CAMELINA PLANTS CAPABLE OF GROWING ON LARGE AREAS OF APPALACHIAN SURFACE COAL MINE LANDS. DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS SUCH AS TRANSCRIPTOMICAND METABOLOMICS DATA, GENE CONSTRUCTS AND GENOME-EDITED TRANSGENIC LINES IN ARABIDOPSIS AND CAMELINA, WILL BE OF IMPORTANCE TO SCIENTISTS WORKING IN BASIC AND APPLIED ENERGY RESEARCH. SHARING OF LARGE-SCALE SEQUENCING DATA IN THIS PROJECT WITH THE BROADER SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY WILL SUPPORT RESEARCH PROJECTS RELATED TO MODEL AND CROP PLANTS. IN ACCORDANCE WITH OUR MISSION AS AN 1890 LAND GRANT INSTITUTION, OUR PRINCIPAL EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVE IS TO CREATE STEM-CENTRIC LEARNING AND VOCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR MINORITY (AND OFTEN FIRST-GENERATION) COLLEGE STUDENTS WHO COME FROM A REGION WITH THE LOWEST COLLEGE ATTENDANCE RATE IN THE NATION.

IN THE LAST 20 YEARS OR SO, THE GOAT INDUSTRY IN THE UNITED STATES HAS PROFITED BY AMERICAN'S INCREASED DESIRE TO PRODUCE FOOD WITHOUT CHEMICALS AND PESTICIDES, AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF COMMERCIAL ENTERPRISES FOR PROCESSING MEAT AND MILK PRODUCTS. THE DOE IS SEASONALLY POLYESTROUS AND THE BREEDING SEASON IS GENERALLY RESTRICTED TO THE AUTUMN AND WINTER. MANY OTHER FACTORS INCLUDING NUTRITION, TEMPERATURE, DISEASE, PRESENCE OF THE MALE, AND GENETIC VARIATIONS MAY ALSO INFLUENCE THE SEASONALITY, AND HENCE, REPRODUCTIVE EFFICIENCY. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE EFFECTS OF GRAZING LEGUMES AND GRASSES MIXTURES ON IMPROVING THE REPRODUCTIVE EFFICIENCY OF GOATS IN ORDER TO INCREASE FARM INCOME PER UNIT ANIMAL OF PRODUCTION UNDER INTENSIVE AND ROTATIONAL GRAZING SYSTEMS. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE: 1.TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTS OF DIVERSE GRASS AND LEGUME FORAGES ON THE OCCURRENCE OF ESTRUS, LENGTHS OF ESTROUS CYCLES AND OVERALL REPRODUCTIVE EFFICIENCY IN THE SPANISH AND KIKO GOATS. 2.TO ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF THREE KIDDINGS IN TWO YEARS BY INDUCING FERTILE ESTRUS DURING THE NON-BREEDING SEASONS IN THE SPANISH AND KIKO GOATS. 3.TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF DIVERSE FORAGES IN CONTROLLING PARASITES IN GOATS TO REDUCE THE OVERALL LEVELS OF PASTURE CONTAMINATION. THE INNOVATIVE NATURE OF THIS PROPOSAL LIES ON THE COMBINED RESEARCH EFFORT OF MIXING LIVESTOCK SPECIES, INTENSIVE ROTATIONAL MANAGEMENT FOR FORAGE SUSTAINABILITY, AND SEQUENTIAL GRAZING TO OPTIMIZE UTILIZATION OF AVAILABLE FORAGES TO ADDRESS THE CRITICAL ISSUE OF REPRODUCTION AND PARASITES IN SMALL RUMINANTS, AND THE REDUCTION OF INPUTS FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL ENTERPRISES.

OBESITY IS A SERIOUS PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM, BECOMING ONE OF THE LEADING CAUSES OF DEATH AND MORBIDITY WORLDWIDE. ABOUT 39% (>1.5 BILLION) OF ADULTS ARE OVERWEIGHT AND 13% (500 MILLION) ARE OBESE. OBESITY AND OVERWEIGHT ARE DEFINED AS EXCESSIVE FAT ACCUMULATION AND CLOSELY ASSOCIATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF DYSLIPIDEMIA, INSULIN RESISTANCE AND HYPERTENSION THAT ARE ALL WELL-KNOWN RISK FACTORS FOR VARIOUS DISEASES. IN MAMMALS, BODY WEIGHT AND ENERGY BALANCE ARE REGULATED BY CONTROLLING FOOD INTAKE AND ENERGY EXPENDITURE (EE) THROUGH THE INTERACTIONS OF PERIPHERAL NUTRIENTS AND HORMONES WITH DIFFERENT NEURONAL SUBPOPULATIONS. LEPTIN AND GHRELIN ARE THE TWO HORMONES WHICH PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN THE REGULATION OF FOOD INTAKE AND BODY WEIGHT. BOTH ORIGINATE IN THE PERIPHERY AND SIGNAL THROUGH DIFFERENT PATHWAYS TO THE BRAIN, PARTICULARLY TO THE HYPOTHALAMUS. LEPTIN FUNCTIONS AS A FEEDBACK MECHANISM THAT SIGNALS KEY REGULATORY CENTERS IN THE BRAIN TO INHIBIT FOOD INTAKE FOR CONTROLLING BODY WEIGHT AND ENERGY HOMEOSTASIS. ONE OF THE CAUSES OF OBESITY IS RESISTANCE TO LEPTIN, THE HORMONE PRODUCED BY THE ADIPOCYTE-THE PRIMARY CELL IN BODY FAT-THAT SIGNAL BRAIN TO REDUCE FEELING OF HUNGER BECAUSE BODY HAS ACCUMULATED ENOUGH FAT.MUSCADINE GRAPE HAS BEEN SHOWN TO EXHIBIT NUMEROUS HEALTH BENEFITS INCLUDING ANTICANCER, ANTI-INFLAMMATORY, ANTI-HYPERTENSION, ANTIOXIDANT ACTIVITIES. WE HYPOTHESIZE THAT USE OF WHOLE BERRY EXTRACT WITH BIOACTIVE PHYTOCHEMICALS MAY SIMULTANEOUSLY ACT ON VARIOUS RECEPTORS TO TRIGGER ANTI-OBESITY EFFECT. WE ALSO THEORIZE THAT CONSUMPTION OF DIETARY POLYPHENOLICS COULD RESCUE THE ANOREXIGENIC ACTIONS OF LEPTIN BY INTERFERING WITH THOSE METABOLIC ABNORMALITIES THAT ATTENUATE LEPTIN SIGNALING IN DIET-INDUCED OBESITY. LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT THE MODE OF ACTION OF PHYTOCHEMICALS IN REGULATING LEPTIN RESISTANCE FOR PREVENTING/INHIBITING OBESITY. ACCORDINGLY, THIS STUDY IS AIMED AT DETERMINING THE ABILITY OF PHYTOCHEMICALS-RICH WHOLE MUSCADINE GRAPE EXTRACT (WMGE) TO MODULATE RESISTANCE/EXPRESSION OR ACTION OF OBESITY HORMONES, LEPTIN AND GHRELIN, TWO KEY HORMONES IN THE REGULATION OF ENERGY BALANCE, IN THE CONTROL OF ADIPOSITY. IN PARTICULAR, WE WILL FOCUS ON EFFECTORS AND PATHWAYS THAT MUSCADINE GRAPE EXTRACT TRIGGER TO EMULATE LEPTIN RESISTANCE. THE MUSCADINE GRAPE EXTRACTS WILL BE TESTED USING PRE-ADIPOCYTE CELL LINES (3T3-L1) FOR ITS ABILITY TO REDUCE FAT ABSORPTION AND ACCUMULATION. EFFECTIVELY FUNCTIONING ANTI-OBESITY EXTRACTS WILL BE SUBJECTED TO MOLECULAR STUDIES TO IDENTIFY GENETIC NETWORKS AND PROTEIN TARGETS. THE OUTCOME WILL BE DISSEMINATED TO CONSUMERS, GROWERS AND INDUSTRY THROUGH VARIOUS OUTREACH ACTIVITIES INCLUDING WORKSHOPS, FIELD DAYS, BROCHURES, PUBLICATIONS, ETC. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL PROMOTE STATE OF THE ART CAPACITY BUILDING IN NUTRIGENOMICS AND AGRO-NUTRACEUTICALS AT CAFS/FAMU. IN ADDITION, THIS RESEARCH WILL GIVE FACULTY AND STUDENTS AN OPPORTUNITY TO AUGMENT THEIR RESEARCH SKILLS IN THE AREAS OF PLANT-BASED NUTRACEUTICALS ON HUMAN HEALTH. OVER AND ABOVE, THIS RESEARCH INTENDS TO PROVIDE A BETTER MANAGEMENT OPTION FOR OBESE POPULATION WHO ARE AT THE HIGHER RISK OF OTHER DISEASES AND THIS IS ONE OF THE PRIORITIES OF CBG.

DESCRIPTION OF THE CURRENT PROBLEM:BOVINE HERPESVIRUS TYPE 1 (BHV-1) INFECTION OF CATTLE CAUSED A NUMBER OF SERIOUS COMPLICATIONS SUCH AS UPPER RESPIRATORY TRACT DISORDERS, CONJUNCTIVITIS, AND GENITAL DISEASES. FURTHERMORE, THE VIRUS MAY INDUCE AN IMMUNE SUPPRESSION CALLED BOVINE RESPIRATORY DISEASE COMPLEX (BRDC) IN WHICH THE U.S. CATTLE INDUSTRY SUFFERS APPROXIMATELY 3 BILLION DOLLARS LOSS EVERY YEAR. BHV-1 BELONGS TO THE SUPERFAMILYOF HERPESVIRUSES SUCH AS HERPES SIMPLEX VIRUS (HSV) AND VARICELLA ZOSTER VIRUS (VZV). THEY SHARE A VARIETY OF SIMILARITY IN TERMS OF THE GENOMES, STRUCTURE, AND INFECTION MODES.EARLY DETECTION OF BHV-1 IS VERY IMPORTANT FOR AGRICULTURE AND COMMERCIAL PURPOSES BUT NOT READILY AVAILABLE.APPROACHES:EMISSION OF VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (VOCS) UPON VIRAL INFECTION IS A RECENTLY INVESTIGATED TOPIC THAT HOLDS GREAT PROMISE FOR EARLY DISEASE DETECTION. OUR RECENT REPORT SHOWED THAT GAMMA-BUTYROLACTONE (GBL), A VOC, WAS RELEASED UPON HSV-1 ACUTE INFECTION, ANDTHAT IT COULD RESTRICT VIRAL REPLICATION, MAKING THE FIRST REPORTED DISCOVERY THAT A HERPESVIRUS COULD TRIGGER THE RELEASE OF VOC FROM INFECTED CELLS. GIVEN THE FACT OF SIMILARITY BETWEEN HSV-1 AND BHV-1 AND THAT GBL SERVES AS A STRESS SIGNAL FOR BACTERIA, IT IS IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTAND THE ROLE OF GBL DURING THE VIRAL ASSAULT OF CATTLE CELLS AS A POTENTIAL MOLECULAR BIOMARKER.IN THIS PROPOSAL, WE WILL STUDY THE MECHANISM OF GBL INDUCTION UPON ACUTE INFECTION USING BHV-1. OUR CENTRAL HYPOTHESIS IS THAT GBL IS PART OF THE CELLULAR SELF-DEFENSE MECHANISM AGAINST THE RELEASED VIRUS ATTACKING NEIGHBORING CELLS. OUR GOAL IS TO USE A COMBINATION OF BIOLOGICAL/CHEMICAL TOOLS TO IDENTIFY HOW THE VIRUS MODULATES THE CELLS TO GENERATE GBL DURING AND AFTER INFECTION.

SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTION OF ENERGY IN THE FORM OF BIOFUELS IS A MAJOR GLOBAL CHALLENGE AS MANKIND FACES AN INCREASING DEMAND FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY, WHILE THERE IS AN ONGOING STRUGGLE TO DECREASE DEPENDENCY ON FOSSIL FUELS. LIPID-BASED BIOFUELS COULD BECOME A SUSTAINABLE SOURCE OF BIOENERGY THAT WILL SATISFY PART OF THE DEMAND FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY. SECOND GENERATION LIPID-BASED BIOFUELS (I.E., BIODIESEL) ARE PRODUCED FROM MICROBES WITH A HIGH PROPENSITY FOR LIPID PRODUCTION (I.E., OLEAGINOUS CELLS), BUT TO DATE, THERE IS NO LARGE-SCALE PRODUCTION PROCESS FOR MICROBIAL LIPID-BASED FUELS DESPITE THE INTENSE RESEARCH EFFORTS. THE MAJOR REASON FOR THIS DISCREPANCY IS THAT OLEAGINOUS MICROBES ARE NOT COST-COMPETITIVE IN THE PRODUCTION OF BIOFUELS. HOWEVER, NEW TOOLS FOR THE GENETIC MODIFICATION OF OLEAGINOUS MICROBES AND HIGH-THROUGHPUT METHODS THAT HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED RECENTLY HAVE FACILITATED THE GENERATION MICROBIAL STRAINS THAT PRODUCE LIPIDS MORE EFFICIENTLY. IN THIS PROJECT, WE WILL MAKE USE OF THE RECENTLY DEVELOPED TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES TO IMPROVE SUSTAINABLE BIOENERGY PRODUCTION.

CEREAL BARS ARE BECOMING INCREASINGLY POPULAR AS READY-TO-EAT SNACKS. BINDERS FOR TRADITIONAL CEREAL BARS CONTAIN LARGE AMOUNTS OF SUGARS AND SUGAR SYRUPS. THEREFORE, REPLACING THESE HIGH-CALORIE CEREAL BARS WITH A NEW GENERATION OF PRODUCTS THAT ARE NUTRIENT-DENSE, LOW-CALORIE, LOW-FAT, AND LOW-SUGAR WILL HAVE A TREMENDOUS IMPACT ON POPULATION HEALTH. FOR THIS REASON, THIS PROJECT PROPOSES AN INNOVATIVE PROCESS TO DEVELOP LOW-CARB PREBIOTIC CEREAL BARS USING MICROFLUIDIZED OAT BRAN AS A NOVEL BINDER. OAT BRAN WILL BE MICROFLUIDIZED AND RHEOLOGICAL AND PHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES OF MICROFLUIDIZED OAT BRAN WILL BE CHARACTERIZED. USING THE MICROFLUIDIZED OAT BRAN AS A BINDER, LOW-CALORIE COMMON AND LOW-CARB PREBIOTIC (CONTAINING WHOLE GRAINS) CEREAL BARS WILL BE DEVELOPED. PROXIMATE COMPOSITION, CALORIC CONTENT, BETA-GLUCAN CONTENT AND MOLECULAR WEIGHT, AND MICROSTRUCTURE AND TEXTURE OF THE CEREAL BARS WILL BE MEASURED, AND SENSORY EVALUATION WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED. FINALLY, GUT MICROBIOTA-MODULATING EFFECTS OF THE CEREAL BARS WILL BE EVALUATED.

THIS PROJECT WILL FACILITATE THE DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF MORE ONLINE FOOD AGRICULTURE NATURAL RESOURCES AND HUMAN (FANH) SCIENCES COURSES.THE PROJECT WILL TRAIN FACULTY TO DEVELOP AND TEACH ONLINE AND DISTANCE EDUCATION COURSES IN THE FANH SCIENCES.

PROJECT SUMMARYTHE US COMMISSION ON DIETETIC REGISTRATION IDENTIFIES THAT AFRICAN AMERICANS REPRESENT LESS THAN 3% OF UNITED STATES REGISTERED DIETITIANS. THE BUREAU OF STATISTICS OCCUPATIONAL OUTLOOK HANDBOOK STATES THAT EMPLOYMENT FOR DIETITIANS IS EXPECTED TO RISE 14% FROM 2016 TO 2026. IN RESPONSE TO THESE OPPORTUNITIES, ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY (AAMU), PROPOSES TO INITIATE THIS TEACHING PROJECT TO RECRUIT, RETAIN, TRAIN, AND MENTOR MINORITY STUDENTS FOR THE DIETETICS PROFESSION. THOUGH DIETETICS IS A REWARDING PATH, UNDERREPRESENTATION OF MINORITIES IN THIS DISCIPLINE IS A GLARING DEFICIENCY. DIETITIANS SERVE AND PLAY THEIR PART IN REDUCING THE INCIDENCE OF DIET-RELATED, NON-COMMUNICABLE DISEASES, WHICH OFTEN RESULT IN INCREASED MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY INCIDENCES IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THEREFORE, AAMU IS PROPOSING TO: 1) RECRUIT AND RETAIN FIVE UNDERGRADUATE MINORITY STUDENTS IN AAMU DIETETICS PROGRAM WITH COMPETITIVE ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE IN STEM DISCIPLINES; 2) CULTIVATELEADERSHIP THROUGH TRAINING IN NUTRITION RESEARCH AND PRACTICAL EXPERIENCE AND; 3) DEVELOP A MENTORING PROGRAM FOR DIETETICS STUDENTS. FIVE UNDERGRADUATE MINORITY STUDENTS WILL BE RECRUITED, TRAINED, AND GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN RESEARCH, EXPERIENTIAL AND VIRTUAL LEARNING, AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. IN ADDITION, STUDENTS WILL BE MATCHED WITH MENTORS WHO WILL ENGAGE THEM IN CAREER-RELATED ACTIVITIES. PARTICIPATING SCHOLARS WHO MAINTAIN A GRADE POINT AVERAGE OF 3.0 OR HIGHER WILL BE AWARDED A YEARLY SCHOLARSHIP AND STIPENDS FOR TWO SUMMER PROJECTS. THIS PROJECT ASPIRES TO STRENGTHEN THE DIETETICS PROGRAM AT AAMU BY PREPARING WELL-TRAINED AND CERTIFIED STUDENTS WHO WILL EFFECT POSITIVE CHANGE IN HEALTH AND WELLNESS.

OUR SOCIETY IS CURRENTLY FACING MANY ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES SUCH AS NATURAL RESOURCES DEPLETION, POLLUTION OF SOIL, WATER AND AIR, WASTE DISPOSAL, AND CLIMATE CHANGE. TO BEST SOLVE ENVIRONMENTAL CHALLENGES, SOCIETY NEEDS GRADUATES READY TO ENTER WORKFORCE WITH UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL PROCESSES AND ABILITY TO INCORPORATE THESE PROCESSES INTO TRADITIONAL SOLUTIONS. THEREFORE, A NEW COURSE IN ECOLOGICAL ENGINEERING AND SCIENCE (EES) WAS INTRODUCED AT NCA&T STATE UNIVERSITY TO TEACH STUDENTS HOW TO INCORPORATE NATURE AND LESSONS LEARNED FROM NATURE TO SOLVE THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS AND ENSURE ENVIRONMENT SUSTAINABILITY. HOWEVER, STUDENT LACKED ADEQUATE BACKGROUND AND PREPARATION IN EES AND DATA SCIENCE. THUS, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMMERGE STUDENTS IN BIOLOGICAL ENGINEERING AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE TO EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING BY DEVELOPING LABORATORY EXERCISES AND SEMESTER LONG PROJECT-BASED TEACHING MATERIALS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PREPARE STUDENTS FOR IMPORTANT SKILLS INCLUDING LEADERSHIP, TEAMWORK, AND COMMUNICATION THROUGH THE COURSE PROJECTS. THE PROJECT CAN IMPACT STUDENTS IN AT LEAST THREE MAJORS IN THREE COLLEGES AT N.C.A&T AND MAKE THESE MAJORS MORE DESIRABLE TO PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS AND EMPLOYERS. TEACHING EES AND DATA SCIENCE WILL MEET A CRITICAL NEED FOR PREPARING COMPETENT GRADUATES WITH THE SKILLS AND EXPERTISE TO SOLVE CURRENT AND FUTURE ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS.

FOOD AND NUTRITIONAL SCIENCES (FNS) UNDERGRADUATES ENROLLED IN ADVANCED COURSES ARE UNPREPARED TO GRASP THE LINK BETWEEN BIOCHEMISTRY AND FOOD SCIENCE. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS THUS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE FNS PROGRAM AT N.C. A&T TO DELIVER CONTEXTUALIZED BIOCHEMISTRY INSTRUCTION USING UP-TO-DATE BIOCHEMISTRY INSTRUMENTATION. BY ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF TEACHING IN THE AREA OF BIOCHEMISTRY, THIS PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF THE FNS PROGRAM TO RECRUIT STUDENTS AND HELP THEM GRADUATE WITH THE SKILLS TO BECOME FNS PROFESSIONALS. THE OUTCOME WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN THE CULTURAL DIVERSITY OF THE FOOD, AGRICULTURE, NATURAL RESOURCES AND HUMAN SCIENCES SCIENTIFIC AND PROFESSIONAL WORKFORCE. BY FACILITATING EXPERIENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES, THE NEW CORE FACILITY WILL STRENGTHEN FNS PROGRAM LINKAGES WITH INDUSTRY AND ACADEMIA. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE LONG-TERM GOALS OF THE UNIVERSITY AND COLLEGE TO FOSTER EXCELLENCE IN TEACHING AND TO SUPPORT STUDENT SUCCESS AND HELPSMEET THE USDA/NIFA GOAL OF ENSURING THE DEVELOPMENT OF HUMAN CAPITAL, COMMUNITIES, AND A DIVERSE WORKFORCE. THIS INITIATIVE IS STRONGLY SUPPORTED BY THE FNS PROGRAM, N.C.A&T, FOOD SCIENTISTS, AND THE FOOD INDUSTRY.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT INCLUDES A NUTRITION LEADERSHIP PROGRAM (NUTRITION L.E.A.D.S. SCHOLARS PROGRAM) AND DEVELOPMENT OF A PERFORMING-ARTS BASED NUTRITION EDUCATION CURRICULUM. BOTH WILL PROVIDE A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY FOR STUDENTS TO OBTAIN KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND RECEIVE EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING THROUGH A HYBRID TEACHING MODEL THAT WILL INCLUDE TRAININGS AND MODULES FROM AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM OF FACULTY AND STAFF FROM MULTIPLE ENTITIES ACROSS THE STATE OF FLORIDA. THE INFORMATION AND TRAINING STUDENTS RECEIVE WILL AID IN DEVELOPMENT OF PEDAGOGICAL TOOLS AND CURRICULUM THAT CAN REACH CULTURALLY DIVERSE GROUPS WITH SUPPORTIVE NUTRITION AND HEALTH MESSAGES. DEVELOPING CULTURALLY COMPETENT PEER LEADERS WHO OFFER SUPPORTIVE NUTRITIONAL PROGRAMMING AND MESSAGES PROVIDES AN AVENUE TO ADDRESS HEALTH AND NUTRITION ISSUES AMONG COLLEGE STUDENTS; PROMOTES CULTURAL DIVERSITY IN THE WORKFORCE FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS; AND CONCURRENTLY TACKLES ISSUES OF HEALTH DISPARITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL HAVETHE ABILITY TO GREATLY IMPACT, BUILD, AND STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF 1890S IN STUDENT DEVELOPMENT, RECRUITMENT, RESEARCH, AND TEACHING. GOALS OF THIS PROGRAM ARE: ENHANCE STUDENT PROFESSIONAL AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS; MOTIVATE STUDENTS AND IMPROVE RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION BY LINKING ACADEMIC AND WORK-RELATED EXPERIENCES; AND PREPARE STUDENT PROFESSIONALS TO ADDRESS NUTRITION AND HUMAN HEALTH ISSUES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1) DEVELOP ONLINE MODULES AND FACE-TO-FACE TRAININGS ON NUTRITION AND HEALTH-RELATED TOPICS; 2) PROVIDE SELECTED NUTRITION STUDENTS WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH AT LEAST 10 SERVICE-LEARNING HOURS (EACH) WITH EXTENSION; AND 3) DEVELOP AN 8-LESSON PERFORMING ARTS-BASED NUTRITION EDUCATION CURRICULUM FOR MIDDLE SCHOOLERS (6-8TH GRADE).

THE PROPOSED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT GRANT WILL PROVIDE MULTIPLE ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL GAINS. THE MOST IMPORTANT ASPECT OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE OUR ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND THE PREVALENCE OF TICK-BORNE PATHOGENS AND HOW THESE PATTERNS CHANGE BASED ON HOST SPECIES. THESE PREVALENCE DATA WILL BE MOST IMPORTANT FOR INFORMING THE NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES WORKFORCE ALONG WITH THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF THE POTENTIAL DISEASE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH OUTDOOR WORK AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES THAT CO-OCCUR IN HABITATS WHERE TICKS ARE COMMON. THESE DATA WILL BE DIRECTLY BENEFICIAL TO MAINTENANCE OF HUMAN HEALTH THROUGH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF DISEASE PREVALENCE.DATA ACQUIRED DURING THIS RESEARCH WILL SERVE AS PRELIMINARY DATA TO ACQUIRE ADDITIONAL FUNDING FROM OTHER FUNDING AGENCIES. THESE CONTINUATION FUNDS WILL PERMIT OPPORTUNITIES TO RECRUIT ADDITIONAL GRADUATE STUDENTS AND CONDUCT SUPPLEMENTARY PROJECTS TO EXPLORE ADDITIONAL RESEARCH QUESTIONS RELATED TO WILDLIFE CONSERVATION AND DISEASE ECOLOGY. ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS FROM THIS RESEARCH INCLUDE ADVANCEMENTS IN OUR UNDERSTANDING OF HOW HOST TYPE INFLUENCES DISEASE PREVALENCE AND ASSOCIATED VECTOR MICROBIAL DIVERSITY. ALTHOUGH THIS RESEARCH WILL OCCUR LOCALLY IN THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES, RESULTS ARE TRANSFERABLE ACROSS A VARIETY OF FOREST TYPES AND WILDLIFE COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES AND GLOBALLY.

THE COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE, COMMUNITIES AND THE ENVIRONMENT (CACE) AT KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY (KSU) IS COMMITTED TO EXPANDING AND INCORPORATING NEW LIVESTOCK RESEARCH TECHNOLOGIES INTO ESTABLISHED AND EXISTING PROGRAMS. THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE PROJECT DIRECTOR (PD) A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO ACQUIRE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS IN "-OMICS" TECHNIQUES THAT WOULD ENABLE THE PROFILING OF LIVESTOCK MICROBIAL POPULATIONS, THUS PROVIDING GREATER INSIGHTS INTO THE MECHANISMS OF ACTION OF NATURAL ANTIMICROBIALS (PHYTOBIOTICS, PREBIOTICS, AND PROBIOTICS). NATURAL ANTIMICROBIALS ARE KNOWN TO ENHANCE PERFORMANCE, IMMUNE RESPONSE, AND GASTROINTESTINAL MICROBIAL DIVERSITY IN LIVESTOCK AND ARE NOW POPULARREPLACEMENTS FORANTIBIOTICS IN LIVESTOCK FEEDING. THE "-OMICS" ARE A SET OF EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES THAT INCLUDE GENOMICS (STUDY OF GENES AND THEIR FUNCTIONS), PROTEOMICS (STUDY OF PROTEINS), AND METABOLOMICS (STUDY OF MOLECULES INVOLVED IN CELLULAR METABOLISM). THESE TECHNIQUES OFFER THE ADVANTAGES OF RAPIDLY AND RELIABLY DETECTING, MEASURING, QUANTIFYING AND COMPARING THOUSANDS OF METABOLITES IN A SINGLE SAMPLE SIMULTANEOUSLY AND ALLOW NUMEROUS SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC TRAITS ASSOCIATED WITH LIVESTOCK PRODUCTION TO BE ASSESSED ROUTINELY, NON-INVASIVELY, AND OFTEN AT A LOWER COST THAN CURRENT TECHNIQUES.THIS UNIQUE TRAINING OPPORTUNITY WILL BE OFFERED BY THE USDA ARS ANIMAL BIOSCIENCES & BIOTECHNOLOGY LABORATORY INBELTSVILLE, MD, AND THE RUMINANT NUTRITION AND METABOLISM AND THE PROTEOMIC AND METABOLOMIC CENTER LABORATORIES AT MONTANA STATE UNIVERSITY (MSU) IN BOZEMAN, MT. RESEARCH IN LIVESTOCK HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS ONE OF THE MAIN AREAS OF UTMOST BENEFIT TO KSU'S STAKEHOLDERS, THE LIMITED-RESOURCE AND MINORITY RURAL AND URBAN FARMERS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY. THE PD IS ESTABLISHING A RESEARCH PROGRAM IN NATURAL ANTIMICROBIALS THAT WILL INCORPORATE THE LATEST APPLICATION OF "-OMICS" TECHNIQUES TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND GROWTH PERFORMANCE OF PASTURE-BASED, SMALL-SCALE, LIMITED-RESOURCE POULTRY PRODUCTION SYSTEMS.THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THE USE OF METAGENOMICS, PROTEOMICS, AND METABOLOMICS TO ENHANCE RESEARCH IN LIVESTOCK MICROBIOTA CHARACTERIZATION AND QUANTIFICATION. THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL HELP STRENGTHEN THE PD'S CAPABILITIES IN A CUTTING EDGE BIOTECHNOLOGY FIELD THAT WILL NOT ONLY BENEFIT THE RESEARCH CAPACITY OF KSU LIVESTOCK AND POULTRY RESEARCH PROGRAMS, BUT WILL ALSO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIESFOR EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING FOR STUDENTS. THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT SUPPORTS ONE OF THE MAJOR GOALS OF USDA 1890 CBG PROGRAM, WHICH IS TO "ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE QUALITY OF RESEARCH, TEACHING/EDUCATION AND EXTENSION PROGRAMS AT THE 1890 INSTITUTIONS TO MORE READILY ESTABLISH THEM AS FULL PARTNERS IN THE US FANH SCIENCES HIGHER EDUCATION SYSTEM." THE PROJECT ALSO SUPPORTS THREE OF NIFA'S HIGH-PRIORITY AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE FY2019 1890 CAPACITY BUILDING GRANT REQUEST FORAPPLICATIONS: FOOD SAFETY, GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIOSECURITY, AND SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE.

CURRENTLY, NEW PROFESSIONALS OR SCIENTISTS ENTERING THE STEM FIELD, ARE IN NEED OF TRAINING IN THE PROCUREMENT OF FUNDS FOR RESEARCH. FURTHERMORE, THERE IS A NEED FOR RESEARCH FOCUSING ON UNDERSTANDING THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEENPHYTOCHEMICALS AND THEIR POTENTIAL TO PREVENT CHRONIC DISEASES (OBESITY, DIABETES, CANCER); DISEASES WHICH ARE BECOMING INCREASINGLY PREVALENT. THIS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THESE ISSUES AND AIMS TO PROVIDE AN INCREASE IN KNOWLEDGE TO BUDDING, MID-LEVEL AND SENIOR SCIENTISTS THAT WILL ULTIMATELY IMPACT THE GENERAL POPULATION. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE AFOREMENTIONED ISSUES BY WAY OF GRANTSMANSHIP WORKSHOPS (TO IMPROVE GRANTWRITING AND INCREASE PROBABILITY OF SECURING RESEARCH FUNDS) AND ATTENDANCE TO CONFERENCES THAT WILL ENHANCE THE UNDERSTANDING OF PHYTOCHEMICALS AND THEIR BENEFITS IN COMBATTING CHRONIC DISEASES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE INFORMATIONON VARIOUS PROMINENT TOPICS IN FOOD SCIENCE THAT ARE BECOMING INCREASINGLY RELEVANTTO NOT ONLY THE FIELD, BUT ALSO TO CONSUMERS. THE EXPECTED IMPACT OF THIS PROJECT WILL EFFECT THE SCIENTIFIC AND LARGER COMMUNITIES, IN THE PREVENTION OF CHRONIC DISEASES.

FOOD INSECURITY AND MALNUTRITION REMAIN MAJOR CALLENGES IN SUB-SHAHARA AFRICA. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE PI, DR. SAMUEL BESONG AN OPPORTUNITY TO 1) STUDY FOOD CHAIN IN RELATION TO FOOD PRODUCTION, PROCESSING, DISTRIBUTION AND CONSUMPTION, 2) ENHANCE PROFESSIONAL NETWORK WITH USAID STAFF, SCIENTISTS AT UNIVERSITIES IN KENYA, AND BUILD CAPACITY FOR STUDENT EXCHANGE PROGRAM IN COLLABORATING INSTITUTIONS IN KENYA. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR RESEARCH IN FOOD SECURITY AND ENABLE DSU TO ESTABLISH A FOOT PRINT IN AFRICA. KNOWLEDGE GAINED FROM THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE PIS EXPERTISE IN FOOD SECURITY AND IMPROVE THE CONTENT OF DSU'S GLOBAL SOCIETIES COURSE (GLOB 395).

THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO EMPOWER AND CHALLENGE HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INNOVATIVE AND ENTREPRENEURIAL THINKERS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH SKILLS AND TOOLS THAT COULD LEAD TO THE CREATION AND COMMERCIALIZATION OF NEW OR ENHANCED FOOD AND FIBER RELATED PRODUCTS OR SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGIES USED IN THE FOOD AND FIBER SECTOR.PARTICPANTS WILL BRAINSTORM IDEAS, COLLABORATE WITH OTHER STUDENTS, WORK ON BUSINESS PLANS AND OBTAIN ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE. THEY WILL ALSO BEPROVIDED WITHTECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE THROUGH WORKSHOPS AND SEMINARS, ADVISORY AND COACHING SERVICES, NETWORKING EVENTS, COMPETITIONS, WORKING SPACE, AND PRODUCT SHOWCASING,MENTORING, INVESTMENT FACILITATION, AND A STUDENT INCUBATOR PROGRAM

THE HUMAN POPULATION IS EXPECTED TO REACH 9 BILLION IN THE NEXT 30 YEARS AND THE CURRENT FOOD PRODUCTION RATE WILL NEED TO INCREASE BY 30% TO HAVE ENOUGH FOOD TO FEED THE INCREASED POPULATION. PORK IS THE NUMBER ONE CONSUMED MEAT IN THE WORLD. TO MEET CONSUMER DEMAND FOR PORK, PIG PRODUCTION MUST BE DONE IN A SAFE AND HUMANE WAY TO ENSURE FOOD ANIMAL HEALTH AND A SUSTAINABLE, HEALTHY FOOD SUPPLY. THEREFORE, IT IS IMPORTANT TO CONDUCT RESEARCH THAT WILL HELP UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT OF SWINE PRODUCTION ON ANIMAL HEALTH. INDOOR ANIMAL PRODUCTION SYSTEMS TEND TO HAVE REDUCED AIR QUALITY, WHICH CAN CONTRIBUTE TO DECREASED RESPIRATORY HEALTH AND ILLNESS. THEREFORE, THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A WORKFLOW FOR TESTING ENVIRONMENTAL AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES FOR THE PRESENCE OF MICROBES AND MICROBIAL PRODUCTS THAT CAN CAUSE SWINE ILLNESS. THE GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO BUILD IMMUNOPROTEOMICS RESEARCH CAPACITY FOR BIOMARKER DISCOVERY. THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE RESEARCH CAPACITY BY COMPLETING OBJECTIVE 1 WHICH WILL MODERNIZE RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE AND TRAINING IN THE AREAS OF IMMUNOLOGY AND PROTEOMICS, AND OBJECTIVES 2 & 3 WILL UTILIZE THE NEW EQUIPMENT AND TRAINING TO ADDRESS AN IMPORTANT RESEARCH PROBLEM RELATED TO SWINE RESPIRATORY HEALTH. THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER ESTABLISH N.C. A&T AS A FULL PARTNER IN THE U.S. FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES HIGHER EDUCATION SYSTEM BY PROVIDING RESEARCH AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO STUDENTS AND SCIENTISTS THAT ARE UNDERREPRESENTED IN FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE PROFESSIONS.

MAKING AGRICULTURE SUSTAINABLE REQUIRES UNDERSTANDING WHERE BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS) WILL BE MOST EFFECTIVE IN THE LANDSCAPE TO MAINTAIN THE CONDITION OF NEARBY ECOSYSTEMS, SINCE HUMANS RECEIVE DIVERSE BENEFITS FROM NATURAL ECOSYSTEMS AS WELL AS AGRICULTURAL LANDS. WETLANDS IN PARTICULAR PROVIDE A WIDE VARIETY OF THESE ECOSYSTEM SERVICES, INCLUDING NUTRIENT TREATMENT, CARBON STORAGE, POLLINATION, AND FLOOD MITIGATION. PLANNING FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE IN DELAWARE IS ESPECIALLY CHALLENGING WITH SEA LEVEL RISE. WE PROPOSE TO ASSESS THE IMPACTS OF SEA LEVEL RISE ON AGRICULTURE AND WETLAND ECOSYSTEM SERVICES AND EXPLORE NOVEL USES OF ECOSYSTEM SERVICES MAPPING FOR PLANNING BMPS. IN OUR RESEARCH (PRIMARY FOCUS), WE WILL (A) EVALUATE HOW WETLAND SERVICES CHANGE WITH PROXIMITY TO AGRICULTURE, (B) STATISTICALLY PINPOINT "HOTSPOTS" WITH HIGH DELIVERY OF DIVERSE BENEFITS AND INVESTIGATE THE BMPS PROMOTING HOTSPOTS NEAR AGRICULTURAL LANDS, AND (C) USE SEA LEVEL PREDICTIONS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL MARGINAL CROPLANDS (CANDIDATES FOR DIFFERENT BMPS) AND SERVICE HOTSPOTS THAT MAY BE LOST. OVERALL, UNDERSTANDING THE FEEDBACKS BETWEEN LAND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AND THE FULL ARRAY OF BENEFITS THAT OUR LANDS PROVIDE WILL HELP US INCREASE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF AGRICULTURAL LANDSCAPES. THE PROJECT ALSO STRENGTHENS DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY'S RESEARCH AND TEACHING CAPABILITIES IN SPATIAL ANALYSIS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, WE WILL (A) IMPROVE INFRASTRUCTURE AND INFORMATION-SHARING FOR SPATIAL RESEARCH, (B) DEVELOP A NEW COURSE AND WORKSHOPS IN ADVANCED SPATIAL ANALYSIS AND UPDATE MATERIALS IN OTHER COURSES, AND (C) SHARE RESEARCH PRODUCTS WITH FARMERS, PROFESSIONAL DATA USERS, AND K-12 AUDIENCES.

THE NEED TO EDUCATE COMMUNITIES ABOUT AGRICULTURE IN OUR SOCIETY WHILE PROMOTING THE PROMISING COLLEGE/CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN AGRICULTURE ESPECIALLY IN STEM AREAS IS PARAMOUNT. AMARANTHUS AS WELL AS SORGHUM ARE IMPORTANT PLANTS FOR TENNESSEE AGRICULTURE AND THEIR WILD RELATIVES INCLUDE NOTORIOUS WEED SPECIES WHICH MAY CONTAIN GENES USEFUL FOR DEVELOPING RESILIENT CROP VARIETIES. THEREFORE, PLANT GENETICS RESEARCH ON BOTH CROP WILD RELATIVES (CWR) OFFERS AN EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO TRAIN DIVERSE BACKGROUND STUDENTS USING MOBILE-EXTENSION APPARATUS ON ECOLOGICAL CONSCIOUSNESS RELATED TOPICS WHILE ACADEMICALLY MOTIVATING THEM. SUCH RESEARCH TRAININGS OF PRE-COLLEGE, UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL STRENGTHEN TSU AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES PROGRAM. THE PROPOSED PROJECT PRESENTS FOLLOWING OBJECTIVE; 1) INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE RESEARCH PROJECT FROM COMMUNITIES ACROSS TENNESSEE USING A STATE-OF-THE-ART MOBILE STEM EDUCATION CLASSROOM/LAB; 2) UNDERTAKE SYLLABI DESIGN FOR DEVELOPING AND/OR ASSIMILATING INTERDISCIPLINARY CURRICULA AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS FOR MULTI-TIER TRAINEES; 3) COLLECT PHYLOGEOGRAPHIC AND GLYPHOSATE RESISTANCE POPULATION STRUCTURE DATA ON AMARANTHUS AND SORGHUM, WHILE EDUCATING HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS AND THEIR MENTORS ACROSS TENNESSEE; AND 4) CREATE AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE PLAN TO RECRUIT STUDENTS FOR DEGREE PROGRAMS IN THE TSU COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE BY ENHANCING EXTENSION AND RESEARCH CAPACITY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES. THE PROPOSED MOLECULAR RESEARCH, EXTENSION COURSES AND TRAININGS WILL BE DESIGNED TO COVER ALL FUNDAMENTALS OF RELEVANT SCIENTIFIC PROCESSES IN PLANT GENETICS AND AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION. GRADUATE RESEARCH THESES AND EXTENSION CURRICULA, RELEVANT TO NATURAL RESOURCES AND SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE, WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING ENHANCEMENTS OF UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS.

A TYPICAL HUMAN ADULT BODY HAS ~30 TRILLION CELLS AND ABOUT 38 TRILLION MICROBES ON AND INSIDE ITS BODY AS ITS VERY OWN MICROBIOME OR METAGENOME. LIKEWISE, SOIL-DWELLING FEMALE RENIFORM NEMATODE (RN), ROTYLENCHULUS RENIFORMIS HAS ITS OWN COMPLEX METAGENOME. BESIDES RN IS A MAJOR DEVASTATING PEST THAT INFESTS 300 PLANT SPECIES, MANY WERE GROWN IN THE SOUTHERN UNITED STATES. OUR PAST WORK IDENTIFIED SEVERAL PARASITISM-RELATED GENES OF FUNGAL AND BACTERIAL ORIGIN. HENCE, UNDERSTANDING COMPOSITION OF RN MICROBIOME IS CRITICAL TO CONTROLLING IT. THIS STUDY AIMS TO UNDERSTAND THE RECIPROCAL RELATIONSHIPS OF THIS NEMATODE WITH ITS OWN MICROBIOME. THIS INTEGRATED RESEARCH AND EDUCATION PROPOSAL ADDRESSES FOUR OBJECTIVES: 1) UNDERTAKE MICROBIAL DIVERSITY ANALYSIS OF RN-INFESTED SOILS; 2) STUDY THE MICROBIOME OF THE RN DURING ITS INFECTIVE STAGE; 3) CARRY OUT BIOINFORMATIC ANALYSIS TO UNDERSTAND RECIPROCAL INTERRELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE SOIL- AND RN-ASSOCIATED MICROBIOMES; AND 4) TEACH AND TRAIN UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE AND POST-GRADUATE STUDENTS IN THE EMERGING FIELD OF MICROBIOME AND METAGENOME ANALYSES, AND THUS OPENING A NOVEL RESEARCH AVENUE IN GENOMICS AT AAMU. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND BROADER IMPACTS ARE: A) DECIPHERING MICROBIAL PROFILES OF VARIED SOIL-TYPES AND RN-INFESTATION; B) SHARING RN-SPECIFIC MICROBIOMES PUBLICLY WITH PROFESSIONALS; C) DETERMINING THE ROLE OF MICROBES IN RN-PARASITISM; D) TRAINING STUDENTS (10) IN EMERGING FIELD OF METAGENOMICS; DEVELOPING GRADUATE-LEVEL MICROBIOME AND METAGENOME ANALYSIS (MMA) COURSE AND INCLUDE IN THE PLANT MOLECULAR BIOLOGY MINOR; E) TRAINING NEXT-GENERATION SCIENTISTS IN THIS ADVANCED STEM FIELD, AND F) CONTRIBUTING TOWARDS DEVELOPING SUSTAINABLE STRATEGY OF MANAGING THIS AND OTHER UNDERSTUDIED PLANT PARASITIC NEMATODES.

THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAIN REGION OF EASTERN KENTUCKY CONTAINS HIGH PROPORTIONS OF FORESTLAND ALONG WITH COAL AND NATURAL GAS DEPOSITARIES. HOWEVER, THIS REGION IS THE HOME OF THOUSANDS OF HOUSEHOLDS LIVING UNDER PERSISTENT POVERTY. MANY OF THE RURAL LANDSCAPES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION HAVE EXPERIENCED SIGNIFICANT CHANGES OVER THE YEARS. IN THOSE AREAS, NATURAL RESOURCE EXTRACTION ACTIVITIES, PARTICULARLY SURFACE MINING, HAVE RESULTED IN SOCIAL, ECONOMIC, AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS. FOREST BIOMASS LOSS IS ONE OF THE PRIMARY IMPACTS OF MOUNTAIN TOP REMOVAL IN APPALACHIA. THE DISTRIBUTION AND ABUNDANCE OF TREE SPECIES AND UNDERSTORY VEGETATION ARE KEY INDICATORS OF FOREST ECOSYSTEM HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY. WHILE THE MINING INDUSTRY BRINGS JOBS AND INCOME OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOME, ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS AFFECTS HUMAN AS WELL AS NATURAL COMMUNITIES. THESE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS INCLUDE REMOVAL OF TOP SOIL AND NEAR-SURFACE MATERIALS; DESTRUCTION OF VEGETATION, BIOMASS, AND BIODIVERSITY; AND POTENTIAL FOR FLOOD, LANDSLIDES, AND OTHER HAZARDS. TOXIC SUBSTANCES IN POLLUTION FROM MINING OPERATIONS HAVE ALSO BEEN LINKED WITH SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES, SUCH AS RESPIRATORY DISEASES AND CANCER, IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. LANDSCAPE CHANGES DUE TO EXCESSIVE MINING CAN AFFECT THE PROVISION OF FOREST AND OTHER ECOSYSTEM SERVICES, WHICH MAY EVENTUALLY THREATEN THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN NEARBY COMMUNITIES. BECAUSE OF THE DEPENDENCY OF THESE COMMUNITIES ON RENEWABLE AND NON-RENEWABLE NATURAL RESOURCES IN THE LANDSCAPE, THE IMPACT OF HISTORICAL MINING ACTIVITIES, AND EMERGING THREATS (SUCH AS ENVIRONMENTAL INSECURITY), IT IS IMPORTANT TO STUDY HOW MINING ACTIVITIES IN THE PAST HAVE IMPACTED THE FOREST LANDSCAPE, ECOSYSTEM FUNCTIONS, AND QUALITY OF LIFE IN THE REGION. IT IS EQUALLY IMPORTANT TO KNOW THE VULNERABILITY OF THESE COMMUNITIES TO NEW THREATS FROM CHANGES IN NATURAL RESOURCES AND OTHER SUPPORTING SYSTEMS. INADEQUATE UNDERSTANDING OF THE DYNAMICS OF THIS UNIQUESYSTEM HAS LIMITED THE ABILITY OF RESEARCHERS TO EXPLAIN LANDSCAPE CHANGES IN THE FUTURE AND THE RESULTING IMPACT ON ECOSYSTEM FUNCTION. THIS PROJECT WILL COLLECT RESIDENTS' PERCEPTIONS OF CHANGES IN THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT, ECOSYSTEMS FUNCTION, AND QUALITY OF LIFE DUE TO SURFACE MINING ACTIVITIES AND LINK THESE TO THE LAND COVER CHANGE DATA DERIVED FROM THE ANALYSIS OF SATELLITE DATA TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC LOCATIONS THAT HAVE UNDERGONE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES AND NEED THE MOST ATTENTION. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO ESTIMATE LOSS IN BIOMASS AND CARBON BALANCE DUE TO SURFACE MINING AND THE EFFECTS ON CLIMATE AND PREDICT RECOVERY TIME OF THE LOST BIOMASS BY ESTIMATING VEGETATION GROWTH IN THE RECLAIMED LAND. THE NATURE OF THE HUMAN-ENVIRONMENT RELATIONSHIP IN MANY NATURAL RESOURCE-DEPENDENT COMMUNITIES IS VERY COMPLEX AND CAN BE ONLY ADDRESSED BY INTEGRATING HUMAN PERCEPTIONS TO THE PHYSICAL CHANGES ON THE LANDSCAPE. COUPLING AIRBORNE LIGHT DETECTION AND RANGING (LIDAR), UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES(DRONES), AND SATELLITE IMAGERY WITH FOREST STAND STRUCTURE AND SPECIES COMPOSITION DATA ALLOWS US TO DEVELOP A PREDICTIVE MODEL FOR SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL DISTRIBUTION OF THE GROWTH AND LOSS OF IMPORTANT PLANT SPECIES ACROSS THE STUDY SITE AND THEIR OVERALL ECOSYSTEM PRODUCTIVITY (I.E., TOTAL BIOMASS OR BIOMASS CHANGES OVER TIME). THE PROPOSAL HAS TWO COMPONENTS. THE RESEARCH COMPONENT OF THE PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY KNOWLEDGE GAPS IN UNDERSTANDING VARIATIONS IN THE CONSEQUENCES OF SURFACE MINING ON ENVIRONMENT, FOREST PRODUCTIVITY, AND FEASIBILITY OF RECLAIMED LANDS FOR AGRICULTURAL ENTERPRISES AND THE TEACHING COMPONENT INCLUDES ENHANCEMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE CURRICULA AT KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY (KSU). KSU WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE-KNOXVILLE (UT) AND TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY (TSU) TO SEEK INPUT FROM LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS VIA FOCUS GROUP DISCUSSIONS AND SURVEYS. TIME SERIES, GEOSPATIAL, SURVEY, AND LONGITUDINAL DATA DERIVED FROM THE PROJECT WILL BE UTILIZEDTO EXPLORE INTERCONNECTIONS BETWEEN SURFACE-COAL MINING, QUALITY OF LIFE, AND OTHER LAND-COVER CHANGE CONDITIONS IN CASE STUDIES AND STUDENT RESEARCH PROJECTS. GENERATING NEW KNOWLEDGE FROM THE STUDY OF SOCIOECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL DYNAMICS OF SURFACE MINING WILL RAISE THE LEVEL OF AWARENESS OF THEIR IMPACTS ON THE LOCAL ECONOMY AND ECOSYSTEMS. THIS NEW KNOWLEDGE WILL ALSO ENHANCE THE TEACHING AND RESEARCH CAPACITY OF THE COLLABORATIVE UNIVERSITIES (KSU, UT, AND TSU) TO EXAMINE THE SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE REGION. SPECIFICALLY, THE FINDINGS OF THIS STUDY CAN BRING US CLOSER TO ANSWERING THE QUESTION: "GIVEN THE LONG HISTORY OF COAL-FIELD BASED EMPLOYMENT AND REVENUE GENERATION, WHY HAS THIS REGION LAGGED BEHIND OTHER AREAS IN QUALITY OF LIFE?" THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE STUDENTS OPPORTUNITIES THAT INCORPORATE INNOVATIVE, PROJECT-BASED EDUCATION BEYOND THE CLASSROOM AND ENHANCED RESEARCH, CRITICAL THINKING, AND DATA ANALYSIS SKILLS. STUDENTS AND FACULTY WILL BE ABLE TO LINK SOCIOECONOMIC, REMOTE SENSING, AND MICROCLIMATE DATA TO EXPLAIN THE DYNAMICS OF HUMAN-ENVIRONMENT RELATIONSHIPS IN ONE OF THE MOST VULNERABLE AND UNDERSERVED REGIONS OF THE NATION. FREQUENT INTERACTIONS BETWEEN RESEARCH FACULTY AND EXTENSION STAFF WILL ALSO ENHANCE EXTENSION POTENTIAL AND IMPACTS BY PROVIDING NEW KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NECESSARY IN ADVISING CLIENTS FACING EMERGING ISSUES SURROUNDING SURFACE-MINING PRACTICES. PROPOSED PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO PROVIDE RESEARCH FACULTY AND STAFF EXPOSURE TO INNOVATIVE AND EMPIRICAL LAND COVER CHANGE MODELS AND SPATIAL DATA PREPARATION, ANALYSIS, AND INTERPRETATION AS WELL AS OPPORTUNITIES FOR CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND COORDINATION OF RESEARCH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS. THE OUTPUTS OF THE PROJECT WILL HAVE SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS ON ENHANCING THE CAPACITY OF FACULTY FROM THE PARTICIPATING UNIVERSITIES TO DEVELOP PROGRAMS FOR IMPROVED AGRICULTURE, ENVIRONMENTAL SECURITY, HUMAN SCIENCE EDUCATION, RESEARCH, AND EXTENSION.

CONSUMER AWARENESS FOR THE HEALTH OF THE FOOD THEY CONSUME HAS BEEN INCREASING. THERE IS A PRESSING NEED FOR THE SUSTAINABLE AND ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY WAY OF FOOD PRODUCTION. THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPAND SUSTAINABLE SWEET CORN PRODUCTION BY PROVIDING ORGANICALLY BASED INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (IPM) OF ONE OF THE KEY SWEET CORN PESTS (CORN EARWORM). SPECIFICALLY, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE IPM PROGRAMS THAT CONCURRENTLY MANIPULATE INSECT HERBIVORES AND WEEDS, AS WELL AS BENEFICIAL ARTHROPODS (PREDATORS AND PARASITOIDS) AFFECTING SWEET CORN. WE CHOSE SWEET CORN AS THE TEST CROP BECAUSE OF ITS ECONOMIC IMPORTANCE TO DIVERSE FARMING OPERATIONS AND PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATIONS DISPLAYING ITS COMPATIBILITY WITH PLANT GROWTH PROMOTING RHIZOBACTERIA (PGPR), MINIMUM TILLAGE AND COVER CROPPING. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO 1) CHARACTERIZE AND QUANTIFY THE TRANSCRIPTIONAL CHANGES OF DEFENSE-RELATED GENES THAT REGULATE DIRECT AND INDIRECT DEFENSES IN PGPR-TREATED PLANTS, 2) IDENTIFY POTENTIAL RAMIFICATIONS OF PGPR-MEDIATED BIOCHEMICAL AND MOLECULAR CHANGES FOR PLANT-INSECT AND TRITROPHIC INTERACTIONS, 3) QUANTIFY THE EFFICACY OF PROMISING PGPR STRAINS TESTED IN OBJECTIVES 1 AND 2 IN SWEET CORN PLANTINGS, 4) DETERMINE EFFECTS OF MINIMUM TILLAGE AND COVER CROPPING ON WEED AND INSECT PESTS, NATURAL ENEMY EFFICACY, AND SWEET CORN YIELD, 5) DEVELOP A TEACHING PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN UMCP AND UMES AND 6) DEVELOP A PARTICIPATORY MODEL FOR TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER USING A HARMONIZED OUTREACH PLAN AND CONTINUOUS FEEDBACK SYSTEM. TWO GRADUATE, THREE UNDERGRADUATE AND THREE INTERN STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED IN PEST MANAGEMENT AND FOOD SAFETY. PLUS THIRTY FARMERS AND EDUCATORS WILL BE EXPECTED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE WORKSHOPS.

THIS PROJECT INTEGRATES RESEARCH, TEACHING AND OUTREACH AND DIRECTLY ADDRESSES THE NIFA STRATEGIC GOAL OF GLOBAL FOOD SECURITY AND AGRICULTURAL BIO-SECURITY. SEED HEALTH IS VITAL IN SUCCESSFUL CROP/FOOD PRODUCTION AND SUSTENANCE OF THE SEED INDUSTRY WHICH CONTRIBUTES ABOUT $4 BILLION TO THE U.S. COMMERCE AND EXPORT PROGRAM ANNUALLY. ORGANIC FOOD PRODUCTION CURRENTLY IS THE FASTEST GROWING SEGMENT OF AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION WITH SALES TOPPLING $39 BILLION IN 2015. WE HYPOTHESIZE THAT THE DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY FOR EFFECTIVE PATHOGEN DETECTION AND PROTECTION OF SEEDS WITH BIO-CONTROL ORGANISMS WILL IMPROVE CROP ESTABLISHMENT, GROWTH AND YIELD, ESPECIALLY IN LOW INPUT ORGANIC PRODUCTION SYSTEMS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE (1) TO DEVELOP RAPID EFFICIENT MOLECULAR AND FIELD DIAGNOSTIC TECHNIQUES FOR DETECTING SEED-BORNE BACTERIAL, VIRAL AND FUNGAL PLANT PATHOGENS, (2) TO DETERMINE EFFECTIVE METHODS FOR APPLICATION OF PROTECTIVE BIOCONTROL ORGANISMS TO SEEDS, (3) TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN MINORITY STUDENTS IN SEED/PLANT HEALTH SCIENCES, (4) TO CONDUCT EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH TO STAKEHOLDERS THROUGH WORKSHOPS AND FIELD PLOT DEMONSTRATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL FACILITATE THE DETECTION OF SEEDBORNE PATHOGENS SIGNIFICANT TO ORGANIC VEGETABLE PRODUCTION IN SOUTHEASTERN US AND BEYOND. THE PLANT HEALTH CURRICULUM AT ALABAMA A&M UNIVERSITY WILL BE STRENGTHENED BY INCORPORATING ORGANIC SEED HEALTH DIMENSIONS AND PLANT BIOSECURITY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO TRAIN MINORITY STUDENTS, ENHANCING MINORITY WORKFORCE IN THE AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES, AND CONTRIBUTING TO GLOBAL FOOD PRODUCTION. LIMITED RESOURCE FARMERS WILL GAIN NEW KNOWLEDGE IN SEED HEALTH TESTING AND BIOLOGICAL SEED INOCULANTS. SEEDBORNE INFECTIONS WILL BE MINIMIZED, THUS LEADING TO INCREASED VEGETABLE YIELDS AND OVERALL FARM PROFITS.

KENTUCKY STATE UNIVERSITY (KSU) IS LOCATED IN THE LARGEST BOURBON PRODUCING AREA IN THE WORLD AND IS SURROUNDED BY MANY WINERIES AND CRAFT BREWERIES, WHICH SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE REGIONAL ECONOMY. THERE ARE MANY JOB OPPORTUNITIES EITHER SUPPORTING OR DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THE FERMENTATION AND DISTILLATION SCIENCES IN KENTUCKY AND THE SURROUNDING REGION. THIS PROJECT TRAINS STUDENTS TO ENTER THIS WORKFORCE AND BE COMPETITIVE FOR JOBS IN THE FERMENTATION AND DISTILLATION INDUSTRY. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO: 1) CREATE AN UNDERGRADUATE CERTIFICATE PROGRAM CONSISTING OF FOUR COURSES: INTRODUCTION TO FERMENTATION AND DISTILLATION SCIENCES, FERMENTATION AND SPIRITS CHEMISTRY, FERMENTATION OF FOODS AND FOOD SAFETY, AND DIRECTED STUDIES; 2) DEVELOP NEW RECIPES FOR VALUE-ADDED PRODUCTS FOR SMALL-SCALE PRODUCERS, INCLUDING PAWPAW, HEMP, AND SORGHUM BEER AND KOMBUCHA, SPIRITS, AND FERMENTED FRUIT AND VEGETABLE PRODUCTS THROUGH RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY NEW EQUIPMENT; 3) CREATE UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH AND PRACTICUM OPPORTUNITIES IN THE RESEARCH AREAS IN OBJECTIVE 2, WHICH WILL HELP STUDENTS DEVELOP LEADERSHIP AND CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS; 4) OFFER WEEKEND AND THIRD THURSDAY WORKSHOP EXTENSION WORKSHOPS IN HOME BREWING AND DISTILLATION FOR STAKEHOLDERS; AND 5) CREATE A RECRUITING WEBSITE FOR THE CERTIFICATE PROGRAM. THIS CERTIFICATE WILL PROVIDE NEW CURRICULUM OPPORTUNITIES IN THE AGRICULTURE, FOOD, AND ENVIRONMENT (AFE) UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAM, ESPECIALLY FOR STUDENTS IN AGRIBUSINESS, FOOD SYSTEMS AND NUTRITIONAL SCIENCE, AND AGRICULTURE TRACTS, AS WELL AS PROVIDE NON-TRADITIONAL STUDENTS OPPORTUNITIES IN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.

THE OVERALL GOAL IS TO USE A COLLABORATIVE INTEGRATED APPROACH THAT FOCUSES MAINLY ON EDUCATION TO EXPAND AN UNDER-DEVELOPED, INFANT AQUAPONICS INDUSTRY IN OKLAHOMA. THIS COMPLEMENTS THE USDA'S STRATEGIC GOAL #1 (MAXIMIZE THE ABILITY OF AMERICAN AGRICULTURE PRODUCERS TO PROSPER BY FEEDING AND CLOTHING THE WORLD) IN THAT IT IS FOSTERING GROWTH IN THE OKLAHOMA AQUAPONICS INDUSTRY, ESPECIALLY EXPANSION OF SMALL FARMS, A VITAL AGRICULTURE SECTOR CURRENTLY IN DECLINE THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY AND IMPOVERISHED IN OKLAHOMA. IT ALSO COMPLEMENTS USDA STRATEGIC GOAL #3 (PROMOTE AMERICAN AGRICULTURE PRODUCTS AND EXPORTS) IN THAT OUR PROJECT WILL PROMOTE AQUAPONICS PRODUCTS AS HEALTHY CHOICES, #4 (FACILITATE RURAL PROSPERITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT) BY SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITIES THAT AQUAPONICS PROVIDES IN AN INCREASINGLY DRIER CLIMATE AND DEGRADED FOOD SYSTEM, AND #7 (PROVIDE ALL AMERICANS ACCESS TO A SAFE, NUTRITIOUS AND SECURE FOOD SUPPLY) IN THAT WE ARE PROMOTING AN INDUSTRY THAT WILL PROVIDE HEALTHY LOCAL FOOD TO A SEVERELY INSECURE FOOD SYSTEM IN OKLAHOMA (I.E. MOST FOOD IS IMPORTED, SUBJECT TO SHIPPING STRESS/DAMAGE, AND SUPPLY ISSUES (ESPECIALLY IN RURAL AREAS DURING BAD WEATHER).

OBESITY IS A SERIOUS HEALTH PROBLEM THAT LEADS TO CO-MORBIDITIES INCLUDING CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASES, HYPERTENSION, DIABETES, AND ADVERSELY AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH IN MANY PARTS OF THE WORLD, ESPECIALLY IN DEVELOPED COUNTRIES. OMEGA-3 FATTY ACIDS HAVE POTENTIAL HEALTH BENEFITS AND DO PLAY A ROLE IN FAT STORAGE AND REGULATE GENES INVOLVED IN METABOLISM. OMEGA-3 FATTY ACIDS ARE PREDOMINANTLY FOUND IN OIL-RICH MARINE SPECIES, PLANT SOURCE, AND ALGAE. PRELIMINARY STUDIES HAVE SHOWN, FOR THE FIRST TIME, THAT OMEGA-3 FATTY ACIDS, EICOSAPENTAENOIC AND DOCOSAHEXAENOIC ACIDS WERE PRESENT IN TROPICAL OIL SEED FROM RICINODENDRON HEUDELOTII ( NJANGSA )AND SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED BACK-FAT THICKNESS IN SWINE. THIS PROJECT WILL BE CONDUCTED TO REACH FIVE OBJECTIVES. 1) DETERMINE BIOCHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND FUNCTIONAL COMPOUNDS OF TRADITIONALLY SHELLED AND NUTCRACKER SHELLING METHODS OF NJANGSA KERNEL, 2) DETERMINE THE EFFICACY OF R. HEUDELOTII OIL SEED INCLUSION IN SWINE DIET TO ENRICH OMEGA-3 FATTY ACIDS CONTENT OF PORK AND MEAT QUALITY, 3) DETERMINE THE EFFECT OF R. HEUDELOTII OIL SEED ON PLASMA LIPIDS AND FAT CONTENT OF ORGANS AND TISSUES, 4) DETERMINE THE MOLECULAR MECHANISMS UNDERLYING LIPID METABOLISM AND EXPRESSION OF KEY GENES INVOLVED IN LIPID METABOLISM, AND 5) PROVIDE STUDENTS HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN LABORATORY INSTRUMENTATION, TISSUE ANALYSES AND GRADUATE EDUCATION. ELUCIDATING THE MECHANISM BY WHICH R. HEUDELOTII OIL SEED REDUCE ADIPOSITY IN SWINE MAY PROVIDE A MEANS OF REDUCING CHILDHOOD AND ADULT OBESITY.

POULTRY PROCESSING REQUIRES LARGE QUANTITIES (98 BILLION GALLONS/YEAR) OF FRESHWATER FOR SANITIZING THE EQUIPMENT AND CLEANING THE MEAT, RESULTING IN POULTRY PROCESSING WASTEWATER (PPW) CONTAMINATED WITH BIOSOLIDS SUCH AS BLOOD, LIPIDS, PROTEIN, AND FECES. THE CONTINUOUSLY INCREASING PRODUCTION OF POULTRY MEAT IN THE U.S., INFLICTS SEVERE STRAIN ON DEPLETING FRESHWATER RESOURCES AND BURDEN ON MUNICIPAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANTS (WWTP). MUNICIPAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANTS DON'T HAVE THE ABILITY TO REMOVE TRACE LEVELS OF EMERGING CONTAMINANTS SUCH AS PATHOGENS, E. COLI, AND COLIFORMS IN WASTEWATER. IN OUR RESEARCH, WE ADDRESS THE DUAL CHALLENGE OF SUSTAINABILITY AND FOOD SAFETY OF POULTRY PROCESSING WITH A NOVEL ZERO-WASTE APPROACH FOR TREATING PPW AND BIOSOLIDS SEPARATED FROM PROCESSING WATER. FIRSTLY, PPW IS TREATED WITH AN INNOVATIVE SEQUENTIAL ULTRAFILTRATION, FORWARD & REVERSE OSMOSIS SYSTEM. ULTRAFILTRATION IS A PRESSURE-DRIVEN MEMBRANE SEPARATION PROCESS TO REMOVE MACRO-/MICRO-PARTICLES FROM WATER, AND REVERSE OSMOSIS IS ANOTHER PRESSURE-DRIVEN MEMBRANE SEPARATION PROCESS TO REMOVE ULTRA FINE PARTICLES AND SALT FROM WATER. FORWARD OSMOSIS IS AN EMERGING TECHNOLOGY TO PURIFY WATER USING NATURALLY OSMOTIC PRESSURE. FORWARD OSMOSIS MEMBRANES WILL BE MODIFIED TO ENHANCE ITS ANTIFOULING PROPERTIES. HYDROPHILIC MAGNETIC NANOPARTICLES ARE USED AS DRAW SOLUTE IN FORWARD OSMOSIS. THE BIOSOLID WASTE SEPARATED FROM PPW PRETREATMENT UNDERGOES 2-STAGE SOLID STATE ANAEROBIC DIGESTION TO PRODUCE RENEWABLE ENERGY METHANE AND FERTILIZER AS BY-PRODUCT. THE CLEAN WATER PRODUCED FROM THE SEQUENTIAL MEMBRANE PROCESSES COULD BE PUT BACK TO THE POULTRY PROCESSING STAGE, AND THE RENEWABLE METHANE GENERATED FROM SS-AD CAN PARTIALLY COVER ENERGY REQUIREMENT OF THE MEMBRANE PROCESS. LIFE CYCLE ANALYSIS AND ECONOMIC ASSESSMENT METHODS ARE USED TO EVALUATE THE OVERALL AND BROADER IMPACTS OF THE ZERO-WASTE PPW TREATMENT ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND COSTS. THE RESEARCH GOAL OF ATTAINING ZERO-WASTE POULTRY PROCESSING ADDRESSES CRITICAL AREAS OF ECOLOGICAL/ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS SUCH AS: (1) DEPLETING FRESHWATER RESOURCES, (2) SPREAD OF FOODBORNE CONTAMINANTS VIA INEFFICIENTLY TREATED WASTEWATER, (3) RISING OPERATING COSTS OF POULTRY PROCESSING PLANTS AND (4) GROWING NUTRIENT POLLUTION IN WATERSHEDS.

QUINOA IS A HIGHLY NUTRITIOUS AND A POTENTIALLY IMPORTANT FOOD SECURITY CROP BECAUSE OF ITS ABILITY TO TOLERATE DROUGHT AND LOW SOIL FERTILITY. THE U.S. IS THE LARGEST CONSUMER AND IMPORTER OF QUINOA, WITH THE DOMESTIC DEMAND CHIEFLY MET THROUGH IMPORTS FROM SOUTH AMERICA. IN 2017, THE U. S. IMPORTED 78 MILLION POUNDS OF QUINOA AT A COST OF $85 MILLION. DOMESTIC PRODUCTION IS MOSTLY SMALL-SCALE AND CENTERED AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE NORTHWEST. TO EXPAND QUINOA PRODUCTION TO THE MIDWEST, IT WILL BE NECESSARY TO DEVELOP AND/OR IDENTIFY SUITABLE VARIETIES. THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO SELECT HIGH-YIELDING, DROUGHT-TOLERANT QUINOA CULTIVARS FOR THE MIDWEST. THE PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT ARE: TO (1) EVALUATE AND SELECT QUINOA LINES FOR HIGHER YIELD AND DROUGHT TOLERANCE, (2) DETERMINE THE IMPACT OF DROUGHT STRESS ON SEED COMPOSITION, (3) DISSEMINATE QUINOA PRODUCTION INFORMATION AND ENCOURAGE ADOPTION BY SMALL FARMERS AS A PROFITABLE CROP, (4) MEASURE THE ECONOMICS OF QUINOA PRODUCTION AND MARKETING, AND FINALLY, (5) TRAIN STUDENTS IN PLANT BREEDING AND CROP PRODUCTION. STARTING WITH ABOUT 100 QUINOA ACCESSIONS, WE HAVE SELECTED 10 BEST LINES AFTER MULTI-YEAR AND MULTI-LOCATION EVALUATIONS. THESE LINES WILL BE EVALUATED AT SIX MISSOURI LOCATIONS. PROMISING LINES WILL BE RELEASED AS CULTIVARS AND WILL BE USED IN FUTURE BREEDING WORK. HOPEFULLY, THE SMALL FARMERS WILL USE THESE CULTIVARS TO EXPAND PRODUCTION INTO MORE MARGINAL LANDS, AND INCREASE THEIR PROFITABILITY. EVENTUALLY, THIS WORK SHOULD LEAD TO REDUCED IMPORTS, IMPROVED FOOD SECURITY, AND CREATE A CADRE OF WELL-TRAINED AGRICULTURAL SCIENTISTS.

NUTRIENT LOSSES FROM DELMARVA AND MARYLAND'S EASTERN SHORE CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEGRADATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. THE SOILS OF THE EASTERN SHORE HAVE SEEN A LONG HISTORY OF POULTRY LITTER APPLICATIONS WELL ABOVE CROP REQUIREMENTS. SUSTAINABLE REDUCTIONS IN PHOSPHORUS (P) LOADS TO THE BAY REMAIN A CHALLENGE, AND CONTINUED EFFORT IS NEEDED. RECENTLY, GROWTH IN BROILER PRODUCTION HAS LED TO A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN THE POULTRY HOUSES CONSTRUCTED IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS. DUE TO JUSTIFIABLE CONCERNS OVER NUTRIENT LOSSES FROM THESE POINT SOURCES, MODERN POULTRY HOUSES MUST MEET CRITICAL SITE REQUIREMENTS AND HAVE APPROVED STORMWATER DRAINAGE PLANS. HOWEVER, MANY OLDER HOUSES AT THE TIME OF CONSTRUCTION DID NOT HAVE THESE REQUIREMENTS AND ARE STILL IN OPERATION TODAY. THEREFORE, THE STORMWATER DRAINAGE FROM THESE HOUSES DESERVE EVALUATION AND ANY MITIGATION ENCOURAGED. THEREFORE, WE PROPOSE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE UMES STORMWATER MANAGEMENT RESEARCH (SWMR) FACILITY TO IMPLEMENT, MONITOR,AND EVALUATE NUTRIENT-REDUCTION STRATEGIES TO REDUCE P LOSS NEAR POULTRY FACILITIES.WE WILL IDENTIFY THE COMMON DRAINAGE PATHWAYS AROUND POULTRY HOUSING TO TARGET NUTRIENT REDUCTION EFFORTS AND THUS INFORM THE P REDUCTION STRATEGIES TO BE EVALUATED AT THE SWMR FACILITY. THE SWMR WILL THEN SERVE AS A DEMONSTRATION FACILITY WHERE WORKSHOPS AND TRAININGS ARE OFFERED TO POULTRY PRODUCERS AND FARMING COMMUNITY AND SHOWCASE P LOSS STRATEGIES AROUND POULTRY HOUSING. IT WOULD ALSO SERVE UMES AS A "LIVING LABORATORY", OFFERING EXTENSIVE HANDS-ON LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND APPLIED RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES, ALONG WITH STRONG COLLABORATIONS WITH AGRICULTURE STAKEHOLDERS.FUNDING AND CONTINUED EFFORTS TO ENCOURAGE AND POTENTIALLY IMPLEMENT SELECTED STRATEGIESWILL BE SOUGHT.

RURAL COUNTIES IN THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI DELTA AVERAGE ONE SUPERMARKET PER 190.5 SQUARE MILES. ADDITIONALLY, 70 PERCENT OF THE LOW-INCOME POPULATIONS IN THIS REGION TRAVEL 30 OR MORE MILES TO BUY THE LOWER FOOD PRICES OFFERED BY A LARGE GROCERY STORE. THE REMAINING OPTIONS INCLUDE SMALL GROCERS OR CONVENIENCE STORES WHERE CONSUMERS ARE LIKELY TO PAY HIGHER PRICES FOR A LESS VARIETY OF LOW-QUALITY FOODS. FOOD DESERTS CONTRIBUTE TO STAGGERING RATES OF CHRONIC CONDITIONS LIKE OBESITY, HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE, DIABETES, AND DEPRESSION. FOOD INSECURE CHILDREN ARE 1.6 TIMES MORE LIKELY TO MISS DAYS OF SCHOOL, 1.95 TIMES MORE LIKELY TO BE SUSPENDED, AND 144 TIMES MORE LIKELY TO REPEAT A GRADE. IN ADDITION, CHRONIC ABSENTEEISM IS ONE OF THE STRONGEST PREDICTORS OF WHETHER A CHILD WILL DROP OUT OF SCHOOL. THEREFORE, THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO: (1) TO SET UP A TRAINING CENTER AT HINDS COMMUNITY COLLEGE, UTICA CAMPUS TO EDUCATE LIMITED-RESOURCE FARMERS ON SUSTAINABLE VEGETABLE PRODUCTION PRACTICES UTILIZING RESEARCH-BASED INFORMATION, (2) TO IDENTIFY DIFFERENT MARKET OUTLETS AS IT RELATES TO SALE OF VEGETABLE CROPS AND (3) TO EDUCATE LIMITED-RESOURCE FARMERS ON BENEFITS OF FARM FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT AND FARM RECORD KEEPING. SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THESE OBJECTIVES WILL INCREASE COMMUNITY FARM ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY OF FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES THAT HAVE KNOWN HEALTH BENEFITS SUCH AS FOOD SECURITY, IMPROVED NUTRITION AND BETTER HEALTH. IN ADDITION, SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THE OBJECTIVES WILL IMPROVE CONSUMER AWARENESS OF THE BENEFITS OF LOCAL AGRICULTURE AND SIMULTANEOUSLY LEAD TO INCREASED COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION.

SWEET POTATO IS SPECIFICALLY TARGETED BY RESEARCH ACTIVITIES AT 1890 LAND GRANT INSTITUTIONS, YET LARGE INTER-INSTITUTIONAL EFFORTS ARE RARE. THE PROPOSED CONSORTIUM BUILDS CONNECTIONS BETWEEN 1890S CURRENTLY WORKING ON SWEET POTATO AND INCORPORATES THE NEWEST 1890 FOR A UNIQUE INVESTIGATION OF THIS CROP IN NORTHERN CLIMATES. PARTNERS FROM FOUR INSTITUTIONS WILL JOIN SKILLS TO DELIVER RESULTS TO INDICATE POTENTIAL OF SWEET POTATO PRODUCTION IN OHIO. IN ADDITION, THE USDA-ARS PLANT GENETIC RESOURCES CONSERVATION UNIT MAINTAINS SEVERAL HUNDRED GENOTYPES AND WILL PROVIDE GENETIC RESOURCES. FIELD TRIALS WILL BE CONDUCTED AT CSU, WITH COMPLIMENTARY TRIALS AT OTHER LOCATIONS IN OHIO. ACCESSIONS WILL BE TESTED TARGETING GENOTYPES WITH POTENTIAL TOLERANCE OF COOL-WET CONDITIONS. THE RESILIENCE OF ACCESSIONS IN MIDWESTERN CLIMATE WITH RESPECT TO VIGOR, YIELD, AND DISEASE INCIDENCE WILL BE GAUGED THROUGH CLASSIC QUANTITATIVE CHARACTERIZATION AND NOVEL RAPID PHENOTYPING TECHNOLOGY. THROUGH USE OF GENETIC TOOLS, PROSPECTS FOR DEVELOPING NORTHERN VARIETIES WILL BE IDENTIFIED. INNOVATIVE POSTHARVEST TREATMENTS USING NATURAL FORMULATIONS WILL BE TESTED FOR IMPROVED STORAGE OF TUBERS. 1890 STUDENTS WILL BE ENGAGED ON THE TOPICS AND THE RESEARCH WILL SUPPORT EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES BY BEING INTEGRATED INTO EXISTING CURRICULA. RESULTS WILL BE TRANSFERRED BACK TO PARTNERS FOR DATABASE AND DECISION-MAKING PURPOSES. SCIENTIFIC AND LAY PUBLICATIONS WILL BE PRIORITIZED. KNOWLEDGE WILL BE TRANSFERRED VIA CSU'S EXTENSION ACTIVITIES TO COMMUNITY OPERATIONS THROUGHOUT THE REGION. SCIENTISTS WILL EXCHANGE BETWEEN INSTITUTIONS FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AND RESULTS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP TOPICS FOR CONTINUING COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS.

THE IMPORTANCE OF FOOD CONSUMPTION IN RELATION TO HUMAN HEALTH HAS INCREASED CONSUMER ATTENTION TOWARDS FOOD NUTRACEUTICAL-VALUE. MUSCADINE GRAPES ARE KNOWN TO POSSESS ENHANCED HEALTH-PROMOTING MOLECULES DUE TO THE SYNTHESIS AND HIGH ACCUMULATION OF UNIQUE PHYTOCHEMICALS CONTEXT THAT DISTINCT THEM FROM OTHER GRAPE SPECIES. THE CURRENT PROJECT FOCUSES ON FUNCTIONAL CHARACTERIZATION OF MUSCADINE METABOLOMIC COMPONENTS AND MOLECULAR MECHANISMS TRIGGERING ANTIOXIDANT CAPACITY AND BREAST ANTICANCER ACTIVITY. THROUGH ASSESSING THE EXTRACT CAPACITY OF 200 INDIVIDUAL MUSCADINE GENOTYPES, WE HAVE NOT ONLY DEMONSTRATED THEIR EFFECTIVE IMPACT IN SUPPRESSING BREAST CANCER VIABILITY, BUT ALSO THEIR SPECIFICITY IN TARGETING CAUCASIAN AND/OR THE MORE AGGRESSIVE AFRICAN AMERICAN BREAST CANCER CELLS. THE DESIGNATED RESEARCH STRATEGY WILL UTILIZE INTEGRATED CUTTING-EDGE METABOLOMIC, TRANSCRIPTOMIC, CYTOTOXIC THERAPY, AND COMPUTATIONAL BIOLOGY TOOLS TO IDENTIFY KEY MUSCADINE CONSTITUENTS AND GENE-NETWORK ASSOCIATED WITH BREAST ANTICANCER ACTIVITY. THE SUCCESS OF THIS RESEARCH WILL GENERATE SUBSTANTIAL FUNDAMENTAL AND APPLICABLE KNOWLEDGE THAT WILL NOT ONLY HELP US TO EXPLOIT THE MOLECULAR MECHANISMS UNDERLYING THE INHIBITION OF BREAST CANCER DEVELOPMENT, BUT WILL FURTHER HAVE VERY DIRECT INFLUENCES ON THE MARKETABILITY OF THE VITICULTURE ENTREPRENEURSHIP IN FLORIDA AND SE REGION. GENERATING INNOVATIVE MUSCADINE PRODUCES WITH SUPERIOR HEALTH PROPERTIES FOR THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE FLORIDA VITICULTURE INDUSTRY IS OF THE UTMOST IMPORTANCE TO HAVE CONSIDERABLY BETTER ECONOMIC VITALITY. SUCH INVESTMENT REQUIRES A GOOD UNDERSTANDING OF CONSUMER/GROWER PREFERENCES, EXPECTATIONS AND DETERMINATION OF THE MARKET CAPACITY. THEREFORE, THE PROJECT WILL CARRY OUT A COMPREHENSIVE SOCIOECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY STUDIES IN ORDER TO DETERMINE SUCCESSFUL MARKETING POTENTIAL.

THE PRESENCE OF CRYPTIC E. COLI, INCLUDING ENTERIC- AND ENVIRONMENTAL-LIVING MEMBERS, HAS POSED A SERIOUS CHALLENGE TO THE CURRENT E. COLI-BASED METHODS FOR WATER QUALITY MONITERING AND MANAGEMENT. TO TAKE STEPS TO OVERCOME THE LIMITATIONS OF THE CURRENT E. COLI-BASED METHODS, THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO OBTAIN BASELINE INFORMATION ABOUT CRYPTIC E. COLI. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE (1) TO DETERMINE THE DISTRIBUTION (ECOLOGICAL NICHE) AND PREVALENCE (FREQUENCY OF OCCURRENCE) OF CRYPTIC E. COLI IN THE UNITED STATES, AND (2) TO COMPARE THE FATE OF ENTERIC CRYPTIC E. COLI VERSUS. THAT OF REAL E. COLI IN AQUATIC ENVIRONMENTS. FOR THE STUDY UNDER OBJECTIVE 1, FECAL SAMPLES FROM THE MAJOR FECAL POLLUTION SOURCES (INCLUDING HUMANS, LIVESTOCK, AND WILD ANIMALS) AND WATER SAMPLES FROM DRAINAGE AREAS OF DIFFERENT DOMINANT LAND USES WILL BE OBTAINED FROM MISSOURI AND VIRGINIA. FOR THE STUDY UNDER OBJECTIVE 2, THE EFFECTS OF TEMPERATURE, PH, AND UV LIGHT ON THE FATES OF REAL E. COLI VERSUS ENTERIC CRYPTIC E. COLI WILL BE STUDIED IN AN AQUATIC MICROCOSM. THIS IS A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT OF LINCOLN UNIVERSITY, VIRGINIA STATE UNIVERSITY, AND A RESEARCH UNIT OF THE USDA-ARS IN COLUMBIA, MISSOURI. THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO COMBINE THE STRENGTH OF THE RESEARCH AND TEACHING ACTIVITIES OF TWO 1890 UNIVERSITIES WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE USDA-ARS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF BOTH SCHOOLS TO ADDRESS CRETICAL ISSUES IN FOOD, AGRICULTURAL, AND NATURAL RESOURCES, AND TO BENEFIT STUDENTS AT BOTH SCHOOLS BY PROVIDING HANDS-ON LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE THEIR JOB MARKET COMPETITIVENESS.

DUE TO PROXIMITY, PESTICIDE CONCENTRATIONS IN AMBIENT AIR ARE HIGHER IN AGRICULTURAL COMMUNITIES AND NEAR TREATED FIELDS. DURING THE PESTICIDE APPLICATION, THE DIRECTION DRIFT OF PESTICIDE IS CRITICAL TO ITS IMPACT ON NEARBY COMMUNITIES. SOME OF THE HEALTH PROBLEMS THAT AFFECT POPULATIONS LIVING IN THE URBAN-RURAL INTERFACE IS BELIEVED TO STEM FROM EXPOSURE TO PESTICIDE VAPORS THAT ARE PRESENT IN THE ATMOSPHERE FOLLOWING THE APPLICATION OF THE PRODUCT BY FARMERS. THE EXTENT OF THIS ON POPULATIONS LIVING IN THE URBAN-AGRICULTURAL INTERFACE IS NOT CLEAR, ALTHOUGH SOME RESIDENTS IN THE URBAN AGRICULTURAL INTERFACE HAVE ATTRIBUTED VARIOUS AILMENTS (ALLERGIES, CANCER, BIRTH DEFECTS, MALE STERILITY,CONTAMINATION OF BREAST MILK, GENETIC MUTATIONS, RESPIRATORY DISEASES, AND MANY MORE) TO PESTICIDEEXPOSURE.THERE IS A LIMITED RESEARCH DONE IN INTEGRATING CURRENT KNOWLEDGE ON WEATHER PREDICTION INTO PESTICIDE APPLICATION PRACTICES. THERE IS, THEREFORE, A NEED FOR DEVELOPING METHODS FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATING THE EXTENT OF PESTICIDE EXPOSURE ON THE URBAN-AGRICULTURAL INTERFACE AND THE EFFECT OF WEATHER PATTERNS ON PESTICIDE DRIFT. IN ADDITION, THERE IS A NEED TO RAISE THE AWARENESS OF RESIDENTS IN URBAN-AGRICULTURAL INTERFACES ABOUT THE POSSIBLE RISKS POSED BY SUCH TYPE OF POLLUTION.THE PROPOSED STUDY, THEREFORE, SEEKS TO EVALUATE PRESENT METHODS FOR MONITORING AND MODELING THE ATMOSPHERIC SPREAD OF PESTICIDE POLLUTANTS IN URBAN-AGRICULTURAL AREAS, IDENTIFY HOTSPOTS OF OCCURRENCE, AND ASSESS THE VULNERABILITY OF AFFECTED COMMUNITIES. IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE PROJECT WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DECISION-SUPPORT TOOL THAT WILL BE BENEFICIAL FOR COMMUNITIES LIVING IN URBAN-AGRICULTURAL INTERFACES.

STRAWBERRIES ARE PRODUCED AND CONSUMED WORLDWIDE. THE UNITED STATES IS THE SECOND LARGESTPRODUCER OF STRAWBERRIES. ONE OF THE BIGGEST CHALLENGES THAT STRAWBERRY GROWERS ARE FACING IS FRUITROT DISEASE OF GRAY MOLD CAUSED BY THE FUNGUS BOTRYTIS CENEREA. IF UNTREATED, IT CAN CONTRIBUTE UP TO AN 80% YIELD LOSS, REDUCED MARKETABLE YIELD AND SHELF LIFE. WE WILL UTILIZE THE ADVANCES IN SEQUENCING TECHNOLOGY AND AVAILABLE GERMPLASM RESOURCES TO IDENTIFY SINGLE NUCLEOTIDE POLYMORPHISMS (SNPS) AND GRAY MOLD RESISTANT LINES. WE WILL DEVELOP GENOME WIDE ASSOCIATION MAPS (GWAS) FOR GRAY MOLD RESISTANCE AND ITS RELATED TRAITS. THE ELITE STRAWBERRY LINES IDENTIFIED IN THIS STUDY WILL BE FURTHER UTILIZED IN THE BREEDING PROGRAMS OR WILL BE ADVANCED FOR MULTI-LOCATION TRAILS. THE EXTENSION SPECIALISTS INVOLVED IN THIS PROJECT WILL COMMUNICATE WITH THE SMALL AND UNDERSERVED FARMERS IN DELMARVA REGION ON GRAY MOLD MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND USE OF RIGHT GENOTYPES. THE POST-HARVEST SPECIALIST WILL BE EVALUATING THE ELITE LINES WITH A VOLATILE COMPOUND TO EXTEND SHELF LIFE OF FRUITS. MOST IMPORTANTLY, THIS PROJECT WILL TRAIN POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCH ASSOCIATES, GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS MOSTLY FROM UNDERREPRESENTED POPULATION WITH MODERN PLANT BREEDING TECHNIQUES AS WELL AS HELP BUILD SMALL FRUITS BREEDING PROGRAM AND RESEARCH CAPACITY AT DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY.

THE NUMBER OF U.S. FARMERS' MARKETS HAS STEADILY INCREASED OVER THE PAST TWENTY YEARS AND MORE THAN 8,500 OF THEM SELL FOODS WORTH 8.7B TO THE PUBLIC ANNUALLY. LONGITUDINAL ADMINISTRATIVE DATA FROM ALL U.S. STATES SHOWED A POSITIVE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE NUMBER OF FARMERS' MARKETS AND THE NUMBER OF REPORTED CASES OF FOODBORNE ILLNESS. THEREFORE, FOOD SAFETY IS OF GREAT CONCERN IN THESE UNIQUE RETAIL ENVIRONMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, FDA FOOD SAFETY MODERNIZATION ACT (FSMA) COMPLIANCE BY 2021 IS ON THE HORIZON FOR SMALL FARMERS.
